original: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /🔽lo ka pra dzny'a /
analyzed: @1b # // rgya gar skad du / lo ka pra dzny'a /
translated: In Sanskrit:🔽Lokaprajña

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'jig rten gzhag pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhag pa /
translated: The Arrangement of the World

original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /
translated: Part One

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed One, Śākyamuni.🔽Then, the thousand worlds, the oceans,

original: de nas / stong rnams dang ni rol mtsho dang // ngan song gsum dang gling dang shing //
analyzed: de nas / stong rnams dang ni rol mtsho dang // ngan song gsum dang gling dang shing //
translated: the three lower realms, the continents, and trees,🔽the pleasure groves, the garuḍas,

original: dga' tshal dang ni mkha' lding dang // rgyal chen grong dang 'dus pa rnams //
analyzed: dga' tshal dang ni mkha' lding dang // rgyal chen grong dang 'dus pa rnams //
translated: the cities of the great kings, and the assemblies.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time.

original: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs te /
translated: The Blessed One was dwelling in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the monks:

original: dge slong dag 'jig rten gyi khams ni gsum po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'jig rten gyi khams ni gsum po 'di dag yin te /
translated: Monks, there are these three worlds.

original: gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: stong chung du'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang / stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams so //
analyzed: stong chung du'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang / stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams so //
translated: the small chiliocosm, the dichiliocosm, the trichiliocosm.

original: stong chung du'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: stong chung du'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the small chiliocosm?🔽It is the totality of one thousand universes of the form of a wheel, with its mountains, oceans, continents, etc.

original: stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams na nyi ma rnam par snang ba rnams kun du 'khor zhing phyogs snang bar @2a * //🔽byed pa ci yod pa de nyid kyi yin te /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams na nyi ma rnam par snang ba rnams kun du 'khor zhing phyogs snang bar @2a * // byed pa ci yod pa de nyid kyi yin te /
translated: The sun and moon illuminate and warm this totality.

original: zla ba stong dang / nyi ma stong dang / ri'i rgyal po ri rab stong dang / shar gyi lus 'phags po stong dang // lho'i 'dzam bu'i gling stong dang // nub kyi ba lang spyod stong dang // byang gi sgra mi snyan stong dang //
analyzed: zla ba stong dang / nyi ma stong dang / ri'i rgyal po ri rab stong dang / shar gyi lus 'phags po stong dang // lho'i 'dzam bu'i gling stong dang // nub kyi ba lang spyod stong dang // byang gi sgra mi snyan stong dang //
translated: One thousand moons, one thousand suns, one thousand Sumerus which are the kings of mountains, one thousand Four-Continents with their Jambudvipa, one thousand good existences, one thousand hells form what, by adding the word sahasra, one thousand, is called a small chiliocosm.🔽One thousand small chiliocosms make a dichiliocosm.🔽One thousand dichiliocosms make a trichiliocosm.

original: rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha'i ris stong dang // sum cu rtsa gsum pa stong dang // 'thab bral ba stong dang / dga' ldan pa stong dang / 'phrul dga' ba stong dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa stong dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten stong ste /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha'i ris stong dang // sum cu rtsa gsum pa stong dang // 'thab bral ba stong dang / dga' ldan pa stong dang / 'phrul dga' ba stong dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa stong dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten stong ste /
translated: a thousand worlds of the Four Great Kings, a thousand worlds of the Thirty-three Gods, a thousand worlds of the Yāma Gods, a thousand worlds of the Joyous Gods, a thousand worlds of the Creative-enjoyment Gods, a thousand worlds of the Gods Who Control the Creations of Others, and a thousand worlds of Brahmā.

original: dge slong dag 'di ni stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ni stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya'o //
translated: Bhikṣus, this is called a chiliocosm.

original: stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is a dichiliochosm?

original: stong chung du'i 'jig rten gyi khams stong gang yin pa de ni stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong chung du'i 'jig rten gyi khams stong gang yin pa de ni stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya'o //
translated: A thousand trichiliocosms is called a dichiliochosm.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i khams gang zhe na /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i khams gang zhe na /
translated: What is a trichiliocosm?

original: dge slong dag stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams stong gang yin pa de ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya'o//
analyzed: dge slong dag stong gnyis pa bar ma'i 'jig rten gyi khams stong gang yin pa de ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya'o//
translated: Bhikṣus, a thousand dichiliochosms is called a trichiliocosm.

original: dge slong dag de lta bu'i stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams shar phyogs su mtha' med cing mu med la /🔽'jig pa'am / zhig par gnas shing /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bu'i stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams shar phyogs su mtha' med cing mu med la / 'jig pa'am / zhig par gnas shing /
translated: “Monks, such trichiliocosms in the east are limitless and endless.

original: chags pa'am chags par gnas te /🔽gzhan 'jig cing @2b gzhan zhig par gnas la /
analyzed: chags pa'am chags par gnas te / gzhan 'jig cing @2b gzhan zhig par gnas la /
translated: They may be destroyed or destroyed and then remain.🔽They may be formed or formed and then remain.🔽Some are destroyed while others are destroyed and then remain.

original: gzhan chags shing gzhan 'chags par gnas so //
analyzed: gzhan chags shing gzhan 'chags par gnas so //
translated: Some are formed while others are formed and then remain.

original: dge slong dag 'di lta bur stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams lho dang / nub dang / byang gi phyogs su mtha' med cing mu med la /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di lta bur stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams lho dang / nub dang / byang gi phyogs su mtha' med cing mu med la /
translated: “Monks, such trichiliocosms in the south, west, and north are limitless and endless.

original: 'jig pa'am / zhig par gnas shing /
analyzed: 'jig pa'am / zhig par gnas shing /
translated: They may be destroyed or destroyed and then remain.

original: chags pa 'am 'chags par gnas te /🔽gzhan 'jig cing gzhan zhig par gnas la /
analyzed: chags pa 'am 'chags par gnas te / gzhan 'jig cing gzhan zhig par gnas la /
translated: They may be formed or formed and then remain.🔽Some are destroyed while others are destroyed and then remain.

original: gzhan chags shing gzhan 'chags par gnas so //
analyzed: gzhan chags shing gzhan 'chags par gnas so //
translated: Some are formed while others are formed and then remain.

original: dge slong dag nam mkha' la char pa'i 'bru shing rta'i srog shing tsam 'bab ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag nam mkha' la char pa'i 'bru shing rta'i srog shing tsam 'bab ste /
translated: “Monks, rain falls from the sky in the form of grains the size of chariot axles.

original: chu'i rgyun rnams rab tu 'bab pa na bar chad med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: chu'i rgyun rnams rab tu 'bab pa na bar chad med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the flow of water is uninterrupted,🔽so it is, monks, with the eastern direction.

original: dge slong dag ngas lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas shar phyogs su de lta bu stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' med cing mu med pa /
analyzed: dge slong dag ngas lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi las 'das pas shar phyogs su de lta bu stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' med cing mu med pa /
translated: With my purified divine eye, which is beyond that of humans, I see the world as it is, without end or limit.

original: gzhan 'jig pa'am zhig par gnas shing /🔽chags pa'am 'chags par gnas la /
analyzed: gzhan 'jig pa'am zhig par gnas shing / chags pa'am 'chags par gnas la /
translated: Some worlds are in the process of destruction,🔽some are in the process of formation,

original: gzhan 'jig cing gzhan zhig par gnas la /
analyzed: gzhan 'jig cing gzhan zhig par gnas la /
translated: some are in the process of destruction,🔽some are in the process of formation.

original: gzhan chags shing gzhan 'chags par gnas pa dang / de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang phyogs su de snyed kyi stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams mtha' med cing mu med la 'jig pa'am /🔽zhig par gnas shing /🔽chags pa'am 'chags par gnas te /
analyzed: gzhan chags shing gzhan 'chags par gnas pa dang / de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang phyogs su de snyed kyi stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams mtha' med cing mu med la 'jig pa'am / zhig par gnas shing / chags pa'am 'chags par gnas te /
translated: Similarly, in the southern, western, and northern directions, I see worlds without end or limit, some in the process of destruction,🔽some in the process of formation,🔽some in the process of destruction,

original: gzhan 'jig cing gzhan zhig par gnas la /
analyzed: gzhan 'jig cing gzhan zhig par gnas la /
translated: some in the process of formation.

original: gzhan 'chags shing gzhan chags par gnas pa dag kyang mthong ngo zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: gzhan 'chags shing gzhan chags par gnas pa dag kyang mthong ngo zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: I also see others who are in the process of being created and others that have been created.

original: bcom ldan 'das nang du yang dag 'jog pa'i phyir gnas khang du gshegs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nang du yang dag 'jog pa'i phyir gnas khang du gshegs so //
translated: ” Then the Blessed One entered his living quarters to go into solitary retreat.

original: de'i tshe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe na /
translated: At that time,

original: tshe dang ldan pa mood gal ya na chen po 'khor de nyid kyi nang du 'dus par gyur te 'dug go //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa mood gal ya na chen po 'khor de nyid kyi nang du 'dus par gyur te 'dug go //
translated: the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana was present in the assembly.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa mood gal ya na chen pos dge slong rnams la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa mood gal ya na chen pos dge slong rnams la smras pa /
translated: Then the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana said to the monks,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag ji tsam du bcom ldan 'das kyis legs par bstan pa dang / 'di ltar shing rta'i srog shing gi dpes bstan pa la ni legs te ngo mtshar to //🔽de la stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na ri chen po nyis stong yod de /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag ji tsam du bcom ldan 'das kyis legs par bstan pa dang / 'di ltar shing rta'i srog shing gi dpes bstan pa la ni legs te ngo mtshar to // de la stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na ri chen po nyis stong yod de /
translated: “Venerable friends, it is wonderful that the Blessed One has taught so well and with such an analogy of a chariot’s axle.🔽In this trichiliocosm there are two thousand great mountains,

original: ri'i rgyal po ri rab stong dang / khor yug gi ri stong rnams so //
analyzed: ri'i rgyal po ri rab stong dang / khor yug gi ri stong rnams so //
translated: a thousand of them being the kings of mountains, Mount Sumeru, and a thousand of them being the surrounding mountains.”

original: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na rgya mtsho chen po nyis stong yod de /🔽nang gi rgya mtsho chen po stong dang / @3a * //
analyzed: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na rgya mtsho chen po nyis stong yod de / nang gi rgya mtsho chen po stong dang / @3a * //
translated: In the universe with four great continents, there are two thousand great oceans.🔽There are one thousand inner great oceans

original: phyi rol gyi rgya mtsho chen po stong rnams so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rgya mtsho chen po stong rnams so //
translated: and one thousand outer great oceans.

original: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na ri sum stong yod de /
analyzed: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na ri sum stong yod de /
translated: In the universe with four great continents, there are three thousand mountains.

original: sems can dmyal ba stong dang / dud 'gro stong dang / yi dvags stong rnams so //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba stong dang / dud 'gro stong dang / yi dvags stong rnams so //
translated: There are one thousand hells, one thousand animal realms, and one thousand ghost realms.

original: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na gling chen po bzhi stong yod de /
analyzed: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na gling chen po bzhi stong yod de /
translated: In the universe with four great continents, there are four thousand great continents.

original: shar gyi lus 'phags po stong dang / lho'i 'dzam bu gling stong dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod stong dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan stong rnams so //
analyzed: shar gyi lus 'phags po stong dang / lho'i 'dzam bu gling stong dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod stong dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan stong rnams so //
translated: There are one thousand of the eastern Videha, one thousand of the southern Jambudvīpa, one thousand of the western Godānīya, and one thousand of the northern Kuru.

original: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na shing chen po bzhi stong yod de /
analyzed: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na shing chen po bzhi stong yod de /
translated: In the universe with four great continents, there are four thousand great trees.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling pa'i shing rgya mtsho'i 'gram gyi shal ma li chen po stong dang / lha ma yin gyi ris kyi tsi tra pa ta li stong dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i sa brtol stong rnams so //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling pa'i shing rgya mtsho'i 'gram gyi shal ma li chen po stong dang / lha ma yin gyi ris kyi tsi tra pa ta li stong dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i sa brtol stong rnams so //
translated: 1000 great śālmali trees on the shores of the ocean in Jambudvīpa, 1000 citrapatali trees in the realm of the demigods, and 1000 trees in the realm of the Thirty-three.

original: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na klu'i rigs bzhi stong yod de /
analyzed: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na klu'i rigs bzhi stong yod de /
translated: In the trichiliocosm there are 1000 types of nāgas.

original: rigs sgo nga las skye ba stong dang / mngal nas skye ba stong dang / drod gsher las skye ba stong dang / rdzus te skye ba stong rnams so //
analyzed: rigs sgo nga las skye ba stong dang / mngal nas skye ba stong dang / drod gsher las skye ba stong dang / rdzus te skye ba stong rnams so //
translated: There are 1000 types of nāgas born from eggs, 1000 types born from wombs, 1000 types born from heat and moisture, and 1000 types of spontaneously born nāgas.

original: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na nam mkha' lding gi rigs bzhi stong yod de /
analyzed: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na nam mkha' lding gi rigs bzhi stong yod de /
translated: In the trichiliocosm there are 1000 types of garuḍas.

original: nam mkha' lding gi rigs sgo nga las skye ba stong dang / mngal nas skye ba stong dang / drod gsher las skye ba stong dang / rdzus te skye ba stong rnams so //
analyzed: nam mkha' lding gi rigs sgo nga las skye ba stong dang / mngal nas skye ba stong dang / drod gsher las skye ba stong dang / rdzus te skye ba stong rnams so //
translated: There are 1000 types of garuḍas born from eggs, 1000 types born from wombs, 1000 types born from heat and moisture, and 1000 types of spontaneously born garuḍas.

original: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na rgyal po chen po bzhi stong yod de /
analyzed: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na rgyal po chen po bzhi stong yod de /
translated: In the universe of a chiliocosm, there are one thousand of the four great kings.

original: yul 'khor srung stong dang / 'phags skyes po stong dang / mig mi bzang stong dang / rnam thos kyi bu stong rnams so //
analyzed: yul 'khor srung stong dang / 'phags skyes po stong dang / mig mi bzang stong dang / rnam thos kyi bu stong rnams so //
translated: There are one thousand of Dhṛtarāṣṭra, one thousand of Virūḍhaka, one thousand of Virūpākṣa, and one thousand of Vaiśravaṇa.

original: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na 'gro ba lnga stong yod de /
analyzed: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na 'gro ba lnga stong yod de /
translated: In the universe of a chiliocosm, there are five thousand realms of living beings.

original: sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba stong dang / dud 'gro dang ; yi dags dang / lha dang mi'i 'gro ba stong rnams so //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba stong dang / dud 'gro dang ; yi dags dang / lha dang mi'i 'gro ba stong rnams so //
translated: There are one thousand realms of hell beings, one thousand of animals, one thousand of ghosts, one thousand of gods, and one thousand of humans.

original: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na 'dun sa chen po nyis stong yod de /
analyzed: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na 'dun sa chen po nyis stong yod de /
translated: In the universe of a chiliocosm, there are two thousand great assemblies.

original: lha'i 'dun sa chos bzangs stong dang / lha ma yin gyi 'dun sa nor bzangs zhes bya ba stong rnams so //
analyzed: lha'i 'dun sa chos bzangs stong dang / lha ma yin gyi 'dun sa nor bzangs zhes bya ba stong rnams so //
translated: There are one thousand assemblies of the gods in Sudharmā, and one thousand assemblies of the demigods in Sudharmā.

original: 'jig rten gzhag pa las tshigs dang po'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhag pa las tshigs dang po'o //
translated: This is the first chapter, on the arrangement of the world, from The Treatise on the Treasury of Abhidharma.🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las / skye gnas ri dang rol mtsho dang // de bzhin sems can dmyal brgyad gzhan //
analyzed: mdo las / skye gnas ri dang rol mtsho dang // de bzhin sems can dmyal brgyad gzhan //
translated: There are mountains and pleasure groves, and likewise eight other hells,

original: sems can gnas dgu rab bshad de //
analyzed: sems can gnas dgu rab bshad de //
translated: The nine abodes of sentient beings are explained.

original: las lam bcu po de bzhin no //
analyzed: las lam bcu po de bzhin no //
translated: The ten karmic paths are also like that.

original: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na 'dod pa'i skye gnas gsum yod de /
analyzed: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na 'dod pa'i skye gnas gsum yod de /
translated: In the trichiliocosm, there are three desire realms.

original: gsum gang @3b gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang @3b gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: sems can 'dod pa nye bar gnas pa dag yod de /
analyzed: sems can 'dod pa nye bar gnas pa dag yod de /
translated: There are sentient beings who abide in desire.

original: gang dag 'dod pa nye bar gnas pa rnams la dbang phyug gis dbang byed pa dag ste /
analyzed: gang dag 'dod pa nye bar gnas pa rnams la dbang phyug gis dbang byed pa dag ste /
translated: They are those who exercise sovereignty over those who abide in desire.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: mi kha cig dang / lha rnams so //
analyzed: mi kha cig dang / lha rnams so //
translated: some humans and gods.

original: 'di ni 'dod pa'i skye gnas dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa'i skye gnas dang po'o //
translated: This is the first desire realm.

original: sems can 'dod pas sprul pa dag yod de /
analyzed: sems can 'dod pas sprul pa dag yod de /
translated: There are sentient beings who emanate desire.

original: gang dag 'dod pas sprul pa dag la dbang phyug gis dbang byed pa dag ste /
analyzed: gang dag 'dod pas sprul pa dag la dbang phyug gis dbang byed pa dag ste /
translated: They are those who exercise sovereignty over those who emanate desire.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: 'phrul dga'i lha rnams so //
analyzed: 'phrul dga'i lha rnams so //
translated: the gods of Nirmāṇarati.

original: 'di ni 'dod pa'i skye gnas gnyis pa'o //🔽sems can 'dod pa'i sprul pa gzhan dag yod de //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa'i skye gnas gnyis pa'o // sems can 'dod pa'i sprul pa gzhan dag yod de //
translated: This is the second desire realm.🔽There are other sentient beings who emanate desire.

original: gang dag 'dod pa gzhan gyis sprul pa rnams la dbang phyug gis dbang byed pa dag ste /
analyzed: gang dag 'dod pa gzhan gyis sprul pa rnams la dbang phyug gis dbang byed pa dag ste /
translated: They are those who exercise sovereignty over those who emanate desire.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams so //
translated: the Paranirmitavasavartin gods.

original: 'di ni 'dod pa'i skye gnas gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa'i skye gnas gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third place of birth in the desire realm.

original: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na bde ba'i skye gnas gsum yod de /
analyzed: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na bde ba'i skye gnas gsum yod de /
translated: In the universe with a billion worlds, there are three places of birth in the form realm.🔽There are sentient beings who, in this very body, are moistened, fully moistened,

original: sems can gang dag lus 'di nyid la dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba las brlan par byed cing yongs su brlan par byed de /
analyzed: sems can gang dag lus 'di nyid la dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba las brlan par byed cing yongs su brlan par byed de /

analyzed: yongs su tshim par byed cing yongs su khyab par byed pa dag yod do //

analyzed: de dag lus 'di nyid la dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde bas brlan par byas shing yongs su brlan par byas te / yongs su tshim par byas shing yongs su khyab par byas nas bde bar reg pa la gnas so //
translated: satisfied, and pervaded this very body with the joy and pleasure born of seclusion, they abide in blissful contact.

analyzed: de dag bde ba de dang / bde ba la gnas pa des tshe ring zhing yun ring por gnas te /
translated: By that bliss and abiding in bliss, they live long and endure for a long time.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams so //

original: 'di ni bde ba'i skye gnas dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bde ba'i skye gnas dang po'o //
translated: This is the first abode of beings.🔽There are beings who moisten, drench,

translated: pervade, and fill this very body with the joy and bliss born of concentration.🔽Having moistened, drenched,

original: yongs su tshim par byas shing yongs su khyab par byas nas bde bar reg pa la gnas so //
analyzed: yongs su tshim par byas shing yongs su khyab par byas nas bde bar reg pa la gnas so //

original: de dag bde ba de dang bde ba la gnas pa des tshe ring zhing yun ring por gnas te /
analyzed: de dag bde ba de dang bde ba la gnas pa des tshe ring zhing yun ring por gnas te /
translated: Through that bliss and abiding in bliss, they live long and endure for a long time.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

analyzed: 'od gsal gyi lha rnams so //

original: 'di ni bde ba'i skye gnas gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bde ba'i skye gnas gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second abode of beings.

original: sems can @4a * //
analyzed: sems can @4a * //
translated: There are beings who,

original: gang dag lus 'di nyid la dga' ba med pa'i bde bas brlan par byed pa dang / yongs su brlan par byed de /
analyzed: gang dag lus 'di nyid la dga' ba med pa'i bde bas brlan par byed pa dang / yongs su brlan par byed de /
translated: They are those who moisten and fully moisten this body with the bliss of not delighting in this body.

original: yongs su tshim par byed cing yongs su khyab par byed pa dag yod do //
analyzed: yongs su tshim par byed cing yongs su khyab par byed pa dag yod do //
translated: There are those who moisten, fully moisten,

original: de dag lus 'di nyid la dga' ba med pa'i bde bas brlan par byas shing yongs su brlan par byas te /
analyzed: de dag lus 'di nyid la dga' ba med pa'i bde bas brlan par byas shing yongs su brlan par byas te /
translated: satisfy, and fully satisfy this very body with the bliss of non-desire.

analyzed: yongs su tshim par byas shing yongs su khyab par byas nas bde bar reg pa la gnas so //
translated: Having moistened, fully moistened,🔽satisfied, and fully satisfied this very body with the bliss of non-desire, they abide in blissful touch.

original: de dag bde ba de dang bde ba la gnas pa des tshe ring zhing yun ring du gnas te 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag bde ba de dang bde ba la gnas pa des tshe ring zhing yun ring du gnas te 'di lta ste /
translated: By that bliss and abiding in bliss, they live long and endure for a long time, just as

original: dge rgyas kyi lha rnams so //
analyzed: dge rgyas kyi lha rnams so //
translated: the gods of the Vast Goodness heaven.

original: 'di ni bde ba'i skye gnas gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bde ba'i skye gnas gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third abode of bliss.

analyzed: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na gser gyi ri chen po bdun stong yod de /
translated: In the trichiliocosm, there are seven thousand great golden mountains.

original: ri'i rgyal po gnya' shing 'dzin stong dang / gshol mda' 'dzin stong dang / seng ldeng can stong dang / blta na sdug stong dang / rta rna ri stong dang / mu khyud 'dzin stong dang / ri'i rgyal po rnam par 'dud stong rnams so //
analyzed: ri'i rgyal po gnya' shing 'dzin stong dang / gshol mda' 'dzin stong dang / seng ldeng can stong dang / blta na sdug stong dang / rta rna ri stong dang / mu khyud 'dzin stong dang / ri'i rgyal po rnam par 'dud stong rnams so //
translated: There are a thousand of each of the following: Yugandhara, Īṣādhara, Khadiraka, Sudarśana, Aśvakarṇa, Vinataka, and Mount Sumeru.

original: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na rol mtsho chen po bdun stong yod de /
analyzed: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na rol mtsho chen po bdun stong yod de /
translated: In the trichiliocosm there are seven thousand great oceans.

original: gnya' shing 'dzin gyi rol mtsho stong dang / gshol mda' 'dzin gyi stong dang / seng ldeng can gyi stong dang / blta na sdug gi stong dang / rta rna ri'i stong dang / mu khyud 'dzin gyi stong dang / rnam par 'dud kyi rol mtsho stong rnams so //
analyzed: gnya' shing 'dzin gyi rol mtsho stong dang / gshol mda' 'dzin gyi stong dang / seng ldeng can gyi stong dang / blta na sdug gi stong dang / rta rna ri'i stong dang / mu khyud 'dzin gyi stong dang / rnam par 'dud kyi rol mtsho stong rnams so //
translated: There are a thousand of each of the following: Yugandhara Ocean, Īṣādhara Ocean, Khadiraka Ocean, Sudarśana Ocean, Aśvakarṇa Ocean, Vinataka Ocean, and the Ocean of Sumeru.

original: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can dmyal ba chen po brgyad stong yod de /
analyzed: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can dmyal ba chen po brgyad stong yod de /
translated: In the trichiliocosm there are eight thousand great hells.

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po yang sos stong dang / thig nag stong dang / bsdus gzhom stong dang / ngu 'bod stong dang / ngu 'bod chen po stong dang / tsha ba stong dang / rab tu tsha ba stong dang ; sems can dmyal ba mnar med pa stong rnams so //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po yang sos stong dang / thig nag stong dang / bsdus gzhom stong dang / ngu 'bod stong dang / ngu 'bod chen po stong dang / tsha ba stong dang / rab tu tsha ba stong dang ; sems can dmyal ba mnar med pa stong rnams so //
translated: There are one thousand of the great hells: Saṃjīva, Kālasūtra, Saṃghāta, Raurava, Mahāraurava, Tapana, Pratāpana, and Avīci.

original: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can gyi gnas dgu stong yod do //
analyzed: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can gyi gnas dgu stong yod do //
translated: In the universe with a thousand worlds, there are one thousand of each of the nine abodes of beings.

original: sems can gzugs yod pa lus tha dad cing 'du shes tha dad pa dag yod de /
analyzed: sems can gzugs yod pa lus tha dad cing 'du shes tha dad pa dag yod de /
translated: There are beings who have form, whose bodies are different and whose ideations are different.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: mi rnams dang / lha kha cig go //
analyzed: mi rnams dang / lha kha cig go //
translated: humans and some gods.

original: 'di ni sems can gyi gnas dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can gyi gnas dang po'o //
translated: This is the first abode of beings.

original: sems can gzugs yod pa lus tha dad cing 'du shes gcig pa dag yod de /
analyzed: sems can gzugs yod pa lus tha dad cing 'du shes gcig pa dag yod de /
translated: There are beings who have form, whose bodies are different and whose ideations are the same.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: tshangs ris kyi lha dang po byung ba gang yin pa de dag go //
analyzed: tshangs ris kyi lha dang po byung ba gang yin pa de dag go //
translated: the gods born in the assembly of Brahmā.

original: 'di ni sems can gyi gnas gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can gyi gnas gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second abode of beings.

original: sems can gzugs yod pa lus gcig la 'du shes tha dad pa @4b dag yod de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems can gzugs yod pa lus gcig la 'du shes tha dad pa @4b dag yod de / 'di lta ste /
translated: There are sentient beings who have form, who have one body and one perception.

original: 'od gsal gyi lha rnams so //
analyzed: 'od gsal gyi lha rnams so //
translated: They are the gods of the Ābhāsvara realm.

original: 'di ni sems can gyi gnas gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can gyi gnas gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third abode of sentient beings.

original: sems can gzugs yod pa lus gcig cing 'du shes gcig pa dag yod de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems can gzugs yod pa lus gcig cing 'du shes gcig pa dag yod de / 'di lta ste /
translated: There are sentient beings who have form, who have one body and one perception.

original: dge rgyas kyi lha rnams so //
analyzed: dge rgyas kyi lha rnams so //
translated: They are the gods of the Śubhakṛtsna realm.

original: 'di ni sems can gyi gnas bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can gyi gnas bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth abode of sentient beings.

original: sems can gzugs yod pa 'du shes med cing 'du shes dang bral ba dag yod de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems can gzugs yod pa 'du shes med cing 'du shes dang bral ba dag yod de / 'di lta ste /
translated: There are sentient beings who have form, who are without perception and do not possess perception.

original: 'du shes med pa'i lha rnams so //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i lha rnams so //
translated: They are the gods who are without perception.

original: 'di ni sems can gyi gnas lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can gyi gnas lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth abode of sentient beings.

original: sems can gzugs med pa rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: sems can gzugs med pa rnam pa thams cad du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnams las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: There are sentient beings who are formless, who have transcended all perceptions of form.

original: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cig sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa dag yod de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: thogs pa'i 'du shes rnams nub par gyur cig sna tshogs kyi 'du shes rnams yid la mi byed pas nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa dag yod de / 'di lta ste /
translated: They think, “Space is infinite,” and they perfect and abide in the sphere of infinite space.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du skyes pa'i lha rnams so //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched du skyes pa'i lha rnams so //
translated: They are the gods who have been born in the sphere of infinite space.

original: 'di ni sems can gyi gnas drug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can gyi gnas drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixth realm of sentient beings.

original: sems can gzugs med pa rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: sems can gzugs med pa rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: “There are sentient beings who have completely transcended the sphere of infinite space.

original: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa dag yod de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa dag yod de / 'di lta ste /
translated: They think, “Consciousness is infinite,” and they perfect and abide in the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched du skyes pa'i lha rnams so //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched du skyes pa'i lha rnams so //
translated: They are the gods who have been born in the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: 'di ni sems can gyi gnas bdun pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can gyi gnas bdun pa'o //
translated: This is the seventh realm of sentient beings.

original: sems can gzugs med pa gang dag rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: sems can gzugs med pa gang dag rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: There are sentient beings who, in every way, transcend the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: ci yang med do snyam nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa dag yod de /
analyzed: ci yang med do snyam nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa dag yod de /
translated: Thinking, “There is nothing at all,” they perfect and abide in the sphere of nothing whatsoever.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched du skyes pa'i lha rnams so //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched du skyes pa'i lha rnams so //
translated: the gods who have taken rebirth in the sphere of nothing whatsoever.

original: 'di ni sems can gyi gnas brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can gyi gnas brgyad pa'o //
translated: This is the eighth realm of sentient beings.🔽There are sentient beings who, in every way, transcend the sphere of nothing whatsoever.

original: sems can gzugs med pa rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa dag yod de /
analyzed: sems can gzugs med pa rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched rdzogs par byas te gnas pa dag yod de /
translated: They perfect and abide in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du skyes pa'i lha rnams so //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du skyes pa'i lha rnams so //
translated: the gods who have taken rebirth in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: 'di ni sems can gyi gnas dgu pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sems can gyi gnas dgu pa'o //
translated: This is the ninth realm of sentient beings.

original: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na /🔽mi dge ba bcu'i las @5a * //
analyzed: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na / mi dge ba bcu'i las @5a * //
translated: In the world systems of a billion-world universe,

original: kyi lam dag yod de /
analyzed: kyi lam dag yod de /
translated: there are the ten unwholesome courses of action.

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig 'khyal pa dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang /
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig 'khyal pa dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang /
translated: Taking life, taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, false speech, slander, harsh speech, frivolous speech, covetousness, malice,

original: log par lta ba rnams so //🔽srog gcod pa shas cher kun du bsten cing bsgoms te /
analyzed: log par lta ba rnams so // srog gcod pa shas cher kun du bsten cing bsgoms te /
translated: and wrong views.

original: lan mang du byas pas sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med par skye bar 'gyur ro //🔽de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni tsha bar ro //🔽de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni du 'bod chen por ro //
analyzed: lan mang du byas pas sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med par skye bar 'gyur ro // de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni tsha bar ro // de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni du 'bod chen por ro //
translated: By frequently, repeatedly, and continuously committing acts of killing, one is reborn in the great hell of Avīci.🔽By committing acts of killing that are of lesser strength and weight than those, one is reborn in the Saṃjīva hell.🔽By committing acts of killing that are of lesser strength and weight than those, one is reborn in the great Saṃghāta hell.

original: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni du 'bod du'o //
analyzed: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni du 'bod du'o //
translated: By committing acts of killing that are of lesser strength and weight than those, one is reborn in the great Raurava hell.

original: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas chas yang bas ni bsdus gzhom du'o //
analyzed: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas chas yang bas ni bsdus gzhom du'o //
translated: By committing acts of killing that are of lesser strength and weight than those, one is reborn in the Saṃghata hell.🔽By committing acts of killing that are of lesser strength and weight than those, one is reborn in the Mahāraurava hell.

original: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni thig nag tu'o //
analyzed: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni thig nag tu'o //
translated: and even less than that, and even lighter than that, in the Saṃjīva hell.

original: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni sems can dmyal ba chen po yang sos su skye bar 'gyur ro //🔽ma byin par len pa shas cher kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te /
analyzed: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni sems can dmyal ba chen po yang sos su skye bar 'gyur ro // ma byin par len pa shas cher kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te /
translated: and even less than that, and even lighter than that, in the Mahājvāla hell.

original: lan mang du byas pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig 'khyal pa dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba shas cher kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te /
analyzed: lan mang du byas pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig 'khyal pa dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba shas cher kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te /
translated: Through the frequent practice of stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, slander, harsh speech, idle talk, covetousness, ill will, and wrong views,

original: lan mang du byas pas ni sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan mang du byas pas ni sems can dmyal ba chen po mnar med par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one is born in the Avīci hell.

original: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni rab tu tsha bar ro //
analyzed: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni rab tu tsha bar ro //
translated: and even less than that, and even lighter than that, in the Pratapana hell.

original: de bas shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni tsha bar ro //
analyzed: de bas shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni tsha bar ro //
translated: The hells of Saṃjīva, Kālasūtra, Saṃghāta, Raurava, Mahāraurava, Tapana, Pratāpana, Avīci, and so on, are the ten great hells.🔽The cold hells are Arbuda, Nirarbuda, Aṭaṭa, Hahava, Huhuva, Utpala, Padma, and Mahāpadma.🔽The occasional hells are of various places.🔽The hells of the pretas are in the great ocean and so on.

original: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni du 'bod chen por ro //
analyzed: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni du 'bod chen por ro //
translated: The hells of animals are in the great ocean and so on.🔽The hells of humans are in Jambudvīpa and so on.🔽The hells of the gods are in the celestial realms and so on.

original: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni du 'bod du'o //
analyzed: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni du 'bod du'o //
translated: The hells of the asuras are in the asura realms and so on.🔽The hells of the hell beings are in the hells of the great hell realms.🔽The hells of the hungry ghosts are in the great ocean and so on.🔽The hells of animals are in the great ocean and so on.🔽The hells of humans are in Jambudvīpa and so on.🔽The hells of the gods are in the celestial realms and so on.🔽The hells of the asuras are in the asura realms and so on.

original: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni bsdus gzhom du'o //🔽de / bas ches shes chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni thig nag tu'o //
analyzed: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni bsdus gzhom du'o // de / bas ches shes chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni thig nag tu'o //
translated: The hells of the hell beings are in the hells of the great hell realms.🔽The hells of the hungry ghosts are in the great ocean and so on.🔽The hells of animals are in the great ocean and so on.🔽The hells of humans are in Jambudvīpa and so on.🔽The hells of the gods are in the celestial realms and so on.🔽The hells of the asuras are in the asura realms and so on.🔽The hells of the hell beings are in the hells of the great hell realms.🔽The hells of the hungry ghosts are in the great ocean and so on.🔽The hells of animals are in the great ocean and so on.

original: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni sems can dmyal ba chen po yang sos su skye bar 'gyur ro //🔽'jig rten gzhag pa las tshigs gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni sems can dmyal ba chen po yang sos su skye bar 'gyur ro // 'jig rten gzhag pa las tshigs gnyis pa'o //
translated: The hells of humans are in Jambudvīpa and so on.🔽The hells of the gods are in the celestial realms and so on.

original: mdo la / mkha' lding las @5b lam bcu po dang // myong ba dang ni bkres dang zas //
analyzed: mdo la / mkha' lding las @5b lam bcu po dang // myong ba dang ni bkres dang zas //
translated: The hells of the asuras are in the asura realms and so on.

original: bdud rtsi phyis char pa dang // mu ge bde dang bcu tshan no //
analyzed: bdud rtsi phyis char pa dang // mu ge bde dang bcu tshan no //
translated: The hells of the hell beings are in the hells of the great hell realms.🔽The hells

original: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na klu'i rigs bzhi stong rgya mtsho chen po na gnas so //
analyzed: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na klu'i rigs bzhi stong rgya mtsho chen po na gnas so //
translated: In the universe with its four great continents, there are four thousand families of nagas who live in the great ocean.

original: nam mkha' lding gi rigs bzhi stong shing shal ma li mthon po la gnas te /
analyzed: nam mkha' lding gi rigs bzhi stong shing shal ma li mthon po la gnas te /
translated: There are four thousand families of garudas who live in the tall sala trees.

original: sgo nga las skye ba stong dang / mngal nas skye ba stong dang / drod gsher las skye ba stong dang / rdzus te skye ba stong rnams so //
analyzed: sgo nga las skye ba stong dang / mngal nas skye ba stong dang / drod gsher las skye ba stong dang / rdzus te skye ba stong rnams so //
translated: There are one thousand born from eggs, one thousand born from wombs, one thousand born from heat and moisture, and one thousand born spontaneously.

original: nam mkha' lding sgo nga las skye ba ni bza' ba'i phyir klu sgo nga las skye ba 'byin par byed de /
analyzed: nam mkha' lding sgo nga las skye ba ni bza' ba'i phyir klu sgo nga las skye ba 'byin par byed de /
translated: The garudas born from eggs eat the nagas born from eggs.

original: mngal nas skye ba ma yin /
analyzed: mngal nas skye ba ma yin /
translated: They do not eat those born from wombs,

original: drod gsher las skye ba ma yin /
analyzed: drod gsher las skye ba ma yin /
translated: those born from heat and moisture,

original: rdzus te skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzus te skye ba ma yin no //
translated: or those born spontaneously.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: ci ste de len na /
analyzed: ci ste de len na /
translated: If they eat them,

original: de nyid thal ba bzhin du byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid thal ba bzhin du byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: they will be reduced to ashes.

original: nam mkha' lding mngal nas skyes pa ni bza' ba'i phyir klu sgo nga las skye ba dang / mngal nas skye ba 'byin par byed de /
analyzed: nam mkha' lding mngal nas skyes pa ni bza' ba'i phyir klu sgo nga las skye ba dang / mngal nas skye ba 'byin par byed de /
translated: The garuḍa born from a womb produces nāgas born from eggs and from wombs in order to eat them,

original: drod gsher las skye ba ma yin //
analyzed: drod gsher las skye ba ma yin //
translated: but not born from heat and moisture.

original: rdzus te skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzus te skye ba ma yin no //
translated: It does not produce supernaturally born nāgas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ci ste de len na /
analyzed: ci ste de len na /
translated: If it did,

original: de nyid thal ba bzhin du byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid thal ba bzhin du byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it would be like eating its own young.

original: nam mkha' lding drod gsher las skye ba ni bza' ba'i phyir klu sgo nga las skye ba dang / mngal nas skye ba dang / drod gsher las skye ba 'byin par byed de /
analyzed: nam mkha' lding drod gsher las skye ba ni bza' ba'i phyir klu sgo nga las skye ba dang / mngal nas skye ba dang / drod gsher las skye ba 'byin par byed de /
translated: The garuḍa born from heat and moisture produces nāgas born from eggs, from wombs, and from heat and moisture in order to eat them,

original: rdzus te skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzus te skye ba ma yin no //
translated: but not supernaturally born nāgas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ci ste de len na de nyid thal ba bzhin du byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ste de len na de nyid thal ba bzhin du byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it did, it would be like eating its own young.

original: nam mkha' lding rdzus te skye ba ni bza' ba'i phyir klu sgo nga las skye ba dang / mngal nas skye ba dang / drod gsher las skye ba dang / rdzus te skye ba 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: nam mkha' lding rdzus te skye ba ni bza' ba'i phyir klu sgo nga las skye ba dang / mngal nas skye ba dang / drod gsher las skye ba dang / rdzus te skye ba 'byin par byed do //
translated: The garuḍas are born supernaturally upapāduka and they lay eggs, are born from a womb, are born from heat and moisture, and are born supernaturally.

original: klu la klu chen po bskal par gnas shing sa 'dzin pa dag yod do //
analyzed: klu la klu chen po bskal par gnas shing sa 'dzin pa dag yod do //
translated: There are nāgas who are great nāgas, who live for an eon and hold up the earth.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: klu'i rgyal po dga' bo dang / nye dga' gnyis dang / klu'i rgyal po rtas rgyal dang / klu'i rgyal po btang bzung dang / klu'i rgyal po gzi can dang / klu'i rgyal po yul 'khor srung dang / klu'i rgyal po nag po chen po dang /
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po dga' bo dang / nye dga' gnyis dang / klu'i rgyal po rtas rgyal dang / klu'i rgyal po btang bzung dang / klu'i rgyal po gzi can dang / klu'i rgyal po yul 'khor srung dang / klu'i rgyal po nag po chen po dang /
translated: the nāga kings Nanda and Upananda, the nāga kings Sāgara and Vāsuki, the nāga kings Takṣaka and Mahāpadma, the nāga kings Anavatapta and Mahākāla,

original: klu'i rgyal po ae le'i 'dab ma rnams te /
analyzed: klu'i rgyal po ae le'i 'dab ma rnams te /
translated: and the nāga kings Airāvaṇa and Elāpattra.

original: 'di dag gzhan yang klu chen po bskal par gnas shing sa 'dzin pa nam mkha' lding dag gis dbyung bar mi nus pa gang yin pa 'di dag ni lha dang lha ma yin gyi g-yul myong bar byed cing so sor myong bar byed de /
analyzed: 'di dag gzhan yang klu chen po bskal par gnas shing sa 'dzin pa nam mkha' lding dag gis dbyung bar mi nus pa gang yin pa 'di dag ni lha dang lha ma yin gyi g-yul myong bar byed cing so sor myong bar byed de /
translated: They experience the battle of the gods and demigods and experience it individually.

original: shes shing rab tu shes la /🔽kun @6a * //
analyzed: shes shing rab tu shes la / kun @6a * //
translated: They know, fully know,

original: du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: du rab tu shes so //
translated: and completely and fully know.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: shin tu mthu che ba yi klu dag yod //
analyzed: shin tu mthu che ba yi klu dag yod //
translated: There are nāgas with great power,

original: ma mtha' srung zhing chu na gnas pa ste //
analyzed: ma mtha' srung zhing chu na gnas pa ste //
translated: who protect the boundaries and live in the water.

original: de dag lha min dag dang g-yul 'gyed pas //
analyzed: de dag lha min dag dang g-yul 'gyed pas //
translated: Because they fight in battle with the demigods,

original: 'di dag brgya byin gyi ni dpung yang yin //
analyzed: 'di dag brgya byin gyi ni dpung yang yin //
translated: they are also the army of Śakra.

original: stobs kyang che zhing dug che klu yin te //
analyzed: stobs kyang che zhing dug che klu yin te //
translated: They are nāgas with great strength and great poison,

original: shin tu drag po dgra thabs sna tshogs can //
analyzed: shin tu drag po dgra thabs sna tshogs can //
translated: with various fierce hostile methods.

original: lha min rnams dang lhan cig g-yul 'gyed pas //
analyzed: lha min rnams dang lhan cig g-yul 'gyed pas //
translated: Because they fight in battle with the demigods,

original: de dag brgya byin gyi ni dpung yang yin //🔽zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: de dag brgya byin gyi ni dpung yang yin // zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: they are also the army of Śakra.🔽In the Madhyamāgama,

original: bar gyi mdo la /
analyzed: bar gyi mdo la /
translated: it is said:

original: dga' bo nyer dga' rtas rgyal dang // btang bzung dang ni gzi can dang // yul 'khor srung dang nag po che //
analyzed: dga' bo nyer dga' rtas rgyal dang // btang bzung dang ni gzi can dang // yul 'khor srung dang nag po che //
translated: Dhṛtarāṣṭra, Virūḍhaka,

original: ae le'i 'dab ma phyi ma yin //
analyzed: ae le'i 'dab ma phyi ma yin //
translated: and Virūpākṣa are the last.

original: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dag yod de /
analyzed: stong spyi phud kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dag yod de /
translated: In the world system of a thousand million worlds, there are the ten wholesome courses of action.

original: srog gcod pa spong ba dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig 'khyal pa spong ba dang / brnab sems med pa dang /
analyzed: srog gcod pa spong ba dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig 'khyal pa spong ba dang / brnab sems med pa dang /
translated: They are: abandoning killing, abandoning stealing, abandoning sexual misconduct, abandoning false speech, abandoning divisive speech, abandoning harsh speech, abandoning frivolous speech, being without covetousness,

original: gnod sems med pa dang / yang dag par lta ba rnams so //
analyzed: gnod sems med pa dang / yang dag par lta ba rnams so //
translated: being without ill will, and having right view.

original: srog gcod pa spong ba shas cher kun du bsten cing bsgoms te lan mang du byas pas ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog gcod pa spong ba shas cher kun du bsten cing bsgoms te lan mang du byas pas ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By frequently cultivating and increasing the abandonment of killing, one is reborn with the same fortune as the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods.

original: de bas ches shas chung ba dang de bas ches yang bas ni 'phrul dga' ba rnams so //
analyzed: de bas ches shas chung ba dang de bas ches yang bas ni 'phrul dga' ba rnams so //
translated: The gods of Nirmāṇarati are even lighter and more subtle.🔽The gods of Tuṣita are even lighter and more subtle.

original: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni dga' ldan pa rnams su'o //🔽de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni 'thab bral ba rnams su'o //
analyzed: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni dga' ldan pa rnams su'o // de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni 'thab bral ba rnams su'o //
translated: The gods of Yama are even lighter and more subtle.

original: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams su'o //
translated: The gods of the Thirty-three are even lighter and more subtle.

original: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni rgyal chen bzhi pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni rgyal chen bzhi pa rnams su'o //
translated: The gods of the Four Great Kings are even lighter and more subtle.

original: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are born with the same fortune as humans are even lighter and more subtle.

original: ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig 'khyal pa spong ba dang / chags sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang /🔽yang dag par lta ba shas cher kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te lan mang du byas pas ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha @6b rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig 'khyal pa spong ba dang / chags sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang / yang dag par lta ba shas cher kun tu bsten cing bsgoms te lan mang du byas pas ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha @6b rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: abandoning taking what is not given, abandoning sexual misconduct, abandoning false speech, abandoning slander, abandoning harsh speech, abandoning frivolous speech, being without covetousness, being without ill will,🔽and having right view.🔽By frequently cultivating and increasing the wholesome actions of abandoning taking what is not given, abandoning sexual misconduct, abandoning false speech, abandoning slander, abandoning harsh speech, abandoning frivolous speech, being without covetousness, being without ill will,🔽and having right view, one is reborn with the same fortune as the Paranirmitavasavartin gods.🔽By a still smaller amount and a still lighter action, one is reborn among the Nirmanarati gods.🔽By a still smaller amount and a still lighter action, one is reborn among the Tushita gods.

original: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni 'phrul dga' ba rnams so //🔽de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni dga' ldan pa rnams su'o //🔽de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni 'thab bral ba rnams su'o //
analyzed: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni 'phrul dga' ba rnams so //🔽de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni dga' ldan pa rnams su'o //🔽de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni 'thab bral ba rnams su'o //
translated: By a still smaller amount and a still lighter action, one is reborn among the Yamas.

original: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams su'o //
translated: The gods of the Thirty-three are even lighter and more buoyant.

original: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni rgyal chen bzhi pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni rgyal chen bzhi pa rnams su'o //
translated: The gods of the Four Great Kings are even lighter and more buoyant.

original: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas ches shas chung ba dang / de bas ches yang bas ni mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are born in the human realm are even lighter and more buoyant.

original: ji ste mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye na yang srog gcod pa spong bas ni tshe ring por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ste mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skye na yang srog gcod pa spong bas ni tshe ring por 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is born in the human realm, by abandoning killing one will have a long life.

original: ma byin par len pa spong bas ni longs spyod chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa spong bas ni longs spyod chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: By abandoning stealing one will have great wealth.

original: 'dod pa la log par g-yem ba spong bas ni chung ma 'gran zla med par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: 'dod pa la log par g-yem ba spong bas ni chung ma 'gran zla med par 'gyur ro//
translated: By abandoning sexual misconduct one will have a wife who is without rival.

original: brdzun du smra ba spong bas ni skur pa mang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba spong bas ni skur pa mang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By abandoning lying one will not be slandered.

original: phra ma spong bas ni mdza' bo dang 'bye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phra ma spong bas ni mdza' bo dang 'bye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By abandoning divisive speech one will not be separated from one’s friends.

original: tshig rtsub po spong bas ni yid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra thos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig rtsub po spong bas ni yid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra thos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By abandoning harsh speech, one will not hear unpleasant sounds.

original: tshig 'khyal pa spong bas ni tshig mnyan par 'gyur ro //🔽chags sems med pas ni 'dod chags che bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig 'khyal pa spong bas ni tshig mnyan par 'gyur ro // chags sems med pas ni 'dod chags che bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By abandoning idle chatter, one's words will be heeded.🔽By being without covetousness, one will not have great desires.

original: gnod sems med pas ni zhe sdang che bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod sems med pas ni zhe sdang che bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By being without ill-will, one will not have great hatred.

original: yang dag pa'i lta bas ni gti mug che bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽sems can dmyal bar myong bar 'gyur ba'i las rnams kyi nang na ni las gang gi rnam par smin pas mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal ba chen po'i tshe'i tshad bskal par len pa 'di mchog yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta bas ni gti mug che bar mi 'gyur ro // sems can dmyal bar myong bar 'gyur ba'i las rnams kyi nang na ni las gang gi rnam par smin pas mnar med pa'i sems can dmyal ba chen po'i tshe'i tshad bskal par len pa 'di mchog yin no //
translated: By having right view, one will not have great delusion.🔽Among the actions to be experienced in hell, the worst is the action whose fruition is to take rebirth in the great Avīci hell for an eon.

original: dud 'gro myong bar 'gyur ba'i las rnams kyi nang na ni las gang gi rnam par smin pas sa srung gi bus sa srung gi bu nyid dang / rab tu brtan pas rab tu brtan pa nyid thob pa 'di mchog yin no //
analyzed: dud 'gro myong bar 'gyur ba'i las rnams kyi nang na ni las gang gi rnam par smin pas sa srung gi bus sa srung gi bu nyid dang / rab tu brtan pas rab tu brtan pa nyid thob pa 'di mchog yin no //
translated: Among the actions to be experienced as an animal, the worst is the action whose fruition is to be born as a nāga king with great power, such as the nāga king Sāgara.

original: yi dags kyi skye gnas su skye bar 'gyur ba'i las rnams kyi nang na ni las gang gi rnam par smin pas rgyal po gshin rjes gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi sems can rnams kyi rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byed pa 'di ni mchog yin no //
analyzed: yi dags kyi skye gnas su skye bar 'gyur ba'i las rnams kyi nang na ni las gang gi rnam par smin pas rgyal po gshin rjes gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi sems can rnams kyi rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byed pa 'di ni mchog yin no //
translated: Among the actions that lead to rebirth as a hungry ghost, the most serious is the action whose fruition is that Yama, the king of the hungry ghosts, has dominion over the kingdom of hungry ghosts.

original: mi'i skye gnas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las rnams kyi nang na ni las gang gi rnam par smin pas nga las nus pa @7a * //🔽las nu nyid du thob pa 'di mchog yin no //
analyzed: mi'i skye gnas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las rnams kyi nang na ni las gang gi rnam par smin pas nga las nus pa @7a * // las nu nyid du thob pa 'di mchog yin no //
translated: Among the actions that lead to rebirth as a human, the most serious is the action whose fruition is that of becoming a universal monarch.

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris myong bar 'gyur ba'i las rnams kyi nang na ni las gang gi rnam par smin pas rgyal po chen po bzhi rnams rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byed pa 'di mchog yin no //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris myong bar 'gyur ba'i las rnams kyi nang na ni las gang gi rnam par smin pas rgyal po chen po bzhi rnams rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byed pa 'di mchog yin no //
translated: Among the actions that lead to rebirth in the Heaven of the Four Great Kings, the most serious is the action whose fruition is that of becoming a king of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum myong bar 'gyur ba'i las rnams kyi nang na ni las gang gi rnam par smin pas brgya byin gyis brgya byin nyid thob pa 'di mchog yin no //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum myong bar 'gyur ba'i las rnams kyi nang na ni las gang gi rnam par smin pas brgya byin gyis brgya byin nyid thob pa 'di mchog yin no //
translated: Among the actions that are experienced in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, this action whose fruition is the status of Śakra is the most excellent.

original: 'thab bral myong bar 'gyur ba'i las rnams kyi nang na ni las gang gi rnam par smin pas rab 'thab bral nyid thob pa 'di mchog yin no //🔽dga' ldan myong bar 'gyur ba'i las rnams kyi nang na ni las gang gi rnam par smin pas yongs su dga' ldan gyis yongs su dga' ldan nyid thob pa 'di mchog yin no //
analyzed: 'thab bral myong bar 'gyur ba'i las rnams kyi nang na ni las gang gi rnam par smin pas rab 'thab bral nyid thob pa 'di mchog yin no // dga' ldan myong bar 'gyur ba'i las rnams kyi nang na ni las gang gi rnam par smin pas yongs su dga' ldan gyis yongs su dga' ldan nyid thob pa 'di mchog yin no //
translated: Among the actions that are experienced in the Heaven Free from Strife, this action whose fruition is the status of Suyāma is the most excellent.🔽Among the actions that are experienced in the Heaven of Joy, this action whose fruition is the status of Saṃtuṣita is the most excellent.

original: 'phrul dga' myong bar 'gyur ba'i las rnams kyi nang na ni las gang gi rnam par smin pas rab sprul nyid thob pa 'di mchog yin no//
analyzed: 'phrul dga' myong bar 'gyur ba'i las rnams kyi nang na ni las gang gi rnam par smin pas rab sprul nyid thob pa 'di mchog yin no//
translated: Among the actions that are experienced in the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations, this action whose fruition is the status of Sunirmita is the most excellent.

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed myong bar 'gyur ba'i las rnams kyi nang na ni las gang gi rnam par smin pas dbang byed kyi dbang nyid thob pa 'di mchog yin no //
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed myong bar 'gyur ba'i las rnams kyi nang na ni las gang gi rnam par smin pas dbang byed kyi dbang nyid thob pa 'di mchog yin no //
translated: Among the actions that produce the experience of the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods, the action whose effect is the sovereignty of the king of the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods is the most excellent.

original: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la bkres pa dang / skom pa yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags po rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la bkres pa dang / skom pa yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags po rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang /
translated: Hunger and thirst exist among humans of Jambudvīpa, among the humans of Pūrvavideha, of Avaragodānīya, of Uttarakuru, among the Cāturmahārājakāyikas,

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams la yang yod do //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams la yang yod do //
translated: among the Trāyastriṃśas, Yāmas, Tuṣitas, Nirmāṇaratis, and among the Paranirmitavaśavartins.

original: de phan chad la ni bkres pa dang skom pa med do //
analyzed: de phan chad la ni bkres pa dang skom pa med do //
translated: But beyond that, there is no hunger or thirst.

original: de ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la kha zas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la kha zas 'di lta ste /
translated: The food of the gods of the realm of desire is:

original: 'bras chan dang / zan dang / phye dang / sha dang / khur ba rnams yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags po dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod la yang yod do //
analyzed: 'bras chan dang / zan dang / phye dang / sha dang / khur ba rnams yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags po dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod la yang yod do //
translated: Rice, barley, wheat, meat, and pastries exist in the east, in the west, and in the north.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams ni ma rmos ma btab pa'i 'bras s'a lu'i 'bru za'o //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams ni ma rmos ma btab pa'i 'bras s'a lu'i 'bru za'o //
translated: The humans of Kuru in the north eat rice that is not cultivated and not sown.

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams ni dri za'i zas dang bdud rtsi'i zas za'o //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams ni dri za'i zas dang bdud rtsi'i zas za'o //
translated: The gods of the realm of the Four Great Kings eat the food of the gandharvas and the food of ambrosia.

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams ji lta ba bzhin du sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul @7b dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams ji lta ba bzhin du sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul @7b dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The gods of the Thirty-three, the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, and the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods eat the same food as the gods of the realm of the Four Great Kings.

original: de yan chad la ni kham gyi zas med do //
analyzed: de yan chad la ni kham gyi zas med do //
translated: Above this realm, there is no longer any material food.

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams kyi bdud rtsi ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams kyi bdud rtsi ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The ambrosia of the gods of the realm of the Four Great Kings is of four types:

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnams so //
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnams so //
translated: yellow, red, and white.🔽As is the case for the Caturmaharajakas, the same holds for the Thirty-three gods,

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams ji lta ba bzhin du sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan ba rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams kyang de bzhin no //🔽tshangs ris pa rnams la ni med do //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams ji lta ba bzhin du sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan ba rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams kyang de bzhin no // tshangs ris pa rnams la ni med do //
translated: the Yamas, the Tuṣitas, the Nirmāṇaratis, and the Paranirmitavaśavartins.🔽The Brahmakāyikas do not have excrement and urine.

original: de yan chad la yang med do //
analyzed: de yan chad la yang med do //
translated: Neither do the gods of higher realms.

original: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling pa rnams la bshang ba dang gci ba yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags po rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams la yang yod do //🔽rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams la ni med do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling pa rnams la bshang ba dang gci ba yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags po rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams la yang yod do // rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams la ni med do //
translated: As in Jambudvīpa, the gods of the realm of desire have excrement and urine,

original: de yan chad la yang med do //
analyzed: de yan chad la yang med do //
translated: except for the Caturmaharajakas and the gods higher🔽than the Tṛdayaṃdhas.

original: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la char 'bab mkhas pa dang / char 'bab mi mkhas pa yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams la yang yod do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la char 'bab mkhas pa dang / char 'bab mi mkhas pa yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams la yang yod do //
translated: Just as there are in Jambudvīpa people who are skillful and not skillful in the matter of rain, so too in Pūrvavideha and in Godānīya.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams la ni med do //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams la ni med do //
translated: But not in Kuru and among the Cāturmahārājakāyikas.

original: de yan chad la yang med do //
analyzed: de yan chad la yang med do //
translated: And not above there.

original: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la lo legs pa dang / mu ge yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags po dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams la yang yod do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la lo legs pa dang / mu ge yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags po dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams la yang yod do //
translated: Just as there are in Jambudvīpa people who have good harvests and famine, so too in Pūrvavideha and in Godānīya.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams la ni med do //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams la ni med do //
translated: But not in Kuru and among the Cāturmahārājakāyikas.

original: de yan chad la yang med do //
analyzed: de yan chad la yang med do //
translated: And not above there.

original: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la 'jigs pa dang / bde ba yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags po rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams la yang yod do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la 'jigs pa dang / bde ba yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags po rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams la yang yod do //
translated: The fear and the happiness that exist among the humans of Jambudvīpa exist among the humans of Videha in the east and Godānīya in the west.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams la ni med do //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams la ni med do //
translated: But they do not exist among the humans of Kuru in the north.

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams la yod do //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams la yod do //
translated: They exist among the Cāturmahārājakāyikas, the Trāyastriṃśas, the Yāmas, the Tuṣitas, the Nirmāṇaratis, and the Paranirmitavaśavartins.

original: tshangs ris pa rnams la ni med do //
analyzed: tshangs ris pa rnams la ni med do //
translated: But they do not exist among the Brahmakāyikas.

original: de yan chad la yang med do //
analyzed: de yan chad la yang med do //
translated: They do not exist above that.

original: 'jig rten gzhag pa las tshigs gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhag pa las tshigs gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third section of the chapter on the world.

original: mdo la / nyo tshong @8a * //
analyzed: mdo la / nyo tshong @8a * //
translated: The Sūtra says:🔽Buying and selling,🔽color, house,🔽bed, clothes,

original: mdog dang khang pa dang // gding ba dang ni gzhag gos dang // yang ba rdul rab bsgre ba dang // tha dad bag ma len dang bcu //
analyzed: mdog dang khang pa dang // gding ba dang ni gzhag gos dang // yang ba rdul rab bsgre ba dang // tha dad bag ma len dang bcu //
translated: washing, and taking a wife.

original: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la nor ram /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la nor ram /
translated: Just as there is buying and selling of wealth,

original: 'bru 'am / gser ram dngul nyo tshong bya ba yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams dang nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams la yang yod do //
analyzed: 'bru 'am / gser ram dngul nyo tshong bya ba yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams dang nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams la yang yod do //
translated: grain, gold and silver among the humans of Jambudvīpa, so too among the humans of Videha in the east and Godānīya in the west.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams la ni med do //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams la ni med do //
translated: But not among the humans of Kuru in the north and the Caturmahārājika gods.

original: de yan chad la yang med do //
analyzed: de yan chad la yang med do //
translated: Nor is there any among the gods above them.

original: 'di snyam du /
analyzed: 'di snyam du /
translated: Some say:

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la nor dang 'bru rnams kyi nyo tshong byed do //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la nor dang 'bru rnams kyi nyo tshong byed do //
translated: The humans of Jambudvīpa engage in buying and selling wealth and grain.

original: shar gyi lus 'phags po rnams ni ras dang be'u ras rnams kyis so //
analyzed: shar gyi lus 'phags po rnams ni ras dang be'u ras rnams kyis so //
translated: The humans of Videha in the east engage in buying and selling cloth and cotton.

original: nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams ni ba lang dang nor bu rnams kyis so zhes zer ba yang yod do //
analyzed: nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams ni ba lang dang nor bu rnams kyis so zhes zer ba yang yod do //
translated: The humans of Godānīya in the west engage in buying and selling cattle and jewels.

original: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams kyi mdog nag po dang / dkar po dang / sngo bsangs dang / mdog skya snar rnam pa bzhi yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams kyi mdog nag po dang / dkar po dang / sngo bsangs dang / mdog skya snar rnam pa bzhi yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The humans of Jambudvīpa are of four colors: black, white, red, and yellow. The humans of Videha in the east are white. The humans of Godānīya in the west are red.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams ni mdog gcig pa ste dkar po'o //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams ni mdog gcig pa ste dkar po'o //
translated: The humans of Kuru in the north are of a single color, white.

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams kyi mdog ni rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams kyi mdog ni rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The gods of the assembly of the Four Great Kings are of four colors:

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnams so //
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnams so //
translated: blue, yellow, red, and white.
