original: rgyal chen bzhi pa rnams kyi ji lta ba bzhin du sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan ba rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi pa rnams kyi ji lta ba bzhin du sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan ba rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The gods of the Thirty-Three and the Yāma gods, etc., are like the gods of the assembly of the Four Great Kings.

original: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams kyang mdog gcig pa ste dkar po'o //
analyzed: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams kyang mdog gcig pa ste dkar po'o //
translated: The gods of Brahmakāyika are of a single color, white.

original: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams ji lta ba bzhin du tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams dang / tshangs pa chen po pa rnams dang / 'od chung ba rnams dang / tshad med 'od pa rnams dang / 'od gsal ba rnams dang / dge chung ba rnams dang /
analyzed: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams ji lta ba bzhin du tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams dang / tshangs pa chen po pa rnams dang / 'od chung ba rnams dang / tshad med 'od pa rnams dang / 'od gsal ba rnams dang / dge chung ba rnams dang /
translated: The gods of the Brahmapurohita heaven, the Mahābrahmā heaven, the Parīttābha heaven, the Apramāṇābha heaven, the Ābhāsvara heaven, the Parīttaśubha heaven,

original: tshad med dge ba rnams dang / dge rgyas pa rnams dang / sprin med pa rnams dang / bsod nams skyes pa rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang ba rnams dang /
analyzed: tshad med dge ba rnams dang / dge rgyas pa rnams dang / sprin med pa rnams dang / bsod nams skyes pa rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang ba rnams dang /
translated: the Apramāṇaśubha heaven, the Śubhakṛtsna heaven, the Anabhraka heaven, the Puṇyaprasava heaven, the Bṛhatphala heaven, the Avṛha heaven, the Atapa heaven, the Sudarśana heaven,

original: shin tu mthong ba rnams dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: shin tu mthong ba rnams dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: and the Akaniṣṭha heaven are also like this.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye @8b skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la ni kha dog med do //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye @8b skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la ni kha dog med do //
translated: The sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, the sphere of nothingness, and the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception are without color.

original: 'di ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams kyi khang pa ched du byas pa dang / ched du byas pa ma yin pa dang / khang bzangs dang / sa khang rnams yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams la yang yod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams kyi khang pa ched du byas pa dang / ched du byas pa ma yin pa dang / khang bzangs dang / sa khang rnams yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams la yang yod do //
translated: The humans of Godānīya and Videha also have houses that are made by humans, and also palaces and caves.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams kyi khang pa ni ched du byas pa ma yin pa'i sa khang ngo //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams kyi khang pa ni ched du byas pa ma yin pa'i sa khang ngo //
translated: The humans of Kuru have only houses that are made by humans.

original: rgyal chen bzhi pa rnams kyi gzhal med khang ni ched du byas pa dang ched du byas pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi pa rnams kyi gzhal med khang ni ched du byas pa dang ched du byas pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The Caturmahārājakāyikas have houses that are made by humans and also houses that are not made by humans.

original: rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha rnams kyi 'jig rten pa bzhin du sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams kyi yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha rnams kyi 'jig rten pa bzhin du sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams kyi yang de bzhin no //
translated: The Trāyastriṃśas, Yāmas, Tuṣitas, Nirmāṇaratis, and Paranirmitavaśavartins have houses that are like those of the Caturmahārājakāyikas.

original: tshangs ris pa rnams kyi gzhal med khang rnams ni ched du byas pa ma yin pa'o //🔽tshangs ris pa rnams kyi ji lta ba bzhin du tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa dang / tshangs pa chen po pa rnams dang / 'od chung ba rnams dang / tshad med 'od pa rnams dang / 'od gsal ba rnams dang / dge chung rnams dang /
analyzed: tshangs ris pa rnams kyi gzhal med khang rnams ni ched du byas pa ma yin pa'o // tshangs ris pa rnams kyi ji lta ba bzhin du tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa dang / tshangs pa chen po pa rnams dang / 'od chung ba rnams dang / tshad med 'od pa rnams dang / 'od gsal ba rnams dang / dge chung rnams dang /
translated: The palaces of the Brahmakayikas are not made by anyone.

original: tshad med dge ba rnams dang / dge rgyas pa rnams dang / sprin med pa rnams dang / bsod nams skyes pa rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang ba rnams dang /
analyzed: tshad med dge ba rnams dang / dge rgyas pa rnams dang / sprin med pa rnams dang / bsod nams skyes pa rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang ba rnams dang /
translated: Just as the Brahmakayikas, so too the Brahmapurohitas, Mahabrahmans, Parittabhas, Apramanabhas, Abhasvaras, Parittasubhas, Apramanasubhas, Subhakṛtsnas, Anabhrakas, Punyaprasavas, Brihatphalas, Avrihas, Atapa, Sudarśanas, Sudṛśas, and Akaniṣṭhas.

original: shin tu mthong ba rnams dang / 'og min pa rnams kyi gzhal med khang yang ched du byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shin tu mthong ba rnams dang / 'og min pa rnams kyi gzhal med khang yang ched du byas pa ma yin no //
translated: The palaces of the Akaniṣṭhas are not made by anyone.

original: gzugs med pa rnams la ni khang pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams la ni khang pa med pa'o //
translated: The formless gods have no palaces.

original: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la gding ba dang bgo ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la gding ba dang bgo ba 'di lta ste /
translated: The people of Jambudvīpa have bedding and clothing such as woolen cloth,🔽cotton cloth, linen cloth, silk cloth, fine silk cloth,

original: bal gos dang / sha na'i ras dang / gso ma'i ras dang / zar ma'i ras dang / ras gos dang / zab dar dang / ko tam pa'i ras dang / rtsva du ku la'i gos dang / aa pa ran ti ka'i gos dang / ras dang /
analyzed: bal gos dang / sha na'i ras dang / gso ma'i ras dang / zar ma'i ras dang / ras gos dang / zab dar dang / ko tam pa'i ras dang / rtsva du ku la'i gos dang / aa pa ran ti ka'i gos dang / ras dang /
translated: goat hair cloth, dukūla cloth, aparantakā cloth, and cotton.

original: be'u ras yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams la yang yod do //
analyzed: be'u ras yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams la yang yod do //
translated: The people of Videha in the east and Godānīya in the west also have these.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams ni dpag bsam shing las byung ba'i gos gyon no //🔽ji ltar byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams dpag bsam gyi @9a * //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams ni dpag bsam shing las byung ba'i gos gyon no //🔽ji ltar byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams dpag bsam gyi @9a * //
translated: The people of Kuru in the north wear clothes made from the wish-fulfilling tree.

original: shing las byung ba'i gos gyon pa bzhin du rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyang de bzhin no //🔽tshangs ris kyi lha rnams ni gos gyon bzhin du skye'o //
analyzed: shing las byung ba'i gos gyon pa bzhin du rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyang de bzhin no // tshangs ris kyi lha rnams ni gos gyon bzhin du skye'o //
translated: The gods of the Four Great Kings, the gods of the Thirty-three, the Yamas, the Joyous, the Creative-Enjoyers, and the Controller of Others’ Creations are born in the same way, wearing clothes that come from the trees.🔽The gods of the Brahma group are born wearing clothes.

original: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams ji lta ba bzhin du tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams dang / tshangs pa chen po pa rnams dang / 'od chung ba rnams dang / tshad med 'od pa rnams dang / 'od gsal ba rnams dang / dge chung ba rnams dang /
analyzed: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams ji lta ba bzhin du tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams dang / tshangs pa chen po pa rnams dang / 'od chung ba rnams dang / tshad med 'od pa rnams dang / 'od gsal ba rnams dang / dge chung ba rnams dang /
translated: Just as the gods of the Brahma group, so too the gods of the Brahmapurohita, the Great Brahma, the Limited Radiance, the Immeasurable Radiance, the Radiant, the Limited Beauty, the Immeasurable Beauty, the Beautifully Lustrous, the Unclouded, the Cloudless, the Merit Born, the Great Result, the Not Great, the Not Less, the Excellent Gods, the Excellent Vision, the Clear-sighted, the Highest Gods, the Akaniṣṭha gods, the Ābhāsvara gods, the Śubhakṛtsna gods, the Bṛhatphala gods, the Parīttābha gods, the Apramāṇābha gods, the Apramāṇacitta gods, the Parīttaśubha gods, the Avṛha gods, the Atapa gods, the Sudarśana gods, the Sudṛśa gods, the Akaniṣṭha gods, the Ākāśānantyāyatana gods, the Vijñānānantyāyatana gods, the Ākiñcanyāyatana gods, and the Naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñāyatana gods are born wearing clothes.

original: chad med dge rnams dang / dge rgyas pa rnams dang / sprin med pa rnams dang / bsod nams skyes pa rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang ba rnams dang /
analyzed: chad med dge rnams dang / dge rgyas pa rnams dang / sprin med pa rnams dang / bsod nams skyes pa rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang ba rnams dang /
translated: the gods of the realm of the Thirty-three, the Yāma gods, the gods of Tuṣita, the Nirmāṇarati gods, the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods, the Brahmakāyika gods, the Brahmapurohita gods, the Brahmapārṣadya gods, the gods of the Ābhāsvara realm, the gods of the Śubhakṛtsna realm, the Anabhraka gods, the gods of the Puṇyaprasava realm, the gods of the Bṛhatphala realm, the Avṛha gods, the Atapa gods, the Sudarśana gods,

original: shin tu mthong ba rnams dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyang de gos gyon bzhin du skye'o //
analyzed: shin tu mthong ba rnams dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyang de gos gyon bzhin du skye'o //
translated: and the Akaniṣṭha gods.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams kyi dpag bsam shing las byung ba'i gos kyang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams kyi dpag bsam shing las byung ba'i gos kyang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The clothes that appear from the wish-fulfilling trees of the humans of Kuru in the north are also of four types:

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnams so //
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnams so //
translated: blue, yellow, red, and white.

original: gzhan gos kyang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzhan gos kyang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The clothes that are not from the wish-fulfilling trees are also of four types:

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnams so //
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnams so //
translated: blue, yellow, red, and white.

original: dpag bsam shing las byung ba'i gos kyang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: dpag bsam shing las byung ba'i gos kyang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The clothes that appear from the wish-fulfilling trees are also of four types:

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnams te /
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnams te /
translated: blue, yellow, red, and white.

original: dpag bsam shing las byung ba'i gos ji lta bu 'dod pa de lta bu skyes pa'am /
analyzed: dpag bsam shing las byung ba'i gos ji lta bu 'dod pa de lta bu skyes pa'am /
translated: The trees that produce garments are like wish-fulfilling trees.

original: bud med dag gis sems bskyed ma thag tu de la yal ga 'dud par byed do //
analyzed: bud med dag gis sems bskyed ma thag tu de la yal ga 'dud par byed do //
translated: As soon as a man or woman thinks of a garment, the branch bends down.

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams kyi dpag bsam shing las byung ba'i gos kyi shing rnams kyang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams kyi dpag bsam shing las byung ba'i gos kyi shing rnams kyang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The trees that produce garments of the Caturmaharajakayikas are also of four types:🔽blue, yellow, red, and white.

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnams dang / gzhan gos kyang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnams dang / gzhan gos kyang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The garments are also of four types:

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnams so //
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnams so //
translated: blue, yellow, red, and white.

original: dpag bsam gyi shing las byung ba'i gos kyang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: dpag bsam gyi shing las byung ba'i gos kyang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The trees that produce garments of the Trayastrimsas are also of four types:

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnams te /🔽dpag bsam shing las byung ba'i gos ji lta bu 'dod pa de lta bu lha'i bu'am /
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnams te / dpag bsam shing las byung ba'i gos ji lta bu 'dod pa de lta bu lha'i bu'am /
translated: blue, yellow, red, and white.

original: lha'i bu mo dag gis sems bskyed ma thag tu yal ga 'dud @9b par byed do //
analyzed: lha'i bu mo dag gis sems bskyed ma thag tu yal ga 'dud @9b par byed do //
translated: As soon as a god or goddess thinks of a garment, the branch bends down.

original: de'i lag tu 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i lag tu 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The gods of the realm of fine-materiality do not have clothing; they are ashamed of their nudity and, as a result of this intention, a subtle matter adheres to their bodies, taking on the color of white, yellow, red or brown, according to the case.

original: rgyal chen bzhi pa rnams kyi ji lta ba bzhin du sum cu rtsa gsum pa dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan ba rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams kyi yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi pa rnams kyi ji lta ba bzhin du sum cu rtsa gsum pa dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan ba rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams kyi yang de bzhin no //
translated: The gods of the realm of desire possess clothing that is similar to the clothing of humans of Jambudvīpa, but which is distinguished by its brilliance and lightness.

original: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams la ni dpag bsam shing las byung ba'i gos med do //🔽de yan chad la yang med do //
analyzed: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams la ni dpag bsam shing las byung ba'i gos med do // de yan chad la yang med do //
translated: The gods of the realm of fine-materiality do not have clothing; they are ashamed of their nudity and, as a result of this intention, a subtle matter adheres to their bodies, taking on the color of white, yellow, red or brown, according to the case.🔽The gods of the realm of desire possess clothing that is similar to the clothing of humans of Jambudvīpa, but which is distinguished by its brilliance and lightness.🔽The gods of the realm of fine-materiality do not have clothing; they are ashamed of their nudity and, as a result of this intention, a subtle matter adheres to their bodies, taking on the color of white, yellow, red or brown, according to the case.

original: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la gding ba dang / bgo ba lci ba dang / yang ba yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags po rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams la yang yod do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la gding ba dang / bgo ba lci ba dang / yang ba yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags po rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams la yang yod do //
translated: The gods of the realm of desire possess clothing that is similar to the clothing of humans of Jambudvīpa, but which is distinguished by its brilliance and lightness.🔽The gods of the realm of fine-materiality do not have clothing; they are ashamed of their nudity and, as a result of this intention, a subtle matter adheres to their bodies, taking on the color of white, yellow, red or brown, according to the case.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams kyi dpag bsam gyi shing las byung ba'i gos la ni srang gcig yod do //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams kyi dpag bsam gyi shing las byung ba'i gos la ni srang gcig yod do //
translated: The gods of the realm of desire possess clothing that is similar to the clothing of humans of Jambudvīpa, but which is distinguished by its brilliance and lightness.🔽The gods of the realm of fine-materiality do not have clothing; they are ashamed of their nudity and, as a result of this intention, a subtle matter adheres to their bodies, taking on the color of white, yellow, red or brown, according to the case.🔽The gods of the realm of desire possess clothing that is similar to the clothing of humans of Jambudvīpa, but which is distinguished by its brilliance and lightness.

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams kyi ni srang phyed do //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams kyi ni srang phyed do //
translated: The gods of the realm of fine-materiality do not have clothing; they are

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi ni srang gi bzhi cha gcig go //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi ni srang gi bzhi cha gcig go //
translated: The gods of the Thirty-three wear garments that weigh one-fourth of a pala.

original: 'thab bral ba rnams kyi ni srang gang gi brgyad cha gcig go //
analyzed: 'thab bral ba rnams kyi ni srang gang gi brgyad cha gcig go //
translated: The Yāma gods wear garments that weigh one-eighth of a pala.

original: dga' ldan ba rnams kyi ni srang gi bcu drug cha gcig go //
analyzed: dga' ldan ba rnams kyi ni srang gi bcu drug cha gcig go //
translated: The Tuṣita gods wear garments that weigh one-sixteenth of a pala.🔽The Nirmāṇarati gods wear garments that weigh one-thirty-second of a pala.

original: 'phrul dga' ba rnams kyi ni sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi srang gi cha gcig go / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams kyi dpag bsam gyi shing las byung ba'i gos ni srang gi drug cu rtsa bzhi'i cha gcig las med do //
analyzed: 'phrul dga' ba rnams kyi ni sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi srang gi cha gcig go / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams kyi dpag bsam gyi shing las byung ba'i gos ni srang gi drug cu rtsa bzhi'i cha gcig las med do //
translated: The Paranirmitavaśavartin gods wear garments that weigh one-sixty-fourth of a pala, which are produced from the wish-fulfilling tree.

original: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams kyi ni gzhal du med ba'i gos yin no //
analyzed: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams kyi ni gzhal du med ba'i gos yin no //
translated: The Brahmakāyika gods wear garments that are immeasurable.

original: tshangs ris pa rnams kyi ji lta ba bzhin du tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams dang / tshangs pa chen po pa rnams dang / 'od chung ba rnams dang / tshad med 'od pa rnams dang / 'od gsal ba rnams dang / dge chung ba rnams dang /
analyzed: tshangs ris pa rnams kyi ji lta ba bzhin du tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams dang / tshangs pa chen po pa rnams dang / 'od chung ba rnams dang / tshad med 'od pa rnams dang / 'od gsal ba rnams dang / dge chung ba rnams dang /
translated: The Brahmapurohita gods, the Mahābrahma gods, the Parīttābha gods, the Apramāṇābha gods, the Ābhāsvara gods, the Parīttaśubha gods, the Apramāṇaśubha gods, and the Śubhakṛtsna gods also wear garments that are immeasurable.

original: tshad med dge ba rnams dang / dge rgyas pa rnams dang / sprin med pa rnams dang / bsod nams skyes pa rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang ba rnams dang /🔽shin tu mthong ba rnams dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyi yang gzhal du med pa'i gos yin no //
analyzed: tshad med dge ba rnams dang / dge rgyas pa rnams dang / sprin med pa rnams dang / bsod nams skyes pa rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang ba rnams dang / shin tu mthong ba rnams dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyi yang gzhal du med pa'i gos yin no //
translated: The gods of the realm of the first dhyāna are the Brahmakāyikas, the Brahmapurohitas, the Mahābrahmans.🔽The gods of the realm of the second dhyāna are the Parīttābhas, the Apramāṇābhas, the Ābhāsvaras.🔽The gods of the realm of the third dhyāna are the Parīttaśubhas, the Apramāṇaśubhas, the Śubhakṛtsnas.🔽The gods of the realm of the fourth dhyāna are the Anabhrakas, the Puṇyaprasavas, the Bṛhatphalas, the Avṛhas, the Atapapas, the Sudarśanas, the Sudṛśas, the Akaniṣṭhas.

original: nyi zer gyi rdul bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i cha gcig ni rdul phra rab yin no //
analyzed: nyi zer gyi rdul bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i cha gcig ni rdul phra rab yin no //
translated: The Akaniṣṭha gods are the highest gods of the realm of finemateriality.🔽The smallest particle of matter is the smallest part of matter that exists.

original: rdul phra rab bdun ni rdul phra mo gcig go / rdul phra mo bdun la ni nyi zer gyi rdul gcig go //🔽nyi zer gyi rdul bdun la ni ri bong gi rdul gcig go //🔽ri bong gi rdul bdun la ni lug rdul gcig go //
analyzed: rdul phra rab bdun ni rdul phra mo gcig go / rdul phra mo bdun la ni nyi zer gyi rdul gcig go // nyi zer gyi rdul bdun la ni ri bong gi rdul gcig go // ri bong gi rdul bdun la ni lug rdul gcig go //
translated: Seven of these smallest particles make one atom.🔽Seven atoms make one louse.🔽Seven lice make one barley grain.

original: lug rdul bdun la ni glang rdul @10a * //🔽gcig go // glang rdul bdun la ni sro ma gcig go //
analyzed: lug rdul bdun la ni glang rdul @10a * //🔽gcig go // glang rdul bdun la ni sro ma gcig go //
translated: Seven barley grains make one finger joint.

original: sro ma bdun la ni aa ba ga na gcig go //
analyzed: sro ma bdun la ni aa ba ga na gcig go //
translated: Seven of these make one avaguna.

original: aa ba ga na bdun la ni ba ti ka gcig go //🔽ba ti ka bdun la ni nas 'bru gcig go //
analyzed: aa ba ga na bdun la ni ba ti ka gcig go // ba ti ka bdun la ni nas 'bru gcig go //
translated: Seven avagunas make one batiki.🔽Seven batikis make one barley grain.

original: nas 'bru bdun la ni sor gcig go //
analyzed: nas 'bru bdun la ni sor gcig go //
translated: Seven barley grains make one finger width.

original: sor nyi shu rtsa bzhi la ni khru gang ngo //🔽'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams kha cig ni khru tshad de ltar brtsis pa'i khru phyed dang bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: sor nyi shu rtsa bzhi la ni khru gang ngo // 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams kha cig ni khru tshad de ltar brtsis pa'i khru phyed dang bzhi pa'o //
translated: Twenty-four finger widths make one cubit.

original: kha cig ni khru bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni khru bzhi pa'o //
translated: Some humans of Jambudvīpa are half a cubit in size, others are four cubits in size.

original: shar gyi lus 'phags po rnams ni khru brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: shar gyi lus 'phags po rnams ni khru brgyad pa'o //
translated: The humans of Videha in the east are eight cubits in size.

original: nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams ni khru bcu drug pa'o //
analyzed: nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams ni khru bcu drug pa'o //
translated: The humans of Godānīya in the west are sixteen cubits in size.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams ni khru sum cu rtsa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams ni khru sum cu rtsa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The humans of Kuru in the north are thirty-two cubits in size.

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams kyi lus thob pa ni rgyang grags kyi bzhi cha gcig go //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams kyi lus thob pa ni rgyang grags kyi bzhi cha gcig go //
translated: The bodies of the gods of the Caturmaharajakayika gods are one-fourth of a krośa in size.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams kyi ni rgyang grags kyi phyed do //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams kyi ni rgyang grags kyi phyed do //
translated: The gods of the Trayastrimsha gods are half a krośa in size.

original: 'thab bral ba rnams kyi ni rgyang grags kyi bzhi cha gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'thab bral ba rnams kyi ni rgyang grags kyi bzhi cha gsum pa'o //
translated: The gods of Yāma have a lifespan of three and a half leagues.

original: dga' ldan pa rnams kyi ni rgyang grags gcig go //🔽'phrul dga' ba rnams kyi ni rgyang grags gcig dang / rgyang grags kyi bzhi cha gcig go //
analyzed: dga' ldan pa rnams kyi ni rgyang grags gcig go // 'phrul dga' ba rnams kyi ni rgyang grags gcig dang / rgyang grags kyi bzhi cha gcig go //
translated: The gods of Tuṣita have a lifespan of one league.🔽The gods of Nirmāṇarati have a lifespan of one and a quarter leagues.

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed rnams kyi ni rgyang grags phyed dang gnyis so //
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed rnams kyi ni rgyang grags phyed dang gnyis so //
translated: The gods of Paranirmitavaśavartin have a lifespan of one and a half leagues.

original: tshangs ris pa rnams kyi ni dpag tshad phyed do //
analyzed: tshangs ris pa rnams kyi ni dpag tshad phyed do //
translated: The gods of Brahmakāyika have a lifespan of half a league.

original: tshangs pa mdun na 'don pa rnams kyi ni dpag tshad gcig go //🔽tshangs pa chen po pa rnams kyi ni dpag tshad phyed dang gnyis so //
analyzed: tshangs pa mdun na 'don pa rnams kyi ni dpag tshad gcig go // tshangs pa chen po pa rnams kyi ni dpag tshad phyed dang gnyis so //
translated: The gods of Brahmapurohita have a lifespan of one league.🔽The gods of Mahābrahmā have a lifespan of one and a half leagues.

original: 'od chung ba rnams kyi ni dpag tshad gnyis so //
analyzed: 'od chung ba rnams kyi ni dpag tshad gnyis so //
translated: The gods of Parīttābha have a lifespan of two leagues.

original: tshad med 'od pa rnams kyi ni dpag tshad bzhi'o //
analyzed: tshad med 'od pa rnams kyi ni dpag tshad bzhi'o //
translated: The gods of Apramāṇābha have a lifespan of four leagues.

original: 'od gsal ba rnams kyi ni dpag tshad brgyad do //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba rnams kyi ni dpag tshad brgyad do //
translated: The gods of Ābhāsvara have a lifespan of eight leagues.

original: dge chung ba rnams kyi ni dpag tshad bcu drug go //
analyzed: dge chung ba rnams kyi ni dpag tshad bcu drug go //
translated: The gods of Parīttaśubha have a lifespan of sixteen leagues.

original: tshad med dge ba rnams kyi ni dpag tshad sum cu rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: tshad med dge ba rnams kyi ni dpag tshad sum cu rtsa gnyis so //
translated: The gods of the realm of good-smelling elemi resin have bodies thirty-two leagues high.

original: dge rgyas pa rnams kyi ni dpag tshad drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: dge rgyas pa rnams kyi ni dpag tshad drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: The gods of the realm of vast good have bodies sixty-four leagues high.

original: sprin med pa rnams kyi ni dpag chad brgya nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: sprin med pa rnams kyi ni dpag chad brgya nyi shu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: The gods of the realm of no-thought have bodies one hundred and twenty leagues high.

original: bsod nams skyes pa rnams kyi ni dpag tshad nyis brgya lnga bcu'o //
analyzed: bsod nams skyes pa rnams kyi ni dpag tshad nyis brgya lnga bcu'o //
translated: The gods of the realm of universal purity have bodies two hundred and fifty leagues high.

original: 'bras bu che ba'i lha rnams kyi ni dpag tshad lnga brgya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba'i lha rnams kyi ni dpag tshad lnga brgya'o //
translated: The gods of the realm of great reward have bodies five hundred leagues high.

original: 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams kyi yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams kyi yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The gods of the realm of non-percipient beings have bodies of the same size.

original: mi che ba'i lus thob pa ni dpag tshad stong ngo //
analyzed: mi che ba'i lus thob pa ni dpag tshad stong ngo //
translated: The gods of the realm of the summit of existence have bodies one thousand leagues high.

original: mi gdung ba rnams kyi ni dpag tshad nyis stong ngo //
analyzed: mi gdung ba rnams kyi ni dpag tshad nyis stong ngo //
translated: The gods of the realm of the no-thought have bodies two thousand leagues high.

original: gya nom snang ba rnams kyi ni dpag tshad bzhi stong ngo //🔽shin tu mthong ba pa rnams kyi ni dpag tshad brgyad stong ngo //
analyzed: gya nom snang ba rnams kyi ni dpag tshad bzhi stong ngo // shin tu mthong ba pa rnams kyi ni dpag tshad brgyad stong ngo //
translated: The gods of the realm of the excellent vision have bodies four thousand leagues high.🔽The gods of the realm of the far-reaching have bodies eight thousand leagues high.

original: 'og min gyi lha rnams @10b kyi lus thob pa rnams kyi ni dpag tshad khri drug stong ngo //
analyzed: 'og min gyi lha rnams @10b kyi lus thob pa rnams kyi ni dpag tshad khri drug stong ngo //
translated: The gods of the realm of the highest have bodies sixteen thousand leagues high.

original: gzugs med pa rnams la ni bsags pa'i lus med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams la ni bsags pa'i lus med do //
translated: In the formless realm, there is no body that is a collection.

original: nyi zer gyi rdul bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i cha gcig gi ni rdul phra rab yin no //
analyzed: nyi zer gyi rdul bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'i cha gcig gi ni rdul phra rab yin no //
translated: The smallest particle is one forty-ninth of a sun ray.

original: rdul phra rab bdun la ni rdul phra mo gcig go //🔽rdul phra mo bdun la ni nyi zer gyi rdul gcig go //🔽nyi zer gyi rdul bdun la ni ri bong gi rdul gcig go / ri bong gi rdul bdun la ni lug rdul gcig go //
analyzed: rdul phra rab bdun la ni rdul phra mo gcig go // rdul phra mo bdun la ni nyi zer gyi rdul gcig go // nyi zer gyi rdul bdun la ni ri bong gi rdul gcig go / ri bong gi rdul bdun la ni lug rdul gcig go //
translated: Seven smallest particles is one fine particle.🔽Seven fine particles is one particle of dust that is carried by the wind.

original: lug rdul bdun la ni glang rdul gcig go //🔽glang rdul bdun la ni sro ma gcig go //🔽sro ma bdun la ni aa ba ga na gcig go / aa ba ga na bdun la ni ba ti ka gcig go//🔽ba ti ka bdun la ni nas 'bru gcig go //
analyzed: lug rdul bdun la ni glang rdul gcig go // glang rdul bdun la ni sro ma gcig go // sro ma bdun la ni aa ba ga na gcig go / aa ba ga na bdun la ni ba ti ka gcig go// ba ti ka bdun la ni nas 'bru gcig go //
translated: Seven particles of dust that are carried by the wind is one particle of dust that remains on objects.🔽Seven particles of dust that remain on objects is one louse egg.🔽Seven louse eggs is one barley grain.

original: nas 'bru bdun la ni sor gcig go //
analyzed: nas 'bru bdun la ni sor gcig go //
translated: Seven barley grains is one finger width.

original: sor nyi shu rtsa bzhi la khru gang ngo //
analyzed: sor nyi shu rtsa bzhi la khru gang ngo //
translated: Twenty-four finger widths is one cubit.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams kha cig gos khru tshad 'di lta bur brtsis pa'i khru brgyad pa gyon no //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams kha cig gos khru tshad 'di lta bur brtsis pa'i khru brgyad pa gyon no //
translated: Some people in Jambudvīpa wear clothing that is eight cubits in size.

original: kha cig ni khru bcu pa'o //🔽shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams kyi ni khru nyi shu pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni khru bcu pa'o // shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams kyi ni khru nyi shu pa'o //
translated: The bodies of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-three are thirty-two cubits.🔽The bodies of the gods of the Heaven of Yama are thirty-two cubits.🔽

original: nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams kyi ni khru bzhi bcu pa'o //
analyzed: nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams kyi ni khru bzhi bcu pa'o //
translated: The garments of the gods of the first meditation are four fingers in width and twenty fingers in length.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams kyi ni dpag bsam shing las byung ba'i gos khru brgyad cu pa gyon no //🔽rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha rnams kyang lus la ci ran pa'i gos gyon no //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams kyi ni dpag bsam shing las byung ba'i gos khru brgyad cu pa gyon no // rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha rnams kyang lus la ci ran pa'i gos gyon no //
translated: The garments of the gods of the second meditation are eight fingers in width and forty fingers in length.🔽The garments of the gods of the third meditation are sixteen fingers in width and eighty fingers in length.🔽The garments of the gods of the fourth meditation are one hundred twenty fingers in width and one hundred twenty fingers in length.🔽The garments of the gods of the realm of desire are of various sizes, according to the species.

original: rgyal chen bzhi pa lha rnams kyi ji lta ba bzhin du sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams dang / tshangs ris pa rnams dang /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi pa lha rnams kyi ji lta ba bzhin du sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams dang / tshangs ris pa rnams dang /
translated: The gods of the realm of desire and the gods of the realm of fine-materiality, from the Brahmakayika gods to the Akaniṣṭha gods, are clothed.

original: tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams dang / tshangs pa chen po pa rnams dang / 'od chung ba rnams dang / tshad med 'od ba rnams dang / 'od gsal ba rnams dang / dge chung ba rnams dang / tshad med dge ba rnams dang /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams dang / tshangs pa chen po pa rnams dang / 'od chung ba rnams dang / tshad med 'od ba rnams dang / 'od gsal ba rnams dang / dge chung ba rnams dang / tshad med dge ba rnams dang /
translated: The Brahmakāyika gods, the Brahmapurohita gods, the Mahābrahma gods, the Parīttābha gods, the Apramāṇābha gods, the Ābhāsvara gods, the Parīttaśubha gods, the Apramāṇaśubha gods,

original: dge rgyas pa rnams dang / sprin med pa rnams dang / bsod nams skyes pa rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang ba rnams dang / shin tu mthong ba rnams dang /
analyzed: dge rgyas pa rnams dang / sprin med pa rnams dang / bsod nams skyes pa rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang ba rnams dang / shin tu mthong ba rnams dang /
translated: the Śubhakṛtsna gods, the Anabhraka gods, the Puṇyaprasava gods, the Brhatphala gods, the Avṛha gods, the Atapa gods, the Sudarśana gods, the Sudṛśa gods,

original: 'og min pa rnams kyi yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'og min pa rnams kyi yang de bzhin no //
translated: and the Akaniṣṭha gods are also like this.

original: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams dbang po tha dad do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams dbang po tha dad do //
translated: Just as humans of Jambudvīpa have different faculties.🔽Some have the female faculty, some have the male faculty, in the same way, the gods of Videha in the east

original: kha cig la ni mo'i dbang po dang / kha cig la ni pho'i dbang po yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams dang / nub kyi @11a * //
analyzed: kha cig la ni mo'i dbang po dang / kha cig la ni pho'i dbang po yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams dang / nub kyi @11a * //
translated: and the gods of Godānīya in the west

original: ba lang spyod pa rnams dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams dang / rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang /
analyzed: ba lang spyod pa rnams dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams dang / rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang /
translated: the humans of Godaniya, the humans of Kuru, the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings, the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the gods of the Heaven Free from Strife, the gods of the Heaven of Joy, the gods of the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations,🔽

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams la yang yang yod do //🔽tshangs ris kyi lha rnams la ni mo'i dbang po yang med /
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams la yang yang yod do // tshangs ris kyi lha rnams la ni mo'i dbang po yang med /
translated: The gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings, the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the Heaven Free from Strife, the Heaven of Joy, the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations, and the Heaven of Making Use of Others’ Emanations all have both male and female faculties.

original: pho'i dbang po yang med do //
analyzed: pho'i dbang po yang med do //
translated: The gods of the Brahmakayika class have neither male nor female faculties.

original: tshangs ris pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin du tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams dang / tshangs pa chen po rnams dang / 'od chung ba rnams dang / tshad med 'od pa rnams dang / 'od gsal ba rnams dang / dge chung ba rnams dang /
analyzed: tshangs ris pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin du tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams dang / tshangs pa chen po rnams dang / 'od chung ba rnams dang / tshad med 'od pa rnams dang / 'od gsal ba rnams dang / dge chung ba rnams dang /
translated: Just as the Brahmakayika gods, so too the gods of the Brahmapurohita, Mahabrahma, Parittashubha, Apramanashubha, and Shubhakrisha classes have neither male nor female faculties.

original: tshad med dge ba rnams dang / dge rgyas pa rnams dang / sprin med pa rnams dang / bsod nams skyes pa rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang ba rnams dang /
analyzed: tshad med dge ba rnams dang / dge rgyas pa rnams dang / sprin med pa rnams dang / bsod nams skyes pa rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang ba rnams dang /
translated: the gods of the four levels of Brahmakayika, the four levels of Brahmapurohita, the four levels of Brahmapārṣada, the two levels of Parīttābha, the two levels of Apramāṇābha, the two levels of Ābhāsvara, the two levels of Parīttaśubha, the two levels of Apramāṇaśubha, the two levels of Śubhakṛtsna, the two levels of Bṛhatphala, the two levels of Avṛha, the two levels of Atapa, the two levels of Sudarśana, the two levels of Sudṛśa, and the Akaniṣṭha gods.🔽

original: shin tu mthong ba rnams dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: shin tu mthong ba rnams dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The gods of the realm of desire are the Four Great Kings, the Thirty-three gods, the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods, the gods of the realm of finemateriality are the Brahmakāyika gods, the Brahmapurohita gods, the Brahmapārṣadya gods, the Parīttābha gods, the Apramāṇābha gods, the Ābhāsvara gods, the Parīttaśubha gods, the Apramāṇaśubha gods, the Śubhakṛtsna gods, the Anabhraka gods, the Puṇyaprasava gods, the Bṛhatphala gods, the Avṛha gods, the Atapa gods, the Sudarśana gods, the Sudṛśa gods, and the Akaniṣṭha gods.

original: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la bag ma gtong ba dang / bag ma len pa yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams la yang yod do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la bag ma gtong ba dang / bag ma len pa yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams la yang yod do //
translated: Just as there is marriage among humans of Jambudvīpa, so too among the humans of Videha in the east and Godānīya in the west.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams la ni med do //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams la ni med do //
translated: But not among the humans of Kuru in the north.

original: rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams la yang yod do //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams la yang yod do //
translated: The gods of the Four Great Kings, the Thirty-three, the Yāma gods, the Joyous, the Creation at Will, and the Controlling Others’ Creations also have this.

original: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams la ni bag ma gtong ba yang med len pa yang med do //
analyzed: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams la ni bag ma gtong ba yang med len pa yang med do //
translated: The Brahmakāyika gods do not give or receive a bride.

original: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams dang / tshangs pa chen po pa rnams dang / 'od chung ba rnams dang / tshad med 'od pa rnams dang / 'od gsal ba rnams dang / dge chung ba rnams dang /
analyzed: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams dang / tshangs pa chen po pa rnams dang / 'od chung ba rnams dang / tshad med 'od pa rnams dang / 'od gsal ba rnams dang / dge chung ba rnams dang /
translated: Just as with the Brahmakāyika gods, the same is true of the gods of Brahmapurohita, Mahābrahma, Parīttābha, Apramāṇābha, Ābhāsvara, Parīttaśubha,

original: tshad med dge rnams dang / dge rgyas pa rnams dang / sprin med pa rnams dang / bsod nams skyes pa rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang ba rnams dang /
analyzed: tshad med dge rnams dang / dge rgyas pa rnams dang / sprin med pa rnams dang / bsod nams skyes pa rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang ba rnams dang /
translated: the gods of the Brahma group of the first concentration, the gods of limited radiance, the gods of unlimited radiance, the gods of complete radiance, the gods of limited virtue, the gods of unlimited virtue, the gods of abundant virtue, the gods of no clouds, the gods of merit-born, the gods of great fruit, the gods of no heat, the gods of pleasant appearance,

original: shin tu mthong ba rnams dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: shin tu mthong ba rnams dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams la yang de bzhin no //
translated: the gods of excellent vision, and the Akaniṣṭha gods.

original: 'jig rten gzhag pa las tshig @11b bzhi pa'o /🔽// /'jig rten gzhag pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhag pa las tshig @11b bzhi pa'o / // /'jig rten gzhag pa /
translated: This concludes the fourth chapter on the arrangement of the world.

original: bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: bam po gnyis pa /
translated: Chapter Five: The Arrangement of the World🔽In the sutra it is said:🔽Cold, hot, seasons, night and day,🔽parents, master and servant,

original: mdo la / grang dang tsha dang dus tshigs mtshan mo dang // pha ma dang ni rje khol dang // nor dang 'bru dang mngon bar zhe na //
analyzed: mdo la / grang dang tsha dang dus tshigs mtshan mo dang // pha ma dang ni rje khol dang // nor dang 'bru dang mngon bar zhe na //
translated: wealth, grain, and what is desired,

original: bcu tshan yongs su brjod pa yin //
analyzed: bcu tshan yongs su brjod pa yin //
translated: are the ten sets that are fully explained.

original: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la shin tu grang ba dang / shin tu tsha ba yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams la yang yod do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la shin tu grang ba dang / shin tu tsha ba yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams la yang yod do //
translated: The inhabitants of Jambudvīpa are subject to great cold and great heat. The same for the inhabitants of Pūrvavideha and of Avaragodānīya.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams la ni med do //🔽rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams la yang med do //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams la ni med do // rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams la yang med do //
translated: But the inhabitants of Kuru in the north are not subject to these two kinds of suffering.

original: de yan chad la yang med do //
analyzed: de yan chad la yang med do //
translated: The Cāturmahārājakāyikas are not subject to great cold or great heat.

original: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la dus tshigs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la dus tshigs 'di lta ste /
translated: The same for the Trāyastriṃśas and the Yāmas.🔽The Tuṣitas are not subject to great cold.🔽The Nirmāṇaratis are not subject to great heat.🔽The Paranirmitavaśavartins are not subject to either great cold or great heat.

original: dgun dang dpyid dang dbyar yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang /
analyzed: dgun dang dpyid dang dbyar yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang /
translated: The gods of the realm of fine-materiality are not subject to either great cold or great heat.🔽The gods of the realm of immateriality are not subject to any suffering of the body.

original: 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan ba rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams la yang yod do //
analyzed: 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan ba rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams la yang yod do //
translated: The gods of the realm of fine-materiality have only two seasons, summer and winter.

original: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams la ni dus tshigs med do //
analyzed: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams la ni dus tshigs med do //
translated: The gods of the realm of immateriality have no day and night.🔽The gods of the realm of desire have a day and a night the length of the life of the gods of the realm of fine-materiality.

original: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du changs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams dang / tshangs pa chen po rnams dang / 'od chung ba rnams dang / tshad med 'od pa rnams dang / 'od gsal ba rnams dang / dge chung ba rnams dang /🔽tshad med dge ba rnams dang / dge rgyas pa rnams dang / sprin med pa rnams dang / bsod nams skyes pa rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang ba rnams dang /
analyzed: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du changs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams dang / tshangs pa chen po rnams dang / 'od chung ba rnams dang / tshad med 'od pa rnams dang / 'od gsal ba rnams dang / dge chung ba rnams dang / tshad med dge ba rnams dang / dge rgyas pa rnams dang / sprin med pa rnams dang / bsod nams skyes pa rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang ba rnams dang /
translated: The gods of the realm of fine-materiality have a day and a night the length of the life of the gods of the realm of desire.

original: shin tu mthong ba rnams dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: shin tu mthong ba rnams dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The gods of the realm of immateriality have a day and a night the length of their life.🔽The life of the gods of the realm of desire is calculated in eons the length of which is equal to the length of a day in the corresponding hell.🔽The life of the gods of the realm of fine-materiality is calculated in eons the length of which is equal to the length of a day in the corresponding hell.🔽The life of the gods of the realm of immateriality is calculated in eons the length of which is equal to the length of a day in the corresponding hell.

original: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la mtshan mo dang / nyin mo yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams dang /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la mtshan mo dang / nyin mo yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams dang /
translated: Just as there is night and day for humans of Jambudvīpa, so too there is night and day for humans of Videha in the east, Godānīya in the west, Kuru in the north, the Caturmahārājika gods and so on up to the Yāma gods.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams la yang yod do //🔽tshangs ris kyi lha rnams la ni mtshan mo yang med /

translated: However, there is neither night nor day for the Tṛaśaiḥsasa gods, nor for the Yāma gods, nor for the Tuṣita gods, nor for the Nirmāṇarati gods, nor for the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods.

original: @12a * // nyin mo yang med /
analyzed: @12a * // nyin mo yang med /
translated: There is neither night nor day for the Brahmakāyika gods.

original: tshad med dge ba rnams dang / dge rgyas pa rnams dang / sprin med pa rnams dang / bsod nams skyes pa rnams dang / 'bras bu tsha ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang ba rnams dang /

analyzed: shin tu mthong ba rnams dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams la yang de bzhin no //

translated: Just as there are fathers and mothers among humans of Jambudvīpa, so too there are fathers and mothers among the humans of Videha in the east, Godānīya in the west, Kuru in the north, and among the gods of the Four Great Kings.

analyzed: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams la ni rje bo yang med bran yang med do //
translated: The gods of the realm of fine-materiality are the Brahmakāyikas,🔽the Brahmapurohitas, the Brahmapārṣadyas,🔽the Parīttābhas, the Apramāṇābhas, the Ābhāsvaras,🔽the Parīttaśubhas, the Apramāṇaśubhas, the Śubhakṛtsnas,🔽the Bṛhatphalas, the Avṛhas, the Atapapas, the Sudarśanas, and the Akaniṣṭhas.🔽The gods of the realm of immateriality are the Ākāśānantyāyatanas, the Vijñānānantyāyatanas, the Ākiñcanyāyatanas, and the Naivasamjñānāsamjñāyatanas.

original: tshangs ris pa rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams dang / tshangs pa chen po pa rnams dang / 'od chung ba rnams dang / tshad med 'od pa rnams dang / 'ong gsal ba rnams dang / dge chung ba rnams dang /🔽tshad med dge ba rnams dang / dge rgyas pa rnams dang / sprin med pa rnams dang / bsod nams skyes pa rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang ba rnams dang /

analyzed: shin tu mthong ba rnams dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The gods of the Brahmakayika realm, the Brahmapurohita realm, the Mahabrahma realm, the Parittashubha realm, the Apramanashubha realm, the Abashubha realm, the Paritta shubha realm, the Apramanashubha realm, the Shubhakrtsna realm, the Anabhraka realm, the Punyaprasava realm, the Brihatphala realm, the Avriha realm, the Atapa realm, the Sudarshana realm, the Sudarshana realm, and the Akanishtha realm are also like this.

translated: Gods of the Thirty-Three, Yāma, Tuṣita, Nirmāṇarati, and Para­nirmitavaśavartin are like the Four Great Kings.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang ni lo drug lon pa ji tsam pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang ni lo drug lon pa ji tsam pa bzhin no //
translated: The gods of the realm of desire are born from a womb, like humans.🔽The gods of the realm of desire are born from

original: 'thab bral ba rnams kyi ni lo bdun lon pa ji tsam pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'thab bral ba rnams kyi ni lo bdun lon pa ji tsam pa bzhin no //
translated: The gods of the Yama heaven live a half-eon.🔽

original: dga' ldan @13b ldan ba rnams kyi ni lo brgyad lon pa ji tsam pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dga' ldan @13b ldan ba rnams kyi ni lo brgyad lon pa ji tsam pa bzhin no //
translated: The gods of Yāma have the size of a child of eight years old.

original: 'phrul dga' ba rnams kyi ni lo dgu lon pa ji tsam pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'phrul dga' ba rnams kyi ni lo dgu lon pa ji tsam pa bzhin no //
translated: The Tuṣitas have the size of a child of nine years old.🔽The Nirmāṇaratis have the size of a child of ten years old.🔽The Paranirmitavaśavartins have the size of a child of twelve years old.

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams kyi ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi bu pho dang bu mo lo bcu lon pa ji tsam pa de bzhin du lha 'am lha'i bu mo'i phrag pa 'am phang par rdzus te skye ba'i sems can 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams kyi ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi bu pho dang bu mo lo bcu lon pa ji tsam pa de bzhin du lha 'am lha'i bu mo'i phrag pa 'am phang par rdzus te skye ba'i sems can 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The gods of the realm of desire are born in the womb, on the back or in the lap of a god or goddess.

original: de na lha 'am lha'i bu mo dag 'di snyam du 'di ni bdag gi bu 'am bu mo snyam du sems so //
analyzed: de na lha 'am lha'i bu mo dag 'di snyam du 'di ni bdag gi bu 'am bu mo snyam du sems so //
translated: The god or goddess thinks: “This is my son or my daughter.”

original: khye'u dang bu mo dag kyang 'di snyam du 'di ni bdag cag gi ma 'am pha'o snyam du sems so //
analyzed: khye'u dang bu mo dag kyang 'di snyam du 'di ni bdag cag gi ma 'am pha'o snyam du sems so //
translated: The child also thinks: “This is my father or my mother.”

original: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams ni thog ma nas lus kyi yan lag dang nyid lag thams cad rdzogs par skye zhing 'chi ba na yang de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams ni thog ma nas lus kyi yan lag dang nyid lag thams cad rdzogs par skye zhing 'chi ba na yang de kho na nyid do //
translated: The Brahmakāyika gods are born with all their limbs and organs complete.

original: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams ji lta ba bzhin du tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams dang / tshangs pa chen po pa rnams dang / 'od chung ba rnams dang / tshad med 'od pa rnams dang / 'od gsal ba rnams dang / dge chung ba rnams dang /
analyzed: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams ji lta ba bzhin du tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams dang / tshangs pa chen po pa rnams dang / 'od chung ba rnams dang / tshad med 'od pa rnams dang / 'od gsal ba rnams dang / dge chung ba rnams dang /
translated: The Brahmapurohita gods, the Mahābrahma gods, the Parīttābha gods, the Apramāṇābha gods, the Ābhāsvara gods, the Parīttaśubha gods,

original: tshad med dge ba rnams dang / dge rgyas pa rnams dang / sprin med pa rnams dang / bsod nams skyes pa rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang ba rnams dang /
analyzed: tshad med dge ba rnams dang / dge rgyas pa rnams dang / sprin med pa rnams dang / bsod nams skyes pa rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang ba rnams dang /
translated: the Apramāṇaśubha gods, the Śubhakṛtsna gods, the Anabhraka gods, the Puṇyaprasava gods, the Bṛhatphala gods, the Avṛha gods, the Atapa gods, the Sudarśana gods,

original: shin tu mthong ba rnams dang / 'og min pa rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: shin tu mthong ba rnams dang / 'og min pa rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: and the Akaniṣṭha gods are born in the same way and die in the same way.

original: gzugs med pa rnams la lus kyi gzugs med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams la lus kyi gzugs med do //
translated: The gods of the realm of fine-materiality do not have a body made of the four elements.

original: de bas na de dag gi skye ba yang mi mngon /
analyzed: de bas na de dag gi skye ba yang mi mngon /
translated: Thus, their birth is not evident,

original: 'chi ba yang mi mngon no //
analyzed: 'chi ba yang mi mngon no //
translated: and their death is not evident.

original: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams mi tshangs par spyod pa 'khrig pa'i chos bsten pa ni gnyis kyis gnyis sbyor ba yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams dang /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams mi tshangs par spyod pa 'khrig pa'i chos bsten pa ni gnyis kyis gnyis sbyor ba yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams dang /
translated: Just as humans of Jambudvīpa engage in sexual union through the joining of two organs in order to enjoy sexual intercourse, so too do the humans of Videha in the east, Godānīya in the west, and Kuru in the north.

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang de bzhin no //
translated: The gods of the four great kings and the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-three do the same.

original: 'thab bral ba rnams ni 'khyud pa tsam gyis gdung ba zhi par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'thab bral ba rnams ni 'khyud pa tsam gyis gdung ba zhi par 'gyur ro //
translated: The gods of the Yāma Heaven experience relief from passion merely through embracing.

original: dga' ldan pa rnams kyi ni lag pa nas bzung ba tsam gyis so //🔽'phrul dga' ba rnams kyi ni bgad pa tsam gyis so //
analyzed: dga' ldan pa rnams kyi ni lag pa nas bzung ba tsam gyis so // 'phrul dga' ba rnams kyi ni bgad pa tsam gyis so //
translated: The gods of Tuṣita experience relief from passion merely through holding hands.🔽The gods of the Heaven of the Masters of Others’ Creations experience relief from passion merely through smiling at one another.

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams kyi ni bltas pa tsam gyis gdung ba zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams kyi ni bltas pa tsam gyis gdung ba zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The gods of the Highest Heaven experience relief from passion merely through looking at one another.

original: tshangs ris pa rnams la ni 'dod chags @14a * //🔽med do // tshangs ris pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin du tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams dang / tshangs pa chen po pa rnams dang / 'od chung ba rnams dang / tshad med 'od pa rnams dang / 'od gsal ba rnams dang / dge chung ba rnams dang /🔽tshad med dge ba rnams dang / dge rgyas par nams dang / sprin med pa rnams dang / bsod nams skyes pa rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang ba rnams dang /
analyzed: tshangs ris pa rnams la ni 'dod chags @14a * // med do // tshangs ris pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin du tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams dang / tshangs pa chen po pa rnams dang / 'od chung ba rnams dang / tshad med 'od pa rnams dang / 'od gsal ba rnams dang / dge chung ba rnams dang / tshad med dge ba rnams dang / dge rgyas par nams dang / sprin med pa rnams dang / bsod nams skyes pa rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang ba rnams dang /
translated: The Brahmakayikas do not have sexual desire.

original: shin tu mthong ba rnams dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyang de bzhin no//
analyzed: shin tu mthong ba rnams dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyang de bzhin no//
translated: The Brahmapurohitas, Mahabrahmans, Parittabhas, Apramanabhas, Abhasvaras, Parittasubhas, Apramanasubhas, Subhakṛtsnas, Anabhrakas, Punyaprasavas, Brihatphalas, Avrihas, Atapa, Sudarśanas, Sudṛśas, and Akaniṣṭhas do not have sexual desire.

original: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la khu chu mi gtsang ba yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la khu chu mi gtsang ba yod pa bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags pa rnams dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod pa rnams dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams la yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as the humans of Jambudvīpa have semen, in the same way, the humans of Videha in the east, Godānīya in the west, and Kuru in the north have semen.

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams la rlung 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams la rlung 'byung ngo //
translated: The gods of the assembly of the Four Great Kings have wind.

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams ji lta ba bzhin du sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams kyi yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams ji lta ba bzhin du sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral ba rnams dang / dga' ldan pa rnams dang / 'phrul dga' ba rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams kyi yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as the gods of the assembly of the Four Great Kings have wind, in the same way, the gods of the Thirty-Three, Yāma, Tuṣita, Nirmāṇarati, and Paranirmitavaśavartin have wind.

original: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams la ni 'dod chags med do //
analyzed: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams la ni 'dod chags med do //
translated: The gods of Brahmakāyika do not have semen.

original: tshangs ris pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin du tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams dang / tshangs pa chen po pa rnams dang / 'od chung ba rnams dang / tshad med 'od pa rnams dang / 'od gsal ba rnams dang / dge chung ba rnams dang /
analyzed: tshangs ris pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin du tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa rnams dang / tshangs pa chen po pa rnams dang / 'od chung ba rnams dang / tshad med 'od pa rnams dang / 'od gsal ba rnams dang / dge chung ba rnams dang /
translated: The lifespan of the gods of Mahabrahma is three great eons.🔽The lifespan of the gods of Parittashubha is four great eons.🔽The lifespan of the gods of Apramanashubha is eight great eons.🔽The lifespan of the gods of Abhasvara is sixteen great eons.🔽The lifespan of the gods of Paritta shubha is thirty-two great eons.🔽The lifespan of the gods of Apramanashubha is sixty-four great eons.🔽The lifespan of the gods of Shubhakrtsna is one hundred twenty-five great eons.🔽The lifespan of the gods of Anabhraka is two hundred fifty great eons.🔽The lifespan of the gods of Punyaprasava is five hundred great eons.

original: tshad med dge ba rnams dang / dge rgyas pa rnams dang / sprin med pa rnams dang / bsod nams skyes pa rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang ba rnams dang /
analyzed: tshad med dge ba rnams dang / dge rgyas pa rnams dang / sprin med pa rnams dang / bsod nams skyes pa rnams dang / 'bras bu che ba rnams dang / mi che ba rnams dang / mi gdung ba rnams dang / gya nom snang ba rnams dang /
translated: The lifespan of the gods of Bṛhatphala is one thousand great eons.

original: shin tu mthong ba rnams dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: shin tu mthong ba rnams dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The lifespan of the gods of Avṛha is two thousand great eons.🔽The lifespan of the gods of Atapa is four thousand great eons.🔽The lifespan of the gods of Sudarśana is eight thousand great eons.🔽The lifespan of the gods of Sudarśana is eight thousand great eons.🔽The lifespan of the gods of Akaniṣṭha is sixteen thousand great eons.

original: sems can dmyal ba'i sems can gyi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni bskal pa gcig ste /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i sems can gyi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni bskal pa gcig ste /
translated: The lifespan of the sentient beings of the hells is one great eon.

original: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
translated: There is premature death.

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni mtha'i bskal pa gcig ste /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi tshe'i tshad ni mtha'i bskal pa gcig ste /
translated: The lifespan of animals is one great eon.

original: bar mdo'i 'chi ba ni yod do //
analyzed: bar mdo'i 'chi ba ni yod do //
translated: But death in the intermediate period does occur.

original: mi rnams kyi nyin zhag sum cu gang yin pa de ni yi dags rnams kyi nyin gcig ste /
analyzed: mi rnams kyi nyin zhag sum cu gang yin pa de ni yi dags rnams kyi nyin gcig ste /
translated: Thirty of your days is one day for hungry ghosts.

original: nyin zhag @14b de sum cu la zla ba gcig / zla ba bcu gnyis la lo gcig ste /
analyzed: nyin zhag @14b de sum cu la zla ba gcig / zla ba bcu gnyis la lo gcig ste /
translated: Thirty of these days is one month. Twelve of these months is one year.

original: yi dags rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni lo de lta bur brtsis pa'i lo lnga brgya ste /
analyzed: yi dags rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni lo de lta bur brtsis pa'i lo lnga brgya ste /
translated: The maximum lifespan of hungry ghosts is five hundred years calculated in this way.

original: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
translated: But death in the intermediate period does occur.

original: de mi'i ltar brtsis na lo khri lnga stong yod do //
analyzed: de mi'i ltar brtsis na lo khri lnga stong yod do //
translated: This is fifteen thousand years in the human realm.

original: shar gyi lus 'phags kyi mi rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni lo nyis brgya lnga bcu ste /
analyzed: shar gyi lus 'phags kyi mi rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni lo nyis brgya lnga bcu ste /
translated: The maximum lifespan of humans in Videha in the east is two hundred and fifty years.

original: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
translated: But death in the intermediate period does occur.

original: nub kyi ba lang spyod kyi mi rnams kyi tshe'i chad kyi mtha' ni lo lnga brgya ste /
analyzed: nub kyi ba lang spyod kyi mi rnams kyi tshe'i chad kyi mtha' ni lo lnga brgya ste /
translated: The maximum lifespan of humans in Godaniya in the west is five hundred years.

original: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
translated: But death in the intermediate period does occur.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni lo stong ste /
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni lo stong ste /
translated: The lifespan of humans of Uttarakuru is fixed at one thousand years.

original: bar ma dor 'chi ba med do //
analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba med do //
translated: There is no premature death.

original: ci'i phyir byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams ni bar ma dor 'chi ba med ce na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams ni bar ma dor 'chi ba med ce na //
translated: Why is there no premature death among humans of Uttarakuru?

original: de dag la bdag gi med cing yongs su 'dzin pa med de /
analyzed: de dag la bdag gi med cing yongs su 'dzin pa med de /
translated: They have no sense of property and no possessiveness.

original: tshe nges shing khyad par du 'gro ba yin pas de'i phyir byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams la bar mdor 'chi ba med do //
analyzed: tshe nges shing khyad par du 'gro ba yin pas de'i phyir byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi mi rnams la bar mdor 'chi ba med do //
translated: Their lifespan is fixed and they do not die before their natural lifespan is exhausted.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la ni yar skye ba dang / mar 'gro ba yod de /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams la ni yar skye ba dang / mar 'gro ba yod de /
translated: Humans of Jambudvipa have a lifespan that increases and decreases.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams res 'ga' ni tshe dpag tu med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams res 'ga' ni tshe dpag tu med par 'gyur la /
translated: Sometimes the lifespan of humans of Jambudvipa is immeasurable.

original: res 'ga' ni tshe lo bcu par 'gyur la /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni tshe lo bcu par 'gyur la /
translated: Sometimes it is ten years.

original: mi rnams kyi tshe lo lnga bcu gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: mi rnams kyi tshe lo lnga bcu gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Fifty years in the human realm

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams kyi nyin zhag gcig go //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams kyi nyin zhag gcig go //
translated: is one day and night for the Four Great Kings.

original: nyin zhag de sum cu la zla ba gcig go //
analyzed: nyin zhag de sum cu la zla ba gcig go //
translated: Thirty of their days make a month.

original: zla ba bcu gnyis la lo gcig ste /
analyzed: zla ba bcu gnyis la lo gcig ste /
translated: Twelve of those months is one year.

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni lo de lta bur brtsis pa'i lha'i lo lnga brgya ste /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni lo de lta bur brtsis pa'i lha'i lo lnga brgya ste /
translated: The lifespan of the gods of the Four Great Kings is five hundred years of such days.

original: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
translated: But they can die in the interim.

original: de mi'i ltar brtsis na lo sa ya phrag dgu yod do //
analyzed: de mi'i ltar brtsis na lo sa ya phrag dgu yod do //
translated: That is nine million human years.

original: de ni sems can dmyal ba chen po yang sos kyi nyin zhag gcig go //
analyzed: de ni sems can dmyal ba chen po yang sos kyi nyin zhag gcig go //
translated: That is one day and night for the great hell beings of the Reviving Hell.

original: nyin zhag de sum cu la zla ba gcig / zla ba bcu gnyis la lo gcig ste /
analyzed: nyin zhag de sum cu la zla ba gcig / zla ba bcu gnyis la lo gcig ste /
translated: Thirty of those days make one month, and twelve of those months make one year.

original: sems can dmyal ba yang sos kyi sems can rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni de lo lta bur brtsis pa'i sems can dmyal ba pa'i lo lnga brgya ste /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba yang sos kyi sems can rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni de lo lta bur brtsis pa'i sems can dmyal ba pa'i lo lnga brgya ste /
translated: The lifespan of the hell beings of the Reviving Hell is five hundred years of such years.

original: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
translated: But they can die in the interim.

original: de mi'i ltar brtsis na lo bye ba phrag 'bum drug khri nyis stong yod do //
analyzed: de mi'i ltar brtsis na lo bye ba phrag 'bum drug khri nyis stong yod do //
translated: That is one hundred and sixty-two trillion human years.

original: mi rnams kyi lo brgya gang yin pa de ni sum cu rtsa gsum gyi nyin zhag gcig go //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi lo brgya gang yin pa de ni sum cu rtsa gsum gyi nyin zhag gcig go //
translated: One hundred human years is one day for the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: nyin zhag de sum cu la zla ba gcig / zla ba bcu gnyis la lo gcig ste /🔽sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni de lta bur brtsis @15a * //
analyzed: nyin zhag de sum cu la zla ba gcig / zla ba bcu gnyis la lo gcig ste / sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni de lta bur brtsis @15a * //
translated: Thirty of those days make one month, and twelve of those months make one year.

original: pa'i lha'i lo stong ste /
analyzed: pa'i lha'i lo stong ste /
translated: The lifespan of the gods of Trayastrimsa is one thousand of those celestial years.

original: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
translated: But they can die in the interim.

original: de mi'i ltar brtsis na lo bye ba phrag gsum dang sa ya phrag drug yod do //
analyzed: de mi'i ltar brtsis na lo bye ba phrag gsum dang sa ya phrag drug yod do //
translated: When calculated in terms of human years, that is three million six hundred thousand years.

original: de ni sems can dmyal ba chen po thig nag gi nyin zhag gcig go //🔽nyin zhag de sum cu la zla ba gcig go //

translated: Thirty of those days make one month, and twelve of those months make one year.

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po thig nag gi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni lo de lta bur brtsis pa'i sems can dmyal ba'i lo stong ste /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po thig nag gi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni lo de lta bur brtsis pa'i sems can dmyal ba'i lo stong ste /

analyzed: de mi'i ltar brtsis na lo bye ba phrag 'bum phrag bcu gnyis dang / bye ba phrag dgu khri drug stong yod do //
translated: When calculated in terms of human years, that is 12,960 million years.

analyzed: mi rnams kyi lo nyis brgya gang yin pa de ni 'thab bral gyi lha rnams kyi nyin zhag gcig go //

analyzed: nyin zhag de sum cu la zla ba gcig / zla ba bcu gnyis la lo gcig ste /
translated: Thirty of their days make a month, and twelve of those months make a year.

analyzed: 'thab bral ba'i lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni lo de lta bur brtsis pa'i lha'i lo nyis stong ste /

original: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
translated: But they can die before then.

analyzed: de ni sems can dmyal ba chen po bsdus gzhom gyi nyin zhag gcig go //
translated: That is one day and night for the beings in the great hell Gathering and Crushing.

original: nyin zhag de sum cu la zla ba gcig / zla ba bcu gnyis la lo gcig ste /

analyzed: de mi'i ltar brtsis na lo bye ba phrag gcig dang / bye ba phrag sum 'bum drug khri brgyad stong yod do //

analyzed: mi rnams kyi lo bzhi brgya gang yin pa de ni dga' ldan gyi lha rnams kyi nyin zhag gcig go //

analyzed: nyin zhag sum cu la zla ba gcig /

analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //

analyzed: de ni sems can dmyal ba chen po ngu 'bod kyi nyin zhag gcig go //
translated: That is one day and night for the beings in the great hell of Saṃjīva.

analyzed: nyin zhag de sum cu la zla ba gcig / zla ba bcu gnyis la lo gcig ste /
translated: Thirty such days make a month. Twelve such months make a year.

analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //

analyzed: mi rnams kyi lo brgyad brgya gang yin pa de ni 'phrul dga' lha rnams kyi nyin zhag gcig go //

original: nyin zhag de sum cu la zla ba gcig go //
analyzed: nyin zhag de sum cu la zla ba gcig go //
translated: Thirty of their days is one month.

original: zla ba bcu gnyis la lo gcig ste /
analyzed: zla ba bcu gnyis la lo gcig ste /
translated: Twelve of their months is one year.

original: 'phrul dga'i lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni lo de lta bur brtsis pa'i lha'i lo brgyad stong ste /
analyzed: 'phrul dga'i lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni lo de lta bur brtsis pa'i lha'i lo brgyad stong ste /

original: bar mdo'i 'chi ba ni yod do //
analyzed: bar mdo'i 'chi ba ni yod do //
translated: But death does occur before then.

original: de mi'i ltar brtsis na lo bye ba phrag nyis brgya sum cu dang / lo sa ya phrag bzhi yod do //
analyzed: de mi'i ltar brtsis na lo bye ba phrag nyis brgya sum cu dang / lo sa ya phrag bzhi yod do //

original: de ni sems can dmyal ba chen po ngu 'bod chen po'i nyin zhag gcig go //
analyzed: de ni sems can dmyal ba chen po ngu 'bod chen po'i nyin zhag gcig go //
translated: This is one day and night in the great hell of Great Screaming.

original: nyin zhag de sum cu la zla ba gcig / zla ba bcu gnyis la lo gcig ste /
analyzed: nyin zhag de sum cu la zla ba gcig / zla ba bcu gnyis la lo gcig ste /
translated: Thirty of these days make a month, and twelve of these months make a year.

translated: But it is possible to die in the interim.🔽If calculated according to human years, it is 6,635,520,000 years.

analyzed: mi rnams kyi lo stong drug brgya gang yin pa de ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams kyi nyin zhag gcig go //
translated: One thousand six hundred human years is one day and night for the Paranirmitavasavartin gods.

original: nyin zhag de sum cu la zla ba gcig /
analyzed: nyin zhag de sum cu la zla ba gcig /
translated: Thirty of those days make one month.

original: zla ba bcu gnyis la lo gcig ste /
analyzed: zla ba bcu gnyis la lo gcig ste /
translated: Twelve of those months make one year.

original: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //

analyzed: de mi'i ltar brtsis na lo bye ba phrag dgu brgya nyi shu rtsa gcig dang / lo sa ya drug yod de /

analyzed: de ni sems can dmyal ba chen po tsha ba'i nyin zhag gcig go //
translated: That is one day and night for the beings in the Great Reviving Hell.

original: nyin zhag de sum cu la zla ba gcig / zla ba bcu gnyis la lo gcig ste /
analyzed: nyin zhag de sum cu la zla ba gcig / zla ba bcu gnyis la lo gcig ste /
translated: Thirty of those days make one month, and twelve of those months make one year.

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po tsha ba'i sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni lo de lta bur brtsis pa'i sems can dmyal ba pa'i lo khri drug stong ste /

original: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //

translated: If calculated in human years, this is 50 million years, 30 billion years, 8.84 trillion years, and 160,000 years.

original: bar gyi mdo la /
analyzed: bar gyi mdo la /
translated: In the intermediate-scope section of the Verses on the Essence of the Spirit of Awakening, it states:

original: dgu dang gsum dang bcu bzhi dang ni lnga bcu rtsa bdun dang // nyis brgya dgu brgya rnams ni mi yi grangs kyi lha tsher bshad //
analyzed: dgu dang gsum dang bcu bzhi dang ni lnga bcu rtsa bdun dang // nyis brgya dgu brgya rnams ni mi yi grangs kyi lha tsher bshad //
translated: Nine, three, fourteen, fifty-seven, two hundred, and nine hundred are explained as the lifespans of the gods in terms of human years.

original: de bzhin gcig dang bcu gnyis gcig dang brgyad dang drug bcu dang // lnga brgya dag ni sems can dmyal ba pa yi tsher bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gcig dang bcu gnyis gcig dang brgyad dang drug bcu dang // lnga brgya dag ni sems can dmyal ba pa yi tsher bshad do //
translated: Similarly, one, twelve, one, eight, sixty, and five hundred are explained as the lifespans of the hell beings.

original: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni bskal pa phyed de /
analyzed: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni bskal pa phyed de /

original: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
translated: However, premature death does occur.
