analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po rab tu tsha ba'i tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni bskal pa phyed de /
translated: The lifespan of the beings of the great hell Intense Heat is half an eon.

original: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
translated: However, premature death does occur.

analyzed: tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don pa'i lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni bskal pa gcig yin te /

analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //

analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //

analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //

analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //

analyzed: tshad med 'od kyi lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni bskal pa bzhi ste /

analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //

analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //

analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //

original: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
translated: Death before the end of that is possible.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni bskal pa drug khri ste /
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni bskal pa drug khri ste /
translated: The lifespan of the gods of the base of nothingness is 60,000 eons.

original: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //
translated: Death before the end of that is possible.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched pa'i lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni bskal pa brgyad khri ste /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched pa'i lha rnams kyi tshe'i tshad kyi mtha' ni bskal pa brgyad khri ste /
translated: The lifespan of the gods of the base of neither discrimination nor nondiscrimination is 80,000 eons.

original: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do //🔽'di nas byang phyogs na ri nag po gsum yod do //
analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do // 'di nas byang phyogs na ri nag po gsum yod do //
translated: Death before the end of that is possible.🔽To the north of here there are three black mountains.

original: ri nag po gsum po de dag gi byang phyogs na ri nag po gsum yod do //
analyzed: ri nag po gsum po de dag gi byang phyogs na ri nag po gsum yod do //
translated: To the north of those three black mountains there are three more black mountains.

original: ri nag po gzhan gsum po de dag gi byang phyogs na yang ri nag po gzhan gsum yod do //
analyzed: ri nag po gzhan gsum po de dag gi byang phyogs na yang ri nag po gzhan gsum yod do //
translated: To the north of these three other black mountains, there are three other black mountains.

original: ri nag po gzhan gsum po de dag gi byang phyogs na ri'i rgyal po gangs zhes bya ba yod do //
analyzed: ri nag po gzhan gsum po de dag gi byang phyogs na ri'i rgyal po gangs zhes bya ba yod do //
translated: To the north of these three other black mountains, there is a king of mountains called Himavat.

original: ri'i rgyal po gangs kyi byang phyogs na /
analyzed: ri'i rgyal po gangs kyi byang phyogs na /
translated: To the north of the king of mountains Himavat,

original: ri'i rgyal po spos kyi ngad ldang zhes bya ba yod do //
analyzed: ri'i rgyal po spos kyi ngad ldang zhes bya ba yod do //
translated: there is a king of mountains called Gandhamadana.

original: ri'i rgyal po spos kyi ngad ldang nas dpag tshad bcu'i tshu rol na mtsho chen po chu zhes bya ba zhig yod de /
analyzed: ri'i rgyal po spos kyi ngad ldang nas dpag tshad bcu'i tshu rol na mtsho chen po chu zhes bya ba zhig yod de /
translated: Ten leagues from the king of mountains Gandhamadana, there is a great lake called Anavatapta.

original: ma dros pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: ma dros pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: It is also called Manasa.

original: mtsho chen po chu zhes bya ba de la chur dpag tshad lnga bcu zheng du dpag tshad lnga bcu yod do //
analyzed: mtsho chen po chu zhes bya ba de la chur dpag tshad lnga bcu zheng du dpag tshad lnga bcu yod do //
translated: This great lake Anavatapta is fifty leagues wide and fifty leagues long.

original: mtha' skor du ni dpag tshad nyis brgya yod do //
analyzed: mtha' skor du ni dpag tshad nyis brgya yod do //
translated: It is two hundred leagues in circumference.

original: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa chu bsal zhing chu sbrang rtsi lta bus gang la /
analyzed: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa chu bsal zhing chu sbrang rtsi lta bus gang la /
translated: It is beautiful, pleasant to behold, clear, and filled with honey-like water.

original: me tog autpa la dang / padma dang / ku mu ta dang / padma dkar pos kun du khebs par 'dug go //
analyzed: me tog autpa la dang / padma dang / ku mu ta dang / padma dkar pos kun du khebs par 'dug go //
translated: It is covered with blue lotuses, red lotuses, night lotuses, and white lotuses.

original: de'i nang nas chu klung chen po bzhi 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i nang nas chu klung chen po bzhi 'di lta ste /
translated: Four great rivers flow from it:

original: gangg'a dang / sindhu dang / si ta dang / pakshu dang / 'di rnams 'bab ste /🔽gangg'a ni shar @17a * //
analyzed: gangg'a dang / sindhu dang / si ta dang / pakshu dang / 'di rnams 'bab ste / gangg'a ni shar @17a * //
translated: the Ganges, the Indus, the Vaksu, and the Sita.

original: phyogs nas glang po che'i kha nas 'bab ste /
analyzed: phyogs nas glang po che'i kha nas 'bab ste /
translated: The Ganges flows from the mouth of an elephant in the east.

original: mtsho chen po chu zhes bya ba'i g-yas phyogs su bskor nas /
analyzed: mtsho chen po chu zhes bya ba'i g-yas phyogs su bskor nas /
translated: It circles the great lake Anavatapta to the right

original: klung lnga brgya dang lhan cig tu shar phyogs gyi rgya mtsho chen por 'gro'o //
analyzed: klung lnga brgya dang lhan cig tu shar phyogs gyi rgya mtsho chen por 'gro'o //
translated: and flows into the great eastern ocean together with five hundred rivers.

original: sindhu ni lho phyogs nas khyu mchog gi kha nas 'bab ste /
analyzed: sindhu ni lho phyogs nas khyu mchog gi kha nas 'bab ste /
translated: The Indus flows from the mouth of a bull in the south.🔽It circles the great lake Anavatapta to the right

original: de ni mtsho chen po chu zhes bya ba'i g-yas phyogs su bskor nas klung lnga brgya dang lhan cig tu lho phyogs kyi rgya mtsho chen por 'gro'o //
analyzed: de ni mtsho chen po chu zhes bya ba'i g-yas phyogs su bskor nas klung lnga brgya dang lhan cig tu lho phyogs kyi rgya mtsho chen por 'gro'o //
translated: and flows into the great southern ocean together with five hundred rivers.

original: pakshu ni nub phyogs nas rta'i kha nas 'bab ste /
analyzed: pakshu ni nub phyogs nas rta'i kha nas 'bab ste /
translated: The Vaksu flows from the mouth of a horse in the west.

original: de ni mtsho chen po chu zhes bya ba'i g-yas phyogs su bskor nas /
analyzed: de ni mtsho chen po chu zhes bya ba'i g-yas phyogs su bskor nas /
translated: It circles the great lake called Water on the right

original: klung lnga brgya dang lhan cig tu nub phyogs kyi rgya mtsho chen por 'gro'o //
analyzed: klung lnga brgya dang lhan cig tu nub phyogs kyi rgya mtsho chen por 'gro'o //
translated: and flows into the great western ocean together with five hundred rivers.

original: si ta ni bya phyogs nas seng ge'i kha nas 'bab ste /
analyzed: si ta ni bya phyogs nas seng ge'i kha nas 'bab ste /
translated: The Sita flows from the mouth of a lion in the northeast.

original: de ni mtsho chen po chu zhes bya ba'i g-yas phyogs su bskor nas /
analyzed: de ni mtsho chen po chu zhes bya ba'i g-yas phyogs su bskor nas /
translated: It circles the great lake called Water on the right

analyzed: klung lnga brgya dang lhan cig tu byang phyogs kyi rgya mtsho chen por 'gro'o //
translated: and flows into the great northern ocean together with five hundred rivers.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: It is said:

analyzed: byang phyogs kha dgur 'gyur ba yi //

analyzed: chu mtsho yod de gzhan dag kyang //

analyzed: tha dad rgyu rnams 'byung gnas yod //

analyzed: chu klung gangg'a sindhu pakshu dang // si ta dpa' rlabs lbu ba'i phreng ba can //

analyzed: 'bab cing thams cad gsal ba'i chu yin te //

analyzed: phyogs bzhi khor khor yug dag nas 'byung //

original: gangg'a shar phyogs rgya mtsho ra 'gro ba ste //
analyzed: gangg'a shar phyogs rgya mtsho ra 'gro ba ste //

analyzed: sindhu lho phyogs rgya mtshor 'gro ba yin //

analyzed: ri spos kyi ngad ldang de'i byang phyogs dpag tshad nyi shu na gser gyi brag bya skyibs lha ma yin gyi ngos zhes bya ba yod de /

analyzed: mtha' skor du dpag tshad nyis brgya 'phang du dpag tshad phyed dang bzhi yod pa /

analyzed: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa zhig yod do //

analyzed: mdzes pa gser gyi bye ma bdal zhing tsandan gyi chus chag chag btab pa ste /
translated: It is spread with golden sand and sprinkled with sandalwood water.

translated: If anything unpleasant, such as wood or

analyzed: de'i khor khor yug na gser gyi brag bya skyibs can brgya stong yod do //

analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa ste /

original: de dag gi nang nas gzhi rnams kyang dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la /
analyzed: de dag gi nang nas gzhi rnams kyang dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la /

analyzed: de dag tu yang yid du mi 'ong ba shing ngam /

original: de'i lam srid du dpag tshad nyi shu /
analyzed: de'i lam srid du dpag tshad nyi shu /

analyzed: zheng du dpag tshad phyed dang gnyis yod pa dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa gser gyi phye ma bdal zhing tsandan gyi chus chag chag btab pa zhig yod de / de yang yid du mi 'ong ba shing ngam gseg ma'am /
translated: It is well-shaped, beautiful to behold, covered with golden sand and sprinkled with sandalwood water.

original: gang ci yang rung ba dag lhung na de mi ma yin pa rnams kyi rlung gi mthus phyi rol du 'dor ro //🔽brag bya skyibs lha ma yin gyi ngos de'i byang phyogs dpag tshad nyi shu na shing s'a la'i rgyal po chen po rab tu brtan pa zhes bya ba s'a la'i phreng ba rim pa bdun gyis bskor ba zhig yod do //
analyzed: gang ci yang rung ba dag lhung na de mi ma yin pa rnams kyi rlung gi mthus phyi rol du 'dor ro // brag bya skyibs lha ma yin gyi ngos de'i byang phyogs dpag tshad nyi shu na shing s'a la'i rgyal po chen po rab tu brtan pa zhes bya ba s'a la'i phreng ba rim pa bdun gyis bskor ba zhig yod do //
translated: If anything unpleasant, such as wood or gravel, falls into it, the non-human beings expel it outside by the power of their wind.🔽Twenty yojanas north of that side of the asuras is the great king of sala trees called Very Stable, surrounded by seven rows of sala trees.

original: s'a la'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa de'i rtsa ba ni 'dom bcu bzhi thur du zug go //
analyzed: s'a la'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa de'i rtsa ba ni 'dom bcu bzhi thur du zug go //
translated: The root of that king of sala trees, Very Stable, extends fourteen fathoms into the ground.

original: s'a la'i phreng ba dang po'i rtsa ba ni 'dom bcu gsum thur du zug go //
analyzed: s'a la'i phreng ba dang po'i rtsa ba ni 'dom bcu gsum thur du zug go //
translated: The roots of the first row of palm trees go down thirteen fathoms.

original: gnyis pa'i ni bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i ni bcu gnyis so //
translated: Those of the second, twelve.

original: gsum pa'i ni bcu gcig go //
analyzed: gsum pa'i ni bcu gcig go //
translated: Those of the third, eleven.

original: bzhi pa'i ni bcu'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa'i ni bcu'o //
translated: Those of the fourth, ten.

original: lnga pa'i ni dgu'o //
analyzed: lnga pa'i ni dgu'o //
translated: Those of the fifth, nine.

original: drug pa'i ni brgyad do //
analyzed: drug pa'i ni brgyad do //
translated: Those of the sixth, eight.

original: s'a la'i phreng ba bdun pa'i rtsa ba ni 'dom bdun thur du zug go //
analyzed: s'a la'i phreng ba bdun pa'i rtsa ba ni 'dom bdun thur du zug go //
translated: The roots of the seventh row of palm trees go down seven fathoms.

original: s'a la'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa de'i yal ga dang / lo ma dang yal ga rnams gang yin pa de ni s'a la'i phreng ba dang po la thug go //
analyzed: s'a la'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa de'i yal ga dang / lo ma dang yal ga rnams gang yin pa de ni s'a la'i phreng ba dang po la thug go //
translated: The branches, leaves and twigs of the king of palm trees, Firm, reach the first row of palm trees.

original: s'a la'i phreng ba dang po ni yal ga dang lo ma dang yal ga gang yin pa de ni gnyis pa la'o //
analyzed: s'a la'i phreng ba dang po ni yal ga dang lo ma dang yal ga gang yin pa de ni gnyis pa la'o //

analyzed: gnyis pa'i gang yin pa de ni gsum pa la'o //

original: gsum pa'i gang yin pa de ni bzhi pa la'o //
analyzed: gsum pa'i gang yin pa de ni bzhi pa la'o //

original: bzhi pa'i gang yin pa de ni lnga pa la'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa'i gang yin pa de ni lnga pa la'o //

original: lnga pa'i gang yin pa de ni drug pa la'o //
analyzed: lnga pa'i gang yin pa de ni drug pa la'o //

original: drug pa'i gang yin pa de ni bdun pa la'o //
analyzed: drug pa'i gang yin pa de ni bdun pa la'o //
translated: What is in the sixth is in the seventh.

original: s'a la'i phreng ba bdun pa'i yal ga dang / lo ma dang yal ga gang yin pa de ni nam mkha' khyab par 'dug go //
analyzed: s'a la'i phreng ba bdun pa'i yal ga dang / lo ma dang yal ga gang yin pa de ni nam mkha' khyab par 'dug go //

translated: The ground inside is

analyzed: mdzes pa gser gyi phye ma bdal zhing tsandan gyi chus chag chag btab pa ste / de yang yid du mi 'ong ba shing ngam gseg ma 'am /

analyzed: der yang yid du mi 'ong ba shing ngam /
translated: There are no unpleasant trees,🔽gravel,

original: gseg ma 'am /
analyzed: gseg ma 'am /
translated: or gravel,🔽

original: gang ci yang rung bdag lhung na de mi ma yin pa rnams kyi rlung gi mthus phyi rol du 'dor ro//
analyzed: gang ci yang rung bdag lhung na de mi ma yin pa rnams kyi rlung gi mthus phyi rol du 'dor ro//
translated: If they fall, non-humans throw them outside by the power of their wind.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi glang po che'i rgyal po g-yul dor chas pa rab tu brtan pa zhes bya ba gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa zhig yod de /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi glang po che'i rgyal po g-yul dor chas pa rab tu brtan pa zhes bya ba gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa zhig yod de /
translated: The gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three have a king of elephants named Stable Armor for Battle. He is well formed, attractive, and beautiful.

original: me tog ku mu ta'i mdog ltar thal kar du 'dug la /
analyzed: me tog ku mu ta'i mdog ltar thal kar du 'dug la /
translated: He is white like the color of a kumuta flower.

original: yan lag bdun shin tu legs par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: yan lag bdun shin tu legs par gnas pa ste /
translated: He has seven excellent limbs.

original: de mgo bo yang dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa ste /
analyzed: de mgo bo yang dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa ste /
translated: His head is well shaped, attractive, and beautiful.

original: sngo zhing srog chags lham bu chug sher gyi mdog ltar dbus dmar la mche ba drug yod de /
analyzed: sngo zhing srog chags lham bu chug sher gyi mdog ltar dbus dmar la mche ba drug yod de /
translated: It is blue with a red center like the color of a peacock’s neck and has six tusks.

original: glang po che rab tu brtan pa srid du dpag tshad phyed dang gsum /
analyzed: glang po che rab tu brtan pa srid du dpag tshad phyed dang gsum /
translated: The elephant Stable is one and a half leagues long,

original: zheng du dpag tshad gcig 'phang du dpag tshad phyed dang gnyis /
analyzed: zheng du dpag tshad gcig 'phang du dpag tshad phyed dang gnyis /
translated: one league wide, and one and a half leagues high.

original: mtha' skor du dpag tshad bdun yod do //
analyzed: mtha' skor du dpag tshad bdun yod do //
translated: It is seven leagues in circumference.

original: de'i 'khor glang po che brgyad stong yod do //
analyzed: de'i 'khor glang po che brgyad stong yod do //
translated: He has an entourage of eight thousand elephants.

original: de thams cad kyang gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug pa mdzes pa /
analyzed: de thams cad kyang gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug pa mdzes pa /
translated: All of them are well-formed, attractive, and beautiful.

original: me tog ku mu ta'i mdog ltar thal kar du 'dug cing yan lag bdun shin tu legs par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: me tog ku mu ta'i mdog ltar thal kar du 'dug cing yan lag bdun shin tu legs par gnas pa ste /
translated: They are white like the color of kumuda flowers, and their seven limbs are very well-placed.

original: de dag gi mgo bo yang dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi mgo bo yang dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa ste /
translated: Their heads are also well-shaped, attractive, and beautiful.

original: sngo zhing srog chags lham bu chu gsher gyi mdog ltar dbus dmar la mche ba drug yod pa sha stag ste /
analyzed: sngo zhing srog chags lham bu chu gsher gyi mdog ltar dbus dmar la mche ba drug yod pa sha stag ste /
translated: They are blue like the color of a water-born jewel, with red in the middle and six tusks.

original: glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa de 'khor dang bcas pa dgun zla ba bzhi ni brag bya skyibs lha ma yin gyi ngos kyi nang na gnas shing 'khod do //
analyzed: glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa de 'khor dang bcas pa dgun zla ba bzhi ni brag bya skyibs lha ma yin gyi ngos kyi nang na gnas shing 'khod do //
translated: That king of elephants, Supratiṣṭhita, together with his entourage, stays and resides in the inner part of the asura side of the cliff during the four winter months.

original: dpyid zla ba bzhi ni shing s'a la'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa'i nang na gnas shing 'khod do //
analyzed: dpyid zla ba bzhi ni shing s'a la'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa'i nang na gnas shing 'khod do //
translated: During the four spring months, he stays and resides in the inner part of the king of sāl trees, Supratiṣṭhita.

original: dbyar zla ba bzhi ni rdzing bu dal gyis 'bab kyi nang na gnas shing 'khod do //
analyzed: dbyar zla ba bzhi ni rdzing bu dal gyis 'bab kyi nang na gnas shing 'khod do //
translated: During the four summer months, he stays and resides in the pond of the gently flowing river.

original: gang gi tshe glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan @19a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan @19a * //
translated: When the king of elephants is very stable,🔽

original: pa brag bya skyibs lha ma yin gyi ngos kyi nang na gnas shing 'dug pa de'i tshe ni glang po che brgyad stong po rnams 'di lta ste /
analyzed: pa brag bya skyibs lha ma yin gyi ngos kyi nang na gnas shing 'dug pa de'i tshe ni glang po che brgyad stong po rnams 'di lta ste /
translated: When the king of elephants, Steadfast, was dwelling and staying in the interior of the cliff-face of the asuras, at that time the eight thousand elephants

original: glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa srung ba dang sba ba dang mdzes par bya ba'i phyir brag bya skyibs brgyad stong gi nang na nye bar gnas shing 'khod do //
analyzed: glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa srung ba dang sba ba dang mdzes par bya ba'i phyir brag bya skyibs brgyad stong gi nang na nye bar gnas shing 'khod do //
translated: were dwelling and staying in the interior of the eight thousand cliffs in order to protect, conceal, and beautify the king of elephants, Steadfast.

original: gang gi tshe glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa brag bya skyibs lha ma yin gyi ngos kyi nang na gnas shing s'a la'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa'i nang du 'gro ba na /🔽res 'ga' ni tha mal pa'i tshul gyis 'gro'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa brag bya skyibs lha ma yin gyi ngos kyi nang na gnas shing s'a la'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa'i nang du 'gro ba na / res 'ga' ni tha mal pa'i tshul gyis 'gro'o //
translated: When the king of elephants, Steadfast, was dwelling and staying in the interior of the cliff-face of the asuras, he went to the interior of the king of sāl trees, Steadfast.🔽Sometimes he went in an ordinary way.

original: res 'ga' ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Sometimes he went like this:

original: lha dang lha'i bu rdzu 'phrul che zhing gang yang rung ba dang 'dra bar bdag nyid mngon par sprul nas glang po che thams cad kyi nang na dbang che bar grags pa gang yin pa de nyid kyi mgo bo 'am /
analyzed: lha dang lha'i bu rdzu 'phrul che zhing gang yang rung ba dang 'dra bar bdag nyid mngon par sprul nas glang po che thams cad kyi nang na dbang che bar grags pa gang yin pa de nyid kyi mgo bo 'am /
translated: Having transformed himself into a god or a son of god with great magical power, he rides on the head or back of the most powerful of all elephants,

original: rgyab tu zhon te sil snyan dang pheg rdob pa dag cher byed cing 'gro'o //
analyzed: rgyab tu zhon te sil snyan dang pheg rdob pa dag cher byed cing 'gro'o //
translated: making a great deal of noise with cymbals and drums.

original: gang gi tshe glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa'i nang na gnas shing 'dug pa de'i tshe ni glang po che brgyad stong po 'di dag kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa'i nang na gnas shing 'dug pa de'i tshe ni glang po che brgyad stong po 'di dag kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: When the king of elephants is standing or sitting in the midst of the eight thousand elephants,

original: glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa srung ba dang / spa ba dang / mdzes par bya ba'i phyir shing s'a la'i phreng ba rim pa bdun po dag gi nang na kha nang du bltas shing 'khod do //
analyzed: glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa srung ba dang / spa ba dang / mdzes par bya ba'i phyir shing s'a la'i phreng ba rim pa bdun po dag gi nang na kha nang du bltas shing 'khod do //
translated: those elephants stand or sit facing him in the seven rows of Sāla trees in order to protect, guard, and beautify the king of elephants.

original: shing s'a la'i phreng ba dang po'i nang na 'dug pa gang yin pa de dag kyang kha nang du bltas te 'khod do //
analyzed: shing s'a la'i phreng ba dang po'i nang na 'dug pa gang yin pa de dag kyang kha nang du bltas te 'khod do //
translated: Those who were in the first row of Sāla trees also sat facing inward.

original: gnyis pa'i nang na 'dug pa gang yin pa de dag kyang kha nang du lta'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i nang na 'dug pa gang yin pa de dag kyang kha nang du lta'o //
translated: Those who were in the second row also sat facing inward.

original: gsum pa'i nang du 'dug pa gang yin pa de dag kyang kha nang du lta'o //
analyzed: gsum pa'i nang du 'dug pa gang yin pa de dag kyang kha nang du lta'o //
translated: Those who were in the third row also sat facing inward.

original: bzhi pa'i nang du 'dug pa de dag kyang kha nang du lta'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa'i nang du 'dug pa de dag kyang kha nang du lta'o //
translated: Those who were in the fourth row also sat facing inward.

original: lnga pa'i nang na 'dug pa gang yin pa de dag kyang kha nang du lta'o //
analyzed: lnga pa'i nang na 'dug pa gang yin pa de dag kyang kha nang du lta'o //
translated: Those who were in the fifth row also sat facing inward.

original: drug pa'i nang na 'dug pa gang yin pa de dag kyang kha nang du lta'o //
analyzed: drug pa'i nang na 'dug pa gang yin pa de dag kyang kha nang du lta'o //
translated: Those who were in the sixth row also sat facing inward.

original: bdun pa'i nang na 'dug pa gang yin pa de dag kyang kha nang du bltas te 'khod do //
analyzed: bdun pa'i nang na 'dug pa gang yin pa de dag kyang kha nang du bltas te 'khod do //
translated: Those who were in the seventh row also sat facing inward.

original: gang gi tshe glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa shing s'a la'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa nas rdzing bu dal gyis 'bab par 'gro ba na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa shing s'a la'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa nas rdzing bu dal gyis 'bab par 'gro ba na /
translated: When the king of elephants, the very steady one, went from the very steady king of Sāla trees to the pond Slow Flow,

original: res 'ga' ni tha mal pa'i tshul gyis 'gro'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni tha mal pa'i tshul gyis 'gro'o //
translated: Sometimes he goes in an ordinary way.

original: res 'ga' ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Sometimes he goes like this:

original: lha 'am lha'i bu rdzu 'phrul che zhing mthu che ba gang yang rung ba dang 'dra bar bdag nyid mngon bar sprul nas glang po che de dag thams cad kyi nang na dbang che bar grags pa gang yin pa de nyid kyi mgo @19b 'am /
analyzed: lha 'am lha'i bu rdzu 'phrul che zhing mthu che ba gang yang rung ba dang 'dra bar bdag nyid mngon bar sprul nas glang po che de dag thams cad kyi nang na dbang che bar grags pa gang yin pa de nyid kyi mgo @19b 'am /
translated: he manifests himself like a god or a son of god with great magical power and great might, and riding on the head or back of that most powerful of all the elephants,

original: rgyab tu zhon te sil snyan dang pheg rdob pa dag rgya cher byed cing 'gro'o //
analyzed: rgyab tu zhon te sil snyan dang pheg rdob pa dag rgya cher byed cing 'gro'o //
translated: he goes forth making much music and beating drums.

original: gang gi tshe glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa rdzing bu dal gyis 'bab kyi nang du zhugs nas rtse zhing dga' la dga' dgur spyod pa de'i tshe glang po che brgyad stong po de dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa rdzing bu dal gyis 'bab kyi nang du zhugs nas rtse zhing dga' la dga' dgur spyod pa de'i tshe glang po che brgyad stong po de dag 'di lta ste /
translated: When the king of elephants, Steadfast, enters the pond Slow Current to play, enjoy himself, and amuse himself, at that time those eight thousand elephants

original: glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa de srung ba dang / sba ba dang / mdzes par bya ba'i phyir rdzing bu dal gyis 'bab kyi mtha' khor khor yug nas bskor te kha nang du bltas shing 'khod do //
analyzed: glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa de srung ba dang / sba ba dang / mdzes par bya ba'i phyir rdzing bu dal gyis 'bab kyi mtha' khor khor yug nas bskor te kha nang du bltas shing 'khod do //
translated: In order to protect, guard, and beautify the king of elephants Supratiṣṭhita, they surrounded the pond Sukumārikā, facing inward.

original: gang gi tshe glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa rdzing bu dal gyis 'bab kyi nang nas rtse zhing dga' la dga' mgur spyad nas phyir byung ba de'i tshe nang na glang po che dbang che bar grags pa gang yin pa de rdzing bu dal gyis
analyzed: gang gi tshe glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa rdzing bu dal gyis 'bab kyi nang nas rtse zhing dga' la dga' mgur spyad nas phyir byung ba de'i tshe nang na glang po che dbang che bar grags pa gang yin pa de rdzing bu dal gyis
translated: When the king of elephants Supratiṣṭhita, having played, enjoyed, and amused himself in the pond Sukumārikā, came out, then whichever elephant was known to be the most powerful among them entered the pond Sukumārikā,

original: 'bab kyi nang du zhugs nas padma'i rtsa ba rnams blangs te /
analyzed: 'bab kyi nang du zhugs nas padma'i rtsa ba rnams blangs te /
translated: took lotus roots,

original: shin tu bkrus shing rab tu bshal nas glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa la 'bul lo //
analyzed: shin tu bkrus shing rab tu bshal nas glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa la 'bul lo //
translated: thoroughly washed and cleaned them, and offered them to the king of elephants Supratiṣṭhita.

original: gang gi tshe glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pas zos shing 'thungs te 'grangs par gyur pa de'i tshe glang po che gzhan brgyad stong po de dag kyang rdzing bu brgyad stong gi nang na rdzing bu re re zhugs na rtse zhing dga' la dga' dgur
analyzed: gang gi tshe glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pas zos shing 'thungs te 'grangs par gyur pa de'i tshe glang po che gzhan brgyad stong po de dag kyang rdzing bu brgyad stong gi nang na rdzing bu re re zhugs na rtse zhing dga' la dga' dgur
translated: When the king of elephants, Steadfast, has eaten and drunk and is satisfied, then those other eight thousand elephants enter each of the eight thousand ponds in the ponds and play, enjoy themselves, and amuse themselves as they please.

original: spyod do // padma'i rtsa ba dag blangs nas shin tu bkrus shing rab tu bshal te za'o //
analyzed: spyod do // padma'i rtsa ba dag blangs nas shin tu bkrus shing rab tu bshal te za'o //
translated: They take the lotus roots, wash them well, and eat them.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi glang po che rgyal po g-yul ngor spyad pa rab tu bstan pa'i mthu ni de tsam mo //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi glang po che rgyal po g-yul ngor spyad pa rab tu bstan pa'i mthu ni de tsam mo //
translated: The power of the king of elephants of the Thirty-Three Gods, used in battle, is just like that.

original: sems can thams cad ni srung ma dang bcas shing srung ba dang / skyob pa dang sbed pa dang / mi 'bral  ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ni srung ma dang bcas shing srung ba dang / skyob pa dang sbed pa dang / mi 'bral  ste /
translated: All sentient beings are protected, guarded, sheltered, hidden, and not separated from

original: sems can gang dbang chung bar grags shing bsod nams chung la /
analyzed: sems can gang dbang chung bar grags shing bsod nams chung la /
translated: those sentient beings who are known to be of little power and of little merit.

original: gzi brjid chung ba de dag ni brgya phrag mang po dang / stong phrag mang po la gcig srung ste /
analyzed: gzi brjid chung ba de dag ni brgya phrag mang po dang / stong phrag mang po la gcig srung ste /
translated: Those of little splendor protect one out of many hundreds and many thousands.

original: dper na ba lang ngam lug brgya phrag mang po dang stong phrag mang po la gcig srung ba de bzhin du /🔽sems can gang dbang chung bar grags shing bsod nams chung la /
analyzed: dper na ba lang ngam lug brgya phrag mang po dang stong phrag mang po la gcig srung ba de bzhin du / sems can gang dbang chung bar grags shing bsod nams chung la /
translated: For example, it is like one protecting many hundreds and many thousands of cattle or sheep.

original: gzi brjid chung ba de dag ni brgya phrag mang po dang / stong phrag mang po la gcig bsrung ngo //
analyzed: gzi brjid chung ba de dag ni brgya phrag mang po dang / stong phrag mang po la gcig bsrung ngo //
translated: Those sentient beings who are known to have little power, little merit, and little splendor, they protect one out of many hundreds and many thousands.

original: sems can gang dbang che bar grags shing bsod nams che la gzi brjid che ba de dag ni brgya phrag mang po dang / stong phrag mang po dag gis gcig tu bsrung ste /
analyzed: sems can gang dbang che bar grags shing bsod nams che la gzi brjid che ba de dag ni brgya phrag mang po dang / stong phrag mang po dag gis gcig tu bsrung ste /
translated: Those sentient beings who are known to have great power, great merit, and great splendor, they protect one out of many hundreds and many thousands.

original: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po 'am /
analyzed: dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po 'am /
translated: For example, it is like a universal monarch

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas @20a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas @20a * //
translated: or a tathāgata, an arhat, a perfectly awakened buddha

original: la brgya phrag mang po dang / stong phrag mang po dag gis gcig tu srung ba de bzhin du sems can gang dbang che bar grags shing bsod nams che la gzi brjid che ba de dag la brgya phrag mang po dang / stong phrag mang po dag gis gcig tu srung ngo //
analyzed: la brgya phrag mang po dang / stong phrag mang po dag gis gcig tu srung ba de bzhin du sems can gang dbang che bar grags shing bsod nams che la gzi brjid che ba de dag la brgya phrag mang po dang / stong phrag mang po dag gis gcig tu srung ngo //
translated: In the same way, many hundreds and many thousands guard those sentient beings who are powerful, famous, meritorious, and glorious.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say:

original: ji ste sems can thams cad srung ma dang bcas shing srung ba dang / skyob pa dang / sbed pa dang mi 'bral na ci'i phyir 'tshe ba yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ste sems can thams cad srung ma dang bcas shing srung ba dang / skyob pa dang / sbed pa dang mi 'bral na ci'i phyir 'tshe ba yod par 'gyur /
translated: If all sentient beings are not separated from their guardians, who protect, guard, conceal, and save them, why is there harm?

original: smras pa / srung ma mthu chung ba zhig yin na de la zil gyis gnon pa la 'tshe ba yod do //
analyzed: smras pa / srung ma mthu chung ba zhig yin na de la zil gyis gnon pa la 'tshe ba yod do //
translated: We say: If a guardian is weak, harm exists in the form of being overwhelmed by others.

original: srung ma bag med cing bag med par gnas pa zhig yin na ni bag med pa'i rgyu las kyang 'tshe ba rnams yod do //
analyzed: srung ma bag med cing bag med par gnas pa zhig yin na ni bag med pa'i rgyu las kyang 'tshe ba rnams yod do //
translated: If a guardian is careless and lives carelessly, harm exists even due to the cause of carelessness.

original: srung ma gnyis lhan cig mthun par gyur pas kyang zil gyis mnan nas 'tshe bar byed do //
analyzed: srung ma gnyis lhan cig mthun par gyur pas kyang zil gyis mnan nas 'tshe bar byed do //
translated: Harm exists in the form of being overwhelmed by two guardians who are in agreement.

original: mi rnams chos ma yin pa spyod cing mi rigs pa spyod pa zhig yin na de dag gis chos ma yin pa spyod pa dang / mi rigs pa spyod pa las kyang 'tshe ba yod do /
analyzed: mi rnams chos ma yin pa spyod cing mi rigs pa spyod pa zhig yin na de dag gis chos ma yin pa spyod pa dang / mi rigs pa spyod pa las kyang 'tshe ba yod do /
translated: If people are practicing non-Dharma and unrighteousness, then there is harm even from their practicing non-Dharma and unrighteousness.

original: // /'jig rten gzhag pa /🔽bam po gsum pa /
analyzed: // /'jig rten gzhag pa / bam po gsum pa /
translated: If people engage in unrighteousness and unwholesomeness, then there is also harm from their engaging in unrighteousness and unwholesomeness.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi mi rnams kyi srung ma 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi mi rnams kyi srung ma 'di lta ste /
translated: The gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three have guardians of humans, such as

original: lam po che dang / srang dang / bzhi mdo dang / sum mdo dang / dri 'tshong ba'i gnas rnams dang / me tog phreng ba 'tshong ba'i gnas rnams dang / zong dgram pa'i gnas rnams dang / btung ba 'tshong ba'i gnas rnams dang / rtag tu myos pa'i gnas rnams dang /🔽gsod byed kyi gnas su bkod pa dag yod de /
analyzed: lam po che dang / srang dang / bzhi mdo dang / sum mdo dang / dri 'tshong ba'i gnas rnams dang / me tog phreng ba 'tshong ba'i gnas rnams dang / zong dgram pa'i gnas rnams dang / btung ba 'tshong ba'i gnas rnams dang / rtag tu myos pa'i gnas rnams dang /🔽gsod byed kyi gnas su bkod pa dag yod de /
translated: the crossroads, the intersections, the flower garland makers, the perfume makers, the markets, the drinking establishments, the brothels, and the slaughterhouses.

original: zla ba phyed kyi tshes brgyad la rgyal po chen po bzhi po dag gi g-yog zho shas 'tsho ba rnams kyis lam po che dang / srang dang / bzhi mdo dang / sum mdo dang / dri 'tshong ba'i gnas rnams dang / me tog gi phreng ba 'tshong ba'i gnas rnams dang /
analyzed: zla ba phyed kyi tshes brgyad la rgyal po chen po bzhi po dag gi g-yog zho shas 'tsho ba rnams kyis lam po che dang / srang dang / bzhi mdo dang / sum mdo dang / dri 'tshong ba'i gnas rnams dang / me tog gi phreng ba 'tshong ba'i gnas rnams dang /
translated: On the eighth day of the half-month, the four great kings, along with their retinues, will search the entire world, asking, “Who is there in the streets, the crossroads, the intersections, the perfume shops, the flower garland shops,

original: zong dgram pa'i gnas rnams dang / btung ba 'tshong ba'i gnas rnams dang / rtag tu myos pa'i gnas rnams dang / gsod byed kyi gnas rnams na su zhig 'dug ces 'jig rten 'di thams cad byul te /
analyzed: zong dgram pa'i gnas rnams dang / btung ba 'tshong ba'i gnas rnams dang / rtag tu myos pa'i gnas rnams dang / gsod byed kyi gnas rnams na su zhig 'dug ces 'jig rten 'di thams cad byul te /
translated: the shops that sell goods, the shops that sell drinks, the places where people are always intoxicated, and the slaughterhouses?”

original: ci ste de dag gis skyen par tshor na ni de dag gnas mthon po la 'god do //
analyzed: ci ste de dag gis skyen par tshor na ni de dag gnas mthon po la 'god do //
translated: If they find someone who is quick-witted, they will place them in a high position.

original: ji ste de dag gis skyen par ma tshor ba na ni de dag gnas dma' ba la 'god do //
analyzed: ji ste de dag gis skyen par ma tshor ba na ni de dag gnas dma' ba la 'god do //
translated: If they find someone who is not quick-witted, they will place them in a low position.

original: zla ba phyed kyi tshes bcu bzhi la ni rgyal po chen @20b po bzhi po de dag gi bu rnams kyi lam po che dang / srang dang / bzhi mdo dang / sum mdo dang / dri 'tshong ba'i gnas rnams dang / me tog gi phreng ba 'tshong ba'i gnas rnams dang /
analyzed: zla ba phyed kyi tshes bcu bzhi la ni rgyal po chen @20b po bzhi po de dag gi bu rnams kyi lam po che dang / srang dang / bzhi mdo dang / sum mdo dang / dri 'tshong ba'i gnas rnams dang / me tog gi phreng ba 'tshong ba'i gnas rnams dang /
translated: On the fourteenth day of the half-month, the sons of the four great kings will search the entire world, asking, “Who is there in the streets, the crossroads, the intersections, the perfume shops, the flower garland shops,

original: zong dgram pa'i gnas rnams dang / btung ba 'tshong ba'i gnas rnams dang / rtag tu myos pa'i gnas rnams dang / gsod byed kyi gnas rnams na su zhig 'dug ces 'jig rten 'di thams cad byul te /
analyzed: zong dgram pa'i gnas rnams dang / btung ba 'tshong ba'i gnas rnams dang / rtag tu myos pa'i gnas rnams dang / gsod byed kyi gnas rnams na su zhig 'dug ces 'jig rten 'di thams cad byul te /
translated: the shops that sell goods, the shops that sell drinks, the places where people are always intoxicated, and the slaughterhouses?”

original: ci ste de dag gis skyen par tshor na ni /
analyzed: ci ste de dag gis skyen par tshor na ni /
translated: If they notice someone quickly,

original: de dag gnas mthon po la 'god do //🔽ci ste de dag gis skyen par mtshor na ni de dag gnas dma' ba la 'god do //
analyzed: de dag gnas mthon po la 'god do //🔽ci ste de dag gis skyen par mtshor na ni de dag gnas dma' ba la 'god do //
translated: they will place them in a high position.🔽If they do not notice someone quickly, they will place them in a low position.

original: zla ba phyed kyi tshe bcva lnga la ni rgyal po chen po bzhi po de dag nyid kyi lam po che dang / srang dang / bzhi mdo dang / sum mdo dang / dri 'tshong ba'i gnas rnams dang / me tog gi phreng ba 'tshong ba'i gnas rnams dang /
analyzed: zla ba phyed kyi tshe bcva lnga la ni rgyal po chen po bzhi po de dag nyid kyi lam po che dang / srang dang / bzhi mdo dang / sum mdo dang / dri 'tshong ba'i gnas rnams dang / me tog gi phreng ba 'tshong ba'i gnas rnams dang /
translated: Every half month, on the fifteenth day, the four great kings themselves search the entire world, asking, “Who is there in the streets, crossroads, intersections, perfume shops, flower garland shops,

original: zong dgram pa'i gnas rnams dang / btung ba 'tshong ba'i gnas rnams dang / rtag tu myos pa'i gnas rnams dang / gsod byed kyi gnas rnams na su zhig 'dug ces 'jig rten 'di thams cad byul te /
analyzed: zong dgram pa'i gnas rnams dang / btung ba 'tshong ba'i gnas rnams dang / rtag tu myos pa'i gnas rnams dang / gsod byed kyi gnas rnams na su zhig 'dug ces 'jig rten 'di thams cad byul te /
translated: markets, drinking establishments, taverns, and slaughterhouses?”

original: ci ste de dag gis skyen par tshor na ni /
analyzed: ci ste de dag gis skyen par tshor na ni /
translated: If they notice someone quickly,

original: de dag gnas mthon po la 'god do //🔽ci ste de dag gis skyen par mtshor na ni de dag gnas dma' ba la 'god do //
analyzed: de dag gnas mthon po la 'god do //🔽ci ste de dag gis skyen par mtshor na ni de dag gnas dma' ba la 'god do //
translated: they will place them in a high position.🔽If they do not notice someone quickly, they will place them in a low position.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'di skad du dge slong dag zla ba phyed kyi tshes brgyad la ni rgyal po chen po bzhi po dag gi zho shas 'tsho ba rnams ni ci mi dang mi ma yin pa'i 'jig rten na mar 'dzin pa dang / phar 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'di skad du dge slong dag zla ba phyed kyi tshes brgyad la ni rgyal po chen po bzhi po dag gi zho shas 'tsho ba rnams ni ci mi dang mi ma yin pa'i 'jig rten na mar 'dzin pa dang / phar 'dzin pa dang /
translated: The Bhagavān also said, “Monks, on the eighth day of the fortnight, the four great kings’ men investigate the entire world, asking, ‘Are there many humans and non-humans in the world who respect their mothers,🔽respect their fathers,🔽respect ascetics, respect brahmins,

original: dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi nang na rgan rabs la rim gro byed pa dang / don byed pa dang / bya ba'i rigs pa byed pa dang / bsod nams byed pa dang / tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la kha na ma tho ba rnams kyis 'jigs par lta ba dang /
analyzed: dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi nang na rgan rabs la rim gro byed pa dang / don byed pa dang / bya ba'i rigs pa byed pa dang / bsod nams byed pa dang / tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la kha na ma tho ba rnams kyis 'jigs par lta ba dang /
translated: respect the elders in their family, do what is meaningful, do what is right, do what should be done, do what is meritorious, and who see the faults of this life and the next?

original: sbyin pa dag sbyin zhing bsod nams dag byed pa dang / gso sbyong la nye bar gnas pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blangs nas 'dug pa dag mang ngam zhes 'jig rten 'di thams cad du nyul lo //
analyzed: sbyin pa dag sbyin zhing bsod nams dag byed pa dang / gso sbyong la nye bar gnas pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blangs nas 'dug pa dag mang ngam zhes 'jig rten 'di thams cad du nyul lo //
translated: Are there many who give gifts, make merit, observe the purificatory fast, and live by taking up the moral precepts?’

original: zla ba phyed kyi tshes bcu bzhi la ni rgyal po chen po bzhi po dag gi bu rnams ci mi dang mi ma yin pa'i 'jig rten na mar 'dzin pa dang / phar 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa dang /🔽rigs kyi @21a * //
analyzed: zla ba phyed kyi tshes bcu bzhi la ni rgyal po chen po bzhi po dag gi bu rnams ci mi dang mi ma yin pa'i 'jig rten na mar 'dzin pa dang / phar 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi @21a * //
translated: On the fourteenth day of the half month, the sons of the four great kings investigate the entire world, asking, “Are there many humans and non-humans who respect their mothers,🔽respect their fathers, respect spiritual practitioners, and respect brahmins?

original: nang na rgan rabs la rim gro byed pa dang / don byed pa dang / bya ba'i rigs pa byed pa dang / bsod nams byed pa dang / tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la kha na ma tho ba rnams kyis 'jigs par lta ba dang /
analyzed: nang na rgan rabs la rim gro byed pa dang / don byed pa dang / bya ba'i rigs pa byed pa dang / bsod nams byed pa dang / tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la kha na ma tho ba rnams kyis 'jigs par lta ba dang /
translated: Do they respect the elders in their families, do they do what is meaningful, do they do what is right, do they do what is meritorious, and do they see the faults of this life and the next?

original: sbyin pa dag sbyin zhing /
analyzed: sbyin pa dag sbyin zhing /
translated: Do they give gifts

original: bsod nams dag byed pa dang / gso sbyong la nye bar gnas pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blangs nas 'dug pa dag mang ngam zhes 'jig rten 'di dag thams cad nyul lo //
analyzed: bsod nams dag byed pa dang / gso sbyong la nye bar gnas pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blangs nas 'dug pa dag mang ngam zhes 'jig rten 'di dag thams cad nyul lo //
translated: and do meritorious deeds, do they observe the purificatory fast, and do they observe the precepts they have taken?”

original: zla ba phyed kyi tshes bcva lnga la ni rgyal bo chen po bzhi po de dag nyid ci mi dang mi ma yin pa'i 'jig rten na mar 'dzin pa dang / phar 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: zla ba phyed kyi tshes bcva lnga la ni rgyal bo chen po bzhi po de dag nyid ci mi dang mi ma yin pa'i 'jig rten na mar 'dzin pa dang / phar 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa dang /
translated: respecting their fathers, respecting spiritual practitioners, respecting brahmins,

original: rigs kyi nang na rgan rabs la rim gro byed pa dang / don byed pa dang / bya ba'i rigs pa byed pa dang / bsod nams byed pa dang / tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la kha na ma tho ba rnams kyis 'jigs par lta ba dang /
analyzed: rigs kyi nang na rgan rabs la rim gro byed pa dang / don byed pa dang / bya ba'i rigs pa byed pa dang / bsod nams byed pa dang / tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la kha na ma tho ba rnams kyis 'jigs par lta ba dang /
translated: respecting the elders in their families, acting for the benefit of their families, acting in accord with the duties of their families, making merit, and seeing the faults of this life and the next?

original: sbyin pa dag sbyin zhing bsod nams dag byed pa dang / gso sbyong la nye bar gnas pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blangs nas 'dug pa dag mang ngam zhes 'jig rten 'di thams cad nyul lo //
analyzed: sbyin pa dag sbyin zhing bsod nams dag byed pa dang / gso sbyong la nye bar gnas pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blangs nas 'dug pa dag mang ngam zhes 'jig rten 'di thams cad nyul lo //
translated: Are many giving gifts, making merit, and observing the purificatory fast, and are many observing the precepts they have taken up?”

original: ci ste mi dang mi ma yin pa'i 'jig rten na mar mi 'dzin pa dang / phar mi 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du mi 'dzin pa dang / bram zer mi 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi nang na rgan rabs la rim gro mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: ci ste mi dang mi ma yin pa'i 'jig rten na mar mi 'dzin pa dang / phar mi 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du mi 'dzin pa dang / bram zer mi 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi nang na rgan rabs la rim gro mi byed pa dang /
translated: If in the world of humans and nonhumans there are those who do not hold their mothers as authorities, do not hold their fathers as authorities, do not hold their spiritual teachers as authorities, do not hold their brahmins as authorities, do not respect the elders in their families,

original: don mi byed pa dang / bya ba'i rigs pa dag mi byed pa dang / bsod nams mi byed pa dang / tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la kha na ma tho ba rnams kyis 'jigs par mi lta ba dang / sbyin pa dag mi sbyin zhing bsod nams dag mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: don mi byed pa dang / bya ba'i rigs pa dag mi byed pa dang / bsod nams mi byed pa dang / tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la kha na ma tho ba rnams kyis 'jigs par mi lta ba dang / sbyin pa dag mi sbyin zhing bsod nams dag mi byed pa dang /
translated: do not do what is meaningful, do not do what is right, do not do what is meritorious, do not fear the faults of this life and the next, do not give gifts, do not do what is meritorious,

original: gso sbyong la nye bar mi gnas pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blangs te /
analyzed: gso sbyong la nye bar mi gnas pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blangs te /
translated: do not observe the purificatory fast, and do not take up the precepts of ethical discipline,

original: mi 'dug pa dag mang na ni rgyal po chen po bzhi po rnams sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams lha'i 'dun sa chos bzangs su 'dus shing 'khod pa'i nang du song nas 'di skad du grogs po dag 'di shes par gyis shig / mi dang mi ma
analyzed: mi 'dug pa dag mang na ni rgyal po chen po bzhi po rnams sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams lha'i 'dun sa chos bzangs su 'dus shing 'khod pa'i nang du song nas 'di skad du grogs po dag 'di shes par gyis shig / mi dang mi ma
translated: If there are many who do not do these things, the four great kings will go to the divine assembly hall of Sudharmā among the gods of the Thirty-Three and say, “Friends, you should know this:

original: yin pa'i 'jig rten na mar mi 'dzin pa dang / phar mi 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du mi 'dzin pa dang / bram zer mi 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi nang na rgan rabs la rim gro mi byed pa dang / don mi byed ba dang /
analyzed: yin pa'i 'jig rten na mar mi 'dzin pa dang / phar mi 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du mi 'dzin pa dang / bram zer mi 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi nang na rgan rabs la rim gro mi byed pa dang / don mi byed ba dang /
translated: In the human and nonhuman worlds, there are those who do not respect their mothers, who do not respect their fathers, who do not respect spiritual practitioners, who do not respect brahmins, who do not honor the elders in their families, who do not do what is meaningful,

original: bya ba'i rigs @21b pa dag mi byed pa dang / bsod nams mi byed pa dang / tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la khan mtho ba rnams kyis 'jigs par mi lta ba dang / sbyin pa dag mi sbyin zhing bsod nams dag mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: bya ba'i rigs @21b pa dag mi byed pa dang / bsod nams mi byed pa dang / tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la khan mtho ba rnams kyis 'jigs par mi lta ba dang / sbyin pa dag mi sbyin zhing bsod nams dag mi byed pa dang /
translated: who do not do what should be done, who do not create merit, who do not look out for the dangers in this life and the next, who do not give gifts and do not create merit,🔽who do not live by the Dharma, who do not live by the holy life, who do not do what is wholesome, who do not do what is good, who do not do what is righteous, who do not do what is meritorious, who do not do what is noble, who do not do what is virtuous, who do not do what is beneficial, who do not do what is lovely, who do not do what is beautiful, who do not do what is radiant, who do not do what is bright, who do not do what is

original: gso sbyong la nye bar mi gnas pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blangs te mi 'dug pa dag mang ngo zhes bsnyad do //
analyzed: gso sbyong la nye bar mi gnas pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blangs te mi 'dug pa dag mang ngo zhes bsnyad do //
translated: They said, There are many who do not observe the purification day and who do not keep the precepts properly.

original: de dag las thos nas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams yi ma rangs shing mi mgu bar gyur nas yi ma rangs pa nyid kyang phyir zlog par byed de //
analyzed: de dag las thos nas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams yi ma rangs shing mi mgu bar gyur nas yi ma rangs pa nyid kyang phyir zlog par byed de //
translated: Having heard this, the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three became displeased and unhappy, and they said, We will turn this back!

original: kye ma grogs po dag 'di ltar mi dang mi ma yin pa'i 'jig rten na mar mi 'dzin pa dang / phar mi 'dzin ba dang / dge sbyong du mi 'dzin pa dang / bram zer mi 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi nang na rgan rabs la rim gror mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: kye ma grogs po dag 'di ltar mi dang mi ma yin pa'i 'jig rten na mar mi 'dzin pa dang / phar mi 'dzin ba dang / dge sbyong du mi 'dzin pa dang / bram zer mi 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi nang na rgan rabs la rim gror mi byed pa dang /
translated: Oh friends, in this world of humans and non-humans, there are those who do not respect their mothers, do not respect their fathers, do not respect ascetics, do not respect brahmins, and do not honor the elders in their families.

original: don mi byed pa dang / bya ba'i rigs pa mi byed pa dang / bsod nams mi byed pa dang / tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la kha na ma tho ba rnams kyis 'jigs par mi lta ba dang / sbyin pa dag mi sbyin zhing bsod nams dag mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: don mi byed pa dang / bya ba'i rigs pa mi byed pa dang / bsod nams mi byed pa dang / tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la kha na ma tho ba rnams kyis 'jigs par mi lta ba dang / sbyin pa dag mi sbyin zhing bsod nams dag mi byed pa dang /
translated: They do not perform meaningful actions, they do not perform appropriate actions, they do not perform meritorious actions, they do not fear the faults of this life and the next, they do not give gifts, they do not perform meritorious actions,

original: gso sbyong la nye bar mi gnas pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blangs te /
analyzed: gso sbyong la nye bar mi gnas pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blangs te /
translated: they do not observe the purificatory fast, they do not observe the precepts,

original: mi 'dug pa mang ba ni mi rnams kyi chos mdzes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi 'dug pa mang ba ni mi rnams kyi chos mdzes pa ma yin no //
translated: and they do not abide in the practice of virtue. These are not beautiful qualities of humans.

original: rkyen du bab pa ma yin no //🔽legs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rkyen du bab pa ma yin no // legs pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not suitable conditions.🔽They are not good.

original: dge ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dge ba ma yin no //
translated: They are not virtuous.🔽Thus, the hosts of gods will wane,

original: de ltar na lha rnams kyi tshogs ni yongs su 'grib par 'gyur la /🔽lha ma yin rnams kyi tshogs ni mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes zlos so //
analyzed: de ltar na lha rnams kyi tshogs ni yongs su 'grib par 'gyur la /🔽lha ma yin rnams kyi tshogs ni mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes zlos so //
translated: and the hosts of asuras will increase.

original: ji ste mi dang mi ma yin pa'i 'jig rten na mar 'dzin pa dang / phar 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi nang na rgan rabs la rim gro byed pa dang / don byed pa dang /
analyzed: ji ste mi dang mi ma yin pa'i 'jig rten na mar 'dzin pa dang / phar 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi nang na rgan rabs la rim gro byed pa dang / don byed pa dang /
translated: If in the world of humans and nonhumans there are many who hold their mothers and fathers in high esteem, who hold ascetics and brahmins in high esteem, who serve the elders in the family, who act for the benefit of others,

original: bya ba'i rigs pa byed pa dang / bsod nams byed pa dang / tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma dang kha na ma tho ba rnams kyis 'jigs par lta ba dang / sbyin pa dag sbyin zhing bsod nams dag byed pa dang / gso sbyong la nye bar gnas pa dang /
analyzed: bya ba'i rigs pa byed pa dang / bsod nams byed pa dang / tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma dang kha na ma tho ba rnams kyis 'jigs par lta ba dang / sbyin pa dag sbyin zhing bsod nams dag byed pa dang / gso sbyong la nye bar gnas pa dang /
translated: who act in accordance with what is proper, who create merit, who fear the faults of this life and the next, who give gifts and create merit, who observe the purificatory fast,

original: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs nas 'dug pa dag mang na ni rgyal po chen po bzhi po rnams sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams lha'i mdun sa chos bzangs du 'dus shing 'khod pa'i nang du song nas 'di skad du grogs po dag 'di shes par gyis
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs nas 'dug pa dag mang na ni rgyal po chen po bzhi po rnams sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams lha'i mdun sa chos bzangs du 'dus shing 'khod pa'i nang du song nas 'di skad du grogs po dag 'di shes par gyis
translated: and who abide by the precepts they have taken up, then the Four Great Kings will go to the divine assembly hall of Sudharmā among the Thirty-Three Gods and, having sat down, will say this: ‘Friends, know this!

original: shig / mi dang mi ma yin pa'i 'jig rten na mar 'dzin pa dang @22a * //
analyzed: shig / mi dang mi ma yin pa'i 'jig rten na mar 'dzin pa dang @22a * //
translated: and Kill!🔽 In the world of humans and nonhumans, Honor your mother!🔽 and Kill your father!🔽

original: phar 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi nang na rgan rabs la rim gro byed pa dang / don byed pa dang / bya ba'i rigs pa byed pa dang / bsod nams byed pa dang /
analyzed: phar 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi nang na rgan rabs la rim gro byed pa dang / don byed pa dang / bya ba'i rigs pa byed pa dang / bsod nams byed pa dang /
translated: The gods of the Thirty-Three said, In the world of humans and non-humans, there are many who hold their mothers, fathers, ascetics, and brahmins as supreme, who respect the elders in their families, who do what is meaningful, who do what is right, who create merit,

original: tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la kha na ma tho ba rnams kyis 'jigs par lta ba dang / sbyin pa dag sbyin zhing bsod nams dag byed pa dang / gso sbyong la nye bar gnas pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blangs nas 'dug pa dag mang ngo zhes bsnyad na ni de dag las thos nas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams yi rangs shing mgu bar gyur nas yi rangs ba nyid kyang zlos par byed de /
analyzed: tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la kha na ma tho ba rnams kyis 'jigs par lta ba dang / sbyin pa dag sbyin zhing bsod nams dag byed pa dang / gso sbyong la nye bar gnas pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blangs nas 'dug pa dag mang ngo zhes bsnyad na ni de dag las thos nas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams yi rangs shing mgu bar gyur nas yi rangs ba nyid kyang zlos par byed de /
translated: who see fear in the faults of this life and the next, who give gifts and create merit, who observe the purificatory fast, and who abide by the precepts they have taken up. Having heard this, the gods of the Thirty-Three rejoiced and were satisfied, and they repeated their rejoicing.

original: kye ma'o grogs po dag 'di ltar mi dang mi ma yin pa'i 'jig rten na mar 'dzin pa dang / phar 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi nang na rgan rabs la rim gro byed pa dang /
analyzed: kye ma'o grogs po dag 'di ltar mi dang mi ma yin pa'i 'jig rten na mar 'dzin pa dang / phar 'dzin pa dang / dge sbyong du 'dzin pa dang / bram zer 'dzin pa dang / rigs kyi nang na rgan rabs la rim gro byed pa dang /
translated: “Alas, my friends, in the human and nonhuman worlds, there are many who respect their mothers, respect their fathers, respect spiritual practitioners, respect brahmins, and respect the elders of their families.

original: don byed pa dang / bya ba'i rigs pa bde ba dang / bsod nams byed pa dang / tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la kha na ma tho ba rnams kyis 'jigs par lta ba dang / sbyin pa dag sbyin zhing bsod nams dag byed pa dang /
analyzed: don byed pa dang / bya ba'i rigs pa bde ba dang / bsod nams byed pa dang / tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la kha na ma tho ba rnams kyis 'jigs par lta ba dang / sbyin pa dag sbyin zhing bsod nams dag byed pa dang /
translated: They are helpful, do what is appropriate, are happy, create merit, fear the unwholesome in this life and the next, give gifts, create merit,

original: gso sbyong la nye bar gnas pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blangs nas 'dug pa dag mang ba ni mi rnams kyi chos mdzes so //
analyzed: gso sbyong la nye bar gnas pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blangs nas 'dug pa dag mang ba ni mi rnams kyi chos mdzes so //
translated: observe the purificatory fast, and maintain their vows. These are the beautiful human qualities.

original: rkyen du bab bo //
analyzed: rkyen du bab bo //
translated: It is the right time.

original: legs so // dge'o //
analyzed: legs so // dge'o //
translated: It is excellent.🔽It is virtuous.

original: de ltar na lha rnams kyi tshogs ni mngon bar 'phel bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar na lha rnams kyi tshogs ni mngon bar 'phel bar 'gyur la /
translated: In this way, the hosts of gods will increase,

original: lha ma yin gyi tshogs ni yongs su 'grib par 'gyur ro zhes zlos so //
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi tshogs ni yongs su 'grib par 'gyur ro zhes zlos so //
translated: The asura hosts will decline.”

original: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis lha'i 'khor rab tu dga' la bde zhing yid bde ba skyes par rig nas /
analyzed: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis lha'i 'khor rab tu dga' la bde zhing yid bde ba skyes par rig nas /
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, seeing that the divine assembly was delighted, happy, and joyful,

original: de'i tshe tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
translated: at that time spoke in verse:🔽“On the eighth, fourteenth, and fifteenth days of the half-month,

original: 'di ni zla phyed tshes brgyad dang // de bzhin bcu bzhi bco lnga dang // cho 'phrul gyi ni zla phyed la'ang //🔽gso sbyong yan lag brgyad pa la //
analyzed: 'di ni zla phyed tshes brgyad dang // de bzhin bcu bzhi bco lnga dang // cho 'phrul gyi ni zla phyed la'ang // gso sbyong yan lag brgyad pa la //
translated: and on the days of the miracles,

original: shin tu mnyam gzhag gnas byed 'dir //
analyzed: shin tu mnyam gzhag gnas byed 'dir //
translated: here one should observe the eight-branched fasting.

original: nga ci 'dra bar de bzhin 'gyur//
analyzed: nga ci 'dra bar de bzhin 'gyur//
translated: Just as I am, so will they be.

original: dge slong dag lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis gang 'di skad du /
analyzed: dge slong dag lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis gang 'di skad du /
translated: “Monks, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this:

original: 'dir ni zla phyed tshes brgyad dang // de bzhin bcu bzhi bco lnga dang // cho 'phrul gyi ni zla phyed la'ang //🔽gso sbyong yan lag brgyad pa la //
analyzed: 'dir ni zla phyed tshes brgyad dang // de bzhin bcu bzhi bco lnga dang // cho 'phrul gyi ni zla phyed la'ang // gso sbyong yan lag brgyad pa la //
translated: “On the eighth, fourteenth, and fifteenth days of the half-month,🔽and on the days of the miracles,

original: shin tu mnyam gzhag gnas byed 'dir //
analyzed: shin tu mnyam gzhag gnas byed 'dir //
translated: here one should observe the eight-branched fasting.

original: nga ci 'dra bar de bzhin 'gyur //
analyzed: nga ci 'dra bar de bzhin 'gyur //
translated: I will become just like him.

original: zhes @22b tshigs su bcad pa smras pa de ni nyes par smras pa yin gyi legs par smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes @22b tshigs su bcad pa smras pa de ni nyes par smras pa yin gyi legs par smras pa ma yin no //
translated: This verse that he spoke is badly spoken, not well spoken.

original: nyes par bstod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: nyes par bstod pa yin gyi /
translated: It is a bad praise,

original: legs par bstod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: legs par bstod pa ma yin no //
translated: not a good praise.

original: nyes par brjod pa yin gyi legs par brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyes par brjod pa yin gyi legs par brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is a bad statement, not a good statement.

original: dge slong dag de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Monks, why is that?

original: lha'i dbang po brgya byin de ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po brgya byin de ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa /
translated: Because Śakra, Lord of the Gods, is full of desire,

original: zhe sdang dang bcas pa /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bcas pa /
translated: full of hatred,

original: gti mug dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: gti mug dang bcas pa ste /
translated: and full of delusion.

original: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrugs pa rnams las yongs su ma grol zhing sdug bsngal las yongs su ma grol lo zhes nga smra'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrugs pa rnams las yongs su ma grol zhing sdug bsngal las yongs su ma grol lo zhes nga smra'o //
translated: I say that he is not completely free from birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, depression, and distress, and he is not completely free from suffering.

original: de bas na des gang 'di skad du /
analyzed: de bas na des gang 'di skad du /
translated: Therefore, he said this:

original: 'dir ni zla phyed tshes brgyad dang // de bzhin bcu bzhi bco lnga dang // cho 'phrul gyi ni zla phyed la'ang //
analyzed: 'dir ni zla phyed tshes brgyad dang // de bzhin bcu bzhi bco lnga dang // cho 'phrul gyi ni zla phyed la'ang //
translated: and on the days of the lunar conjunctions,🔽he should observe the eight-part poṣadha

original: gso sbyong yan lag brgyad pa dang // shin tu mnyam gzhag gnas byed 'dir //
analyzed: gso sbyong yan lag brgyad pa dang // shin tu mnyam gzhag gnas byed 'dir //
translated: and remain in a state of perfect equipoise.

original: nga ci 'dra ba de bzhin 'gyur //
analyzed: nga ci 'dra ba de bzhin 'gyur //
translated: He will become just like me.🔽This verse is badly spoken, not well spoken.

original: zhes tshigs su bcad pas smras pa 'di nyes par smras pa yin gyi legs par smras pa ma yin no //🔽nyes par bstod pa yin gyi legs par bstod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes tshigs su bcad pas smras pa 'di nyes par smras pa yin gyi legs par smras pa ma yin no // nyes par bstod pa yin gyi legs par bstod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is a bad praise, not a good praise.

original: nyes par brjod pa yin gyi legs par brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyes par brjod pa yin gyi legs par brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is a bad expression, not a good expression.

original: dge slong dag dge slong gang dgra bcom pa yin zhing zag pa zad pa /🔽bya ba byas pa /
analyzed: dge slong dag dge slong gang dgra bcom pa yin zhing zag pa zad pa / bya ba byas pa /
translated: Monks, a monk who is an arhat, one whose defilements are exhausted,

original: byed pa byas pa /
analyzed: byed pa byas pa /
translated: one who has done what had to be done,🔽one who has accomplished what had to be accomplished,

original: khur bor ba /
analyzed: khur bor ba /
translated: one who has cast off the burden,

original: bdag gi don rjes su thob pa /🔽srid pa kun tu sbyor ba /
analyzed: bdag gi don rjes su thob pa / srid pa kun tu sbyor ba /
translated: one who has attained his own welfare,

original: yongs su zad pa /
analyzed: yongs su zad pa /
translated: one whose fetters that bound him to existence are exhausted,

original: yang dag pa'i shes pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba des ni gang 'di skad du /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pas sems shin tu rnam par grol ba des ni gang 'di skad du /
translated: one whose right knowledge has completely liberated his mind,🔽he should not say this:

original: 'dir ni zla phyed tshes brgyad dang // de bzhin bcu bzhi bco lnga dang / cho 'phrul gyi ni zla phyed la'ang //
analyzed: 'dir ni zla phyed tshes brgyad dang // de bzhin bcu bzhi bco lnga dang / cho 'phrul gyi ni zla phyed la'ang //
translated: and likewise on the fourteenth and fifteenth, and on the full moon of the miracle month,

original: gso sbyong yan lag brgyad pa la //
analyzed: gso sbyong yan lag brgyad pa la //
translated: I will observe the eight-part poṣadha.

original: shin tu mnyam gzhag gnas byed 'dir //
analyzed: shin tu mnyam gzhag gnas byed 'dir //
translated: Here, I will abide in perfect equipoise.

original: nga ci 'dra bar de bzhin 'gyur //
analyzed: nga ci 'dra bar de bzhin 'gyur //
translated: I will become just like him.”

original: zhes tshigs su bcad pa 'di smras na logs par smras pa yin te nyes par smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes tshigs su bcad pa 'di smras na logs par smras pa yin te nyes par smras pa ma yin no //
translated: This verse is spoken by the bhikṣu, but it is not spoken wrongly or badly.

original: legs par bstod pa yin te //
analyzed: legs par bstod pa yin te //
translated: It is spoken well,

original: nyes par bstod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyes par bstod pa ma yin no //
translated: not badly.

original: legs par brjod pa yin te nyes par brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: legs par brjod pa yin te nyes par brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is spoken correctly, not incorrectly.

original: dge slong dag de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Bhikṣus, why is that?

original: dge slong de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: dge slong de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: Bhikṣus, that bhikṣu is free from desire,

original: zhe sdang dang bral ba /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bral ba /
translated: free from anger,

original: gti mug dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: gti mug dang bral ba ste /
translated: and free from ignorance.🔽He is free from birth, aging, sickness,

original: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya @23a * //
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya @23a * //
translated: death, sorrow,🔽lamentation, pain,🔽and despair.

original: ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba rnams las yongs su grol zhing sdug bsngal las yongs su grol ba'o zhes smra ste /
analyzed: ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba rnams las yongs su grol zhing sdug bsngal las yongs su grol ba'o zhes smra ste /
translated: They are completely liberated from birth, old age, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and agitation. They are completely liberated from suffering.

original: de bas na des ni gang 'di skad du /
analyzed: de bas na des ni gang 'di skad du /
translated: Therefore, it is good if you say this:🔽Here, on the eighth, fourteenth, and fifteenth,

original: 'dir ni zla phyed tshes brgyad dang // de bzhin bcu bzhi bco lnga dang // cho 'phrul gyi ni zla phyed la'ang //
analyzed: 'dir ni zla phyed tshes brgyad dang // de bzhin bcu bzhi bco lnga dang // cho 'phrul gyi ni zla phyed la'ang //
translated: and on the days of the lunar stations,

original: gso sbyong yan lag brgyad pa la //
analyzed: gso sbyong yan lag brgyad pa la //
translated: in the observance of the eightfold precepts,

original: shin tu mnyam gzhag gnas byed 'dir //
analyzed: shin tu mnyam gzhag gnas byed 'dir //
translated: I will abide in perfect equipoise.

original: nga ci 'dra bar de bzhin 'gyur //
analyzed: nga ci 'dra bar de bzhin 'gyur //
translated: Just as I am, so will they be.

original: zhes tshigs su bcad pa 'di smras na legs par smras pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes tshigs su bcad pa 'di smras na legs par smras pa yin te /
translated: If you say this verse, it is well said.

original: nyes par smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyes par smras pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not badly said.

original: legs par bstod pa yin te nyes par bstod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: legs par bstod pa yin te nyes par bstod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is a good praise, not a bad praise.

original: legs par brjod pa yin te nyes par brjod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: legs par brjod pa yin te nyes par brjod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is a good expression, not a bad expression.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi khor khor yug na /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi khor khor yug na /
translated: In the whole of Jambudvīpa,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i lam dpag tshad gcig tu gser gyi bye ma bdal te /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i lam dpag tshad gcig tu gser gyi bye ma bdal te /
translated: The path of a universal monarch is one yojana wide and is covered with golden sand.

original: rgya mtsho chen po'i chus pus mo nub pa tsam du yongs su khyab po //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po'i chus pus mo nub pa tsam du yongs su khyab po //
translated: It is completely filled with water from the great ocean up to one’s knees.

original: gang gi tshe 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po 'jig rten du 'byung ba'i tshe rgya mtsho chen po dpag tshad gnyis kyi bar du chu skam zhing med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po 'jig rten du 'byung ba'i tshe rgya mtsho chen po dpag tshad gnyis kyi bar du chu skam zhing med par 'gyur te /
translated: When a universal monarch appears in the world, the water of the great ocean recedes two yojanas.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po gang nas gling du 'gro ba de ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i lam yin no //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po gang nas gling du 'gro ba de ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i lam yin no //
translated: The path of the universal monarch is where the universal monarch travels to the continents.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'di skad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'di skad du /
translated: The Bhagavān also said:

original: dge slong dag sngon byung ba ma shar ba'i dus kyi tshe rta rin po che la zhon nas sa chen po 'dod pas nyi ma shar ba'i dus kyi tshe glang po rin po che la zhon nas sa chen po rgya mtsho la thug pa 'di nyid bskor te
analyzed: dge slong dag sngon byung ba ma shar ba'i dus kyi tshe rta rin po che la zhon nas sa chen po 'dod pas nyi ma shar ba'i dus kyi tshe glang po rin po che la zhon nas sa chen po rgya mtsho la thug pa 'di nyid bskor te
translated: Monks, in the past, when the sun had not risen, I rode on the precious horse and conquered the great earth. When the sun rose, I rode on the precious elephant and circumambulated this great earth that reaches to the ocean.

original: / rgyal po'i pho brang nas 'khor de nyid du song nas khye'u sus kyi bya ba byed do //
analyzed: / rgyal po'i pho brang nas 'khor de nyid du song nas khye'u sus kyi bya ba byed do //
translated: He went from the royal palace to the assembly and acted as the boy’s attendant.🔽“Bhikṣus, when the cakravartin king wishes to examine the precious horse, he mounts the precious horse at sunrise and travels throughout this great earth as far as the ocean,

original: dge slong dag gzhan yang 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal pos rta rin po che brtag par 'dod pas nyi ma shar ba'i dus kyi tshe rta rin po che la zhon nas sa chen po rgya mtsho la thug pa 'di nyid bskor te /
analyzed: dge slong dag gzhan yang 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal pos rta rin po che brtag par 'dod pas nyi ma shar ba'i dus kyi tshe rta rin po che la zhon nas sa chen po rgya mtsho la thug pa 'di nyid bskor te /
translated: returning to the royal palace at the end of the day.

original: rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor de nyid du song nas khye'u sus kyi bya ba byed do//🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor de nyid du song nas khye'u sus kyi bya ba byed do// zhes gsungs so //
translated: He went from the royal palace to the assembly and acted as the boy’s attendant.”

original: bsdus pa'i mdo la /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i mdo la /
translated: The Saṃkṣipta-sūtra says:

original: ri dang skye gnas dag dang ni //
analyzed: ri dang skye gnas dag dang ni //
translated: Mountains, forests,🔽Garuḍas, buying and selling,

original: nam mkha' lding dang nyo tshong dang // grang ba dag ni lnga par byas //
analyzed: nam mkha' lding dang nyo tshong dang // grang ba dag ni lnga par byas //
translated: And cold are the fifth.

original: dus tshigs kyang ni tha ma yin //
analyzed: dus tshigs kyang ni tha ma yin //
translated: The seasons are the last.

original: 'jig rten gzhag pa las tshigs drug pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhag pa las tshigs drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixth chapter, on the arrangement of the world.🔽In the sūtra it says:

original: mdo la // srung ma lha'i grong khyer srang rnams rgyal @23b byed pa //
analyzed: mdo la // srung ma lha'i grong khyer srang rnams rgyal @23b byed pa //
translated: The protector, the city of the gods, the streets are victorious.

original: chos bzangs rgyu ba'i lam dang 'obs dang skyed mos tshal //
analyzed: chos bzangs rgyu ba'i lam dang 'obs dang skyed mos tshal //
translated: The path of the good Dharma, the moat, and the pleasure grove,

original: sa gzhi dang ni yongs 'du rdo dang glang chen rnams //
analyzed: sa gzhi dang ni yongs 'du rdo dang glang chen rnams //
translated: the ground, the wish-fulfilling tree, and the elephants,

original: lha ma yin rnams kyi yang de dang 'dra ba yin //
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams kyi yang de dang 'dra ba yin //
translated: are also like that for the asuras.

original: lha'i grong khyer dang lha ma yin gyi grong gi bar du sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi srung ma rnam pa lnga bkod pa la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lha'i grong khyer dang lha ma yin gyi grong gi bar du sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi srung ma rnam pa lnga bkod pa la 'di lta ste /
translated: Between the city of the gods and the city of the asuras, the Thirty-Three gods have five types of guardians arranged:

original: chu na gnas pa'i klu rnams dang / lag na gzhong thogs kyi lha rnams dang / phreng thogs kyi lha rnams dang / rtag tu myos kyi lha rnams dang / rgyal po chen po bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: chu na gnas pa'i klu rnams dang / lag na gzhong thogs kyi lha rnams dang / phreng thogs kyi lha rnams dang / rtag tu myos kyi lha rnams dang / rgyal po chen po bzhi rnams so //
translated: the nāgas who dwell in the water, the gods who hold plates in their hands, the gods who hold garlands, the gods who are always intoxicated, and the four great kings.

original: gang gi tshe lha ma yin rnams sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams dang / lhan cig tu g-yul 'gyed par 'dod par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lha ma yin rnams sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams dang / lhan cig tu g-yul 'gyed par 'dod par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the asuras wish to wage war with the Thirty-Three gods,

original: dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa 'di lta ste /
translated: they assemble their four-division army,

original: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs rnams go cha gyon no //
analyzed: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs rnams go cha gyon no //
translated: the elephant division, the horse division, the chariot division, and the infantry division.

original: go cha rnam pa bzhi gyon pa la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: go cha rnam pa bzhi gyon pa la 'di lta ste /
translated: They put on four kinds of armor:

original: gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnams so //
analyzed: gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnams so //
translated: made of gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.

original: go cha rnam pa bzhi gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / beed'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnams bgos nas /
analyzed: go cha rnam pa bzhi gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / beed'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnams bgos nas /
translated: Having put on the four kinds of armor—made of gold, silver, beryl, and crystal—

original: mtshon cha bzhi la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshon cha bzhi la 'di lta ste /
translated: they take up four kinds of weapons:

original: ral gri dang / mdung dang / 'phang mdung dang / gzhu rnams so //
analyzed: ral gri dang / mdung dang / 'phang mdung dang / gzhu rnams so //
translated: swords, spears, javelins, and bows.

original: mtshon cha rnam pa bzhi ral gri dang / mdung dang / 'phang mdung dang / gzhu rnams blangs nas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams dang 'gyed pa'i phyir lha ma yin gyi grong khyer nas byung ngo //
