analyzed: mtshon cha rnam pa bzhi ral gri dang / mdung dang / 'phang mdung dang / gzhu rnams blangs nas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams dang 'gyed pa'i phyir lha ma yin gyi grong khyer nas byung ngo //
translated: Having taken up the four kinds of weapons—swords, spears, javelins, and bows—they emerge from the city of the asuras in order to fight with the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: lha ma yin de dag gi dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs rnams kyis go cha bgos te /
analyzed: lha ma yin de dag gi dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs rnams kyis go cha bgos te /
translated: The four divisions of the asura army—the elephant division, the horse division, the chariot division, and the infantry division—are armored.

original: go cha rnam pa bzhi gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnams bgos nas /
analyzed: go cha rnam pa bzhi gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnams bgos nas /
translated: They are armored in four types of armor made of gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.

original: mtshon cha rnam pa bzhi ral gri dang / mdung dang / 'phang mdung dang / gzhu rnams blangs te /
analyzed: mtshon cha rnam pa bzhi ral gri dang / mdung dang / 'phang mdung dang / gzhu rnams blangs te /
translated: They take up four types of weapons—swords, spears, javelins, and bows.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams dang 'gyed pa'i phyir lha ma yin gyi grong khyer nas byung ba de dag chu na gnas pa'i klu rnams kyis mthong ngo //🔽mthong nas chu na gnas pa'i klu rnams kyang dpung gi @24a * //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams dang 'gyed pa'i phyir lha ma yin gyi grong khyer nas byung ba de dag chu na gnas pa'i klu rnams kyis mthong ngo // mthong nas chu na gnas pa'i klu rnams kyang dpung gi @24a * //
translated: When they emerge from the asura city to fight with the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the nāgas who live in the water see them.

original: tshogs yan lag bzhi pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshogs yan lag bzhi pa 'di lta ste /
translated: When the nāgas who live in the water see them, they also assemble their four divisions of troops.

original: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs rnams kyang go cha bgos te go cha rnam pa bzhi gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang /🔽shel las byas pa rnams bgos nas /
analyzed: glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs rnams kyang go cha bgos te go cha rnam pa bzhi gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnams bgos nas /
translated: The four divisions of the army—the elephant division, the cavalry, the chariot division, and the infantry—are also armored. They wear four types of armor made of gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.

original: mtshon cha rnam pa bzhi ral gri dang / mdung dang / 'phang mdung dang / gzhu rnams blangs te /
analyzed: mtshon cha rnam pa bzhi ral gri dang / mdung dang / 'phang mdung dang / gzhu rnams blangs te /
translated: They take up four types of weapons—swords, spears, javelins, and bows.

original: lha ma yin rnams dang / lhan cig tu g-yul 'gyed do //
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams dang / lhan cig tu g-yul 'gyed do //
translated: They fight the asuras.

original: der ji ste klu rnams rgyal te /
analyzed: der ji ste klu rnams rgyal te /
translated: If the nāgas are victorious,

original: lha ma yin rnams pham par gyur na ni klu rnams kyis lha ma yin thub cing rdugs par byas te pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas lha ma yin gyi grong khyer du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams pham par gyur na ni klu rnams kyis lha ma yin thub cing rdugs par byas te pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas lha ma yin gyi grong khyer du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the nāgas defeat, crush, and drive the asuras back to the city of the asuras.

original: ji ste lha ma yin rnams rgyal te /
analyzed: ji ste lha ma yin rnams rgyal te /
translated: If the asuras are victorious,

original: klu rnams pham na ni lha ma yin rnams kyis sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi srung ma dang po klu rnams thub cing rdugs par byas te /
analyzed: klu rnams pham na ni lha ma yin rnams kyis sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi srung ma dang po klu rnams thub cing rdugs par byas te /
translated: If the nāgas are defeated, the asuras will defeat the nāgas, the first guardians of the Thirty-Three gods, and drive them away.

original: pham par byas nas rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas /
analyzed: pham par byas nas rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas /
translated: Having defeated them,

original: rgya mtsho chen po nas ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi bar rim dang po gang na lag na gzhong thogs kyi lha rnams 'khod par brje zhing 'gro'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po nas ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi bar rim dang po gang na lag na gzhong thogs kyi lha rnams 'khod par brje zhing 'gro'o //
translated: they will proceed from the great ocean to the first level of Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains, where the gods who hold plates in their hands reside.

original: de nas lag na gzhong thogs kyi lha rnams dang / chu na gnas pa'i klu rnams dang / srung ma gnyis gcig tu 'dus par gyur nas /
analyzed: de nas lag na gzhong thogs kyi lha rnams dang / chu na gnas pa'i klu rnams dang / srung ma gnyis gcig tu 'dus par gyur nas /
translated: Then the gods who hold plates in their hands and the nāgas who dwell in the water will unite as one guardian.

original: lha ma yin dang lhan cig tu g-yul 'gyed do //
analyzed: lha ma yin dang lhan cig tu g-yul 'gyed do //
translated: They will fight the asuras.

original: der ji ste srung ma gnyis rgyal te /
analyzed: der ji ste srung ma gnyis rgyal te /
translated: If the two guardians are victorious,

original: lha ma yin rnams pham na ni /
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams pham na ni /
translated: the asuras will be defeated.

original: srung ma gnyis kyis lha ma yin rnams thub cing rdugs par byas te /
analyzed: srung ma gnyis kyis lha ma yin rnams thub cing rdugs par byas te /
translated: The two guardians will defeat the asuras and drive them away.

original: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas lha ma yin gyi grong khyer du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas lha ma yin gyi grong khyer du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having defeated and driven them away, they will proceed to the city of the asuras.

original: ji ste lha ma yin rnams rgyal te /
analyzed: ji ste lha ma yin rnams rgyal te /
translated: If the asuras are victorious,

original: srung ma gnyis pham na ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi srung ma gnyis lha ma yin rnams kyis thub cing rdugs par byas te /
analyzed: srung ma gnyis pham na ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi srung ma gnyis lha ma yin rnams kyis thub cing rdugs par byas te /
translated: and the two guardians are defeated, then the asuras will defeat and drive away the two guardians of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas /
analyzed: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas /
translated: Having defeated and driven them away,

original: ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi bang rim dang po nas bar rim gnyis pa lag na phreng thogs kyi lha rnams 'khod par brje zhing 'gro'o //
analyzed: ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi bang rim dang po nas bar rim gnyis pa lag na phreng thogs kyi lha rnams 'khod par brje zhing 'gro'o //
translated: they will proceed from the first to the second level of Mount Sumeru, where the garland-bearers live.

original: de nas phreng thogs kyi lha rnams dang / lag na gzhong thogs kyi lha rnams dang / chu na gnas pa'i klu rnams dang / srung ma gsum po rnams @24b gcig tu 'dus par gyur nas lha ma yin rnams dang lhan cig tu g-yul 'gyed do //
analyzed: de nas phreng thogs kyi lha rnams dang / lag na gzhong thogs kyi lha rnams dang / chu na gnas pa'i klu rnams dang / srung ma gsum po rnams @24b gcig tu 'dus par gyur nas lha ma yin rnams dang lhan cig tu g-yul 'gyed do //
translated: Then the garland-bearers, the vessel-bearers, the nāgas who live in the water, and the three guardians will join forces and fight the asuras.

original: der ji ste srung ma gsum po rnams rgyal te /
analyzed: der ji ste srung ma gsum po rnams rgyal te /
translated: If the three guardians are victorious,🔽then the asuras are defeated.

original: lha ma yin rnams pham na ni srung ma gsum po dag gis lha ma yin rnams thub cing rdugs par byas te /
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams pham na ni srung ma gsum po dag gis lha ma yin rnams thub cing rdugs par byas te /
translated: The three guardians defeat and destroy the asuras,

original: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas lha ma yin gyi grong khyer du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas lha ma yin gyi grong khyer du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: defeating and driving them back to the asura city.

original: ji ste lha ma yin rnams rgyal te /
analyzed: ji ste lha ma yin rnams rgyal te /
translated: If the asuras are victorious,🔽then the three guardians of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three are defeated.

original: srung ma gsum po rnams pham na ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi srung ma gsum po rnams lha ma yin rnams kyis thub cing rdugs par byas te /🔽pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas /
analyzed: srung ma gsum po rnams pham na ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi srung ma gsum po rnams lha ma yin rnams kyis thub cing rdugs par byas te / pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas /
translated: The asuras defeat and destroy the three guardians,

original: ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi bang rim gnyis pa nas bang rim gsum pa gang na rtag tu myos pa'i lha rnams 'khod par brje zhing 'gro'o //
analyzed: ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi bang rim gnyis pa nas bang rim gsum pa gang na rtag tu myos pa'i lha rnams 'khod par brje zhing 'gro'o //
translated: defeating and driving them back from the second to the third terrace of Mount Sumeru, where the ever-infatuated gods reside.

original: de nas rtag tu myos pa'i lha rnams dang / phreng thogs kyi lha rnams dang / lag na gzhong thogs kyi lha rnams dang / chu na gnas pa'i klu rnams dang / srung ma rnam pa bzhi po rnams gcig tu 'dus par gyur nas lha ma yin rnams dang lhan cig tu g-yul 'gyed do //
analyzed: de nas rtag tu myos pa'i lha rnams dang / phreng thogs kyi lha rnams dang / lag na gzhong thogs kyi lha rnams dang / chu na gnas pa'i klu rnams dang / srung ma rnam pa bzhi po rnams gcig tu 'dus par gyur nas lha ma yin rnams dang lhan cig tu g-yul 'gyed do //
translated: Then, the ever-infatuated gods, the garland-bearer gods, the gods bearing vessels in their hands, the nāgas dwelling in the water, and the four guardians gather together and wage war with the asuras.

original: der ji ste srung ma bzhi po rnams rgyal te /
analyzed: der ji ste srung ma bzhi po rnams rgyal te /
translated: If the four guardians are victorious there,

original: lha ma yin rnams pham na ni srung ma bzhi po rnams kyis lha ma yin rnams thub cing rdugs par byas te /
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams pham na ni srung ma bzhi po rnams kyis lha ma yin rnams thub cing rdugs par byas te /
translated: and the asuras are defeated, the four guardians will defeat and crush the asuras.

original: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas lha ma yin gyi grong khyer du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas lha ma yin gyi grong khyer du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having defeated and driven them away, they will return to the city of the asuras.

original: ji ste lha ma yin rnams rgyal te /
analyzed: ji ste lha ma yin rnams rgyal te /
translated: If the asuras are victorious there,

original: srung ma bzhi po rnams pham na ni sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams kyi srung ma bzhi po dag lha ma yin rnams kyis thub cing rdugs par byas te /
analyzed: srung ma bzhi po rnams pham na ni sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams kyi srung ma bzhi po dag lha ma yin rnams kyis thub cing rdugs par byas te /
translated: and the four guardians are defeated, the asuras will defeat and crush the four guardians of the gods of the Thirty-Three.

original: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas /
analyzed: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas /
translated: having defeated and turned them back,

original: ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi bang rim gsum pa nas bang rim bzhi pa gang na rgyal po chen po bzhi rnams 'khod par brje zhing 'gro'o //
analyzed: ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi bang rim gsum pa nas bang rim bzhi pa gang na rgyal po chen po bzhi rnams 'khod par brje zhing 'gro'o //
translated: they go from the third to the fourth terrace of Mount Sumeru, where the Four Great Kings are located.

original: de nas rgyal po chen po bzhi po rnams dang / rtag tu myos pa'i lha rnams dang / phreng thogs kyi lha rnams dang lag na gzhong thogs kyi lha rnams dang / chu na gnas pa'i klu rnams dang / srung ma lnga po rnams gcig tu 'dus par gyur nas lha ma yin rnams dang lhan cig tu g-yul 'gyed do //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po chen po bzhi po rnams dang / rtag tu myos pa'i lha rnams dang / phreng thogs kyi lha rnams dang lag na gzhong thogs kyi lha rnams dang / chu na gnas pa'i klu rnams dang / srung ma lnga po rnams gcig tu 'dus par gyur nas lha ma yin rnams dang lhan cig tu g-yul 'gyed do //
translated: Then the Four Great Kings, the ever-infatuated gods, the garland-bearer gods, the gods bearing offerings in their hands, the water-dwelling nāgas, and the five guardians gather together and engage in battle with the asuras.

original: de ji ste srung ma lnga po rnams rgyal te /
analyzed: de ji ste srung ma lnga po rnams rgyal te /
translated: If the five guardians are victorious

original: lha ma yin rnams pham na ni srung ma lnga po rnams kyis lha ma yin @25a * //
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams pham na ni srung ma lnga po rnams kyis lha ma yin @25a * //
translated: and the asuras are defeated, the five guardians defeat and crush the asuras,

original: rnams thub cing rdugs par byas te /
analyzed: rnams thub cing rdugs par byas te /
translated: and the asuras flee into their city.

original: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas lha ma yin gyi grong khyer du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas lha ma yin gyi grong khyer du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having defeated and driven them away, they will go to the city of the demigods.

original: ji ste lha ma yin rnams rgyal te srung ma lnga po rnams pham na ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi srung ma lnga po rnams lha ma yin rnams kyis thub cing rdugs par byas te /
analyzed: ji ste lha ma yin rnams rgyal te srung ma lnga po rnams pham na ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi srung ma lnga po rnams lha ma yin rnams kyis thub cing rdugs par byas te /
translated: “ ‘If the demigods are victorious and the five guardians are defeated, the five guardians of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three will be overpowered and defeated by the demigods.

original: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas /🔽ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi bang rim bzhi pa nas steng gi gzhi gang na sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams 'khod par brje zhing 'gro'o //
analyzed: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas / ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi bang rim bzhi pa nas steng gi gzhi gang na sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams 'khod par brje zhing 'gro'o //
translated: Having defeated and driven them away,🔽they will go to the fourth terrace of Mount Sumeru, where they will displace the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: de nas rgyal po chen po bzhi lha rnams kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin gang na ba der song ste phyin nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po chen po bzhi lha rnams kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin gang na ba der song ste phyin nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: “ ‘Then the Four Great Kings will go to Śakra, lord of the gods, and say to him:

original: koo shi ka gang bdag cag srung ma lnga po rnams lha ma yin rnams kyis thub cing rdugs par byas te /
analyzed: koo shi ka gang bdag cag srung ma lnga po rnams lha ma yin rnams kyis thub cing rdugs par byas te /
translated: “Kauśika, know that we five guardians have been defeated, crushed, and humiliated by the asuras,🔽and that we have been driven back to the summit of Mount Sumeru.

original: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi bang rim gyi steng gi gzhir brjes te mchis par mkhyen par mdzod cig / koo shi ka da ltar gang gi dus la bab par dgongs shig / de nas lha'i dbang po brgya
analyzed: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi bang rim gyi steng gi gzhir brjes te mchis par mkhyen par mdzod cig / koo shi ka da ltar gang gi dus la bab par dgongs shig / de nas lha'i dbang po brgya
translated: Kauśika, now is the time to consider what should be done.”

original: byin gyis rgyal po chan po bzhi rnams kyi ltar mnyan nas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams la smras pa /
analyzed: byin gyis rgyal po chan po bzhi rnams kyi ltar mnyan nas sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams la smras pa /
translated: Then Śakra, lord of the gods, listened to the four great kings and said to the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three,

original: grogs po dag gang srung ma lnga po rnams lha ma yin rnams kyis thub cing rdugs par byas te /
analyzed: grogs po dag gang srung ma lnga po rnams lha ma yin rnams kyis thub cing rdugs par byas te /
translated: “Friends, the five guardians have been defeated, crushed, and humiliated by the asuras,

original: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas shing ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi steng gi gzhir brjes te /
analyzed: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas shing ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi steng gi gzhir brjes te /
translated: and they have been driven back to the summit of Mount Sumeru.

original: 'ongs pa shes par gyis shig / grogs po dag da ltar gang gi dus la bab pa soms shig de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa la bsams so //
analyzed: 'ongs pa shes par gyis shig / grogs po dag da ltar gang gi dus la bab pa soms shig de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa la bsams so //
translated: Know that the time has come.🔽Friends, consider the time that has come to pass.🔽Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, thought of the king of elephants, Airāvaṇa.

original: de nas glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyi mtshan mo rtogs nas /🔽dper na skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa lag pa bskum pa las brkyang pa 'am /
analyzed: de nas glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyi mtshan mo rtogs nas / dper na skyes bu stobs dang ldan pa lag pa bskum pa las brkyang pa 'am /
translated: Then the king of elephants, Airāvaṇa, understood Śakra, Lord of the Gods, in the night.

original: brkyang ba las bskum pa bzhin du glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa 'dzam bu'i gling nas mi snang bar byas te /
analyzed: brkyang ba las bskum pa bzhin du glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa 'dzam bu'i gling nas mi snang bar byas te /
translated: Just as a strong man might stretch out his bent arm or bend his outstretched arm, the king of elephants, Airāvaṇa, disappeared from Jambudvīpa

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du song ngo //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du song ngo //
translated: and went to the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: song nas mgo sum cu rtsa gnyis mngon par sprul te /
analyzed: song nas mgo sum cu rtsa gnyis mngon par sprul te /
translated: Having gone there, he manifested thirty-two heads.🔽Each head had six large tusks,

original: mgo re re la ma che ba drug drug / mche ba re re la rdzing bu bdun bdun /
analyzed: mgo re re la ma che ba drug drug / mche ba re re la rdzing bu bdun bdun /
translated: and on each tusk were seven ponds,

original: rdzing bu @25b re re la padma bdun bdun /
analyzed: rdzing bu @25b re re la padma bdun bdun /
translated: and in each pond were seven lotuses,🔽and on each lotus were seven celestial maidens,🔽and each celestial maiden had seven attendants.

original: padma re re la sdong bu bdun bdun /
analyzed: padma re re la sdong bu bdun bdun /
translated: On each lotus there are seven stalks.

original: sdong bu re re la lha'i bu mo bdun bdun /
analyzed: sdong bu re re la lha'i bu mo bdun bdun /
translated: On each stalk there are seven divine maidens.

original: lha'i bu mo re re la g-yog mo bdun bdun /
analyzed: lha'i bu mo re re la g-yog mo bdun bdun /
translated: On each divine maiden there are seven attendants.

original: g-yog mo ra re la sil snyan bdun bdun mngon bar sprul te /
analyzed: g-yog mo ra re la sil snyan bdun bdun mngon bar sprul te /
translated: On each attendant there are seven musical instruments.

original: mgo de dag thams cad kyi nang na khyad par du 'phags pa gang yin pa de la lha'i dbang po brgya byin zhon no //
analyzed: mgo de dag thams cad kyi nang na khyad par du 'phags pa gang yin pa de la lha'i dbang po brgya byin zhon no //
translated: Śakra, Lord of the Gods, rides the most excellent head of all.

original: de las gzhan pa'i mgo lhag ma rnams la ni nye ba'i dbang po sum cu rtsa gnyis po rnams zhon no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i mgo lhag ma rnams la ni nye ba'i dbang po sum cu rtsa gnyis po rnams zhon no //
translated: The other remaining heads are ridden by the thirty-two minor lords.

original: de las gzhan pa'i glang po che rnams la ni de las gzhan pa'i sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams zhon no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i glang po che rnams la ni de las gzhan pa'i sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams zhon no //
translated: The other elephants are ridden by the other gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: de shin tu mgyogs te /🔽dper na 'jig pa'i rlung ngam /
analyzed: de shin tu mgyogs te / dper na 'jig pa'i rlung ngam /
translated: It is extremely fast,🔽like the wind at the time of destruction

original: 'chags pa'i rlung bzhin te /
analyzed: 'chags pa'i rlung bzhin te /
translated: or the wind at the time of creation.

original: de ltar na lha 'am lha'i bu mo su yang 'di skad du 'di ni bdag gi mdun du 'gro'o zhe 'am phyi nas 'ong ngo snyam du sems pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar na lha 'am lha'i bu mo su yang 'di skad du 'di ni bdag gi mdun du 'gro'o zhe 'am phyi nas 'ong ngo snyam du sems pa med do //
translated: In this way, no god or divine maiden thinks, “This is going in front of me” or “This is coming from behind me.”

original: de nas glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi grong khyer lho phyogs kyi sgo nas byung ste /
analyzed: de nas glang po che'i rgyal po rab tu brtan pa sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi grong khyer lho phyogs kyi sgo nas byung ste /
translated: Then the king of elephants, Steadfast, came out of the southern gate of the city of the Thirty-Three Gods.

original: de nas skyed mos tshal rtsub 'gyur tshal du phyin nas /
analyzed: de nas skyed mos tshal rtsub 'gyur tshal du phyin nas /
translated: Then he went to the Nandana Grove.

original: rdzu 'phrul mngon bar 'du byed pa de btang ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul mngon bar 'du byed pa de btang ste /
translated: Then he gave up that magical creation.

original: 'di lta ste lha 'am /
analyzed: 'di lta ste lha 'am /
translated: It was like a god or

original: lha'i bu rdzu 'phrul che zhing mthu che ba gang yang rung ba dang 'dra bar bdag nyid mngon bar sprul te /
analyzed: lha'i bu rdzu 'phrul che zhing mthu che ba gang yang rung ba dang 'dra bar bdag nyid mngon bar sprul te /
translated: a son of a god with great magical power and great strength. He manifested himself

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams dang lhan cig tu lha'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la 'byor cing ldan bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams dang lhan cig tu lha'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la 'byor cing ldan bar 'gyur te /
translated: and together with the Thirty-Three Gods, he became endowed with and possessed the five divine sense pleasures.

original: rtse zhing dga' la dga' dgur spyod do //
analyzed: rtse zhing dga' la dga' dgur spyod do //
translated: He played, enjoyed, and amused himself.

original: rang gi las kyi 'bras bu nyams su myong ngo //
analyzed: rang gi las kyi 'bras bu nyams su myong ngo //
translated: He experienced the results of his own actions.

original: ji tsam du sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams skyed mos tshal rtsub 'gyur tshal du rtse zhing dga' la dga' dgur spyod pa de tsam du lus kyang rtsub par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji tsam du sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams skyed mos tshal rtsub 'gyur tshal du rtse zhing dga' la dga' dgur spyod pa de tsam du lus kyang rtsub par 'gyur la /
translated: Just as the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three enjoy themselves and indulge in pleasures in the Nandana Grove, their bodies become rough.

original: sems kyang rtsub bar 'gyur te /🔽de dag lus rtsub pa dang / sems rtsub pa dang / g-yul 'gyed pa la mngon bar mos par gyur nas dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa 'di lta ste /🔽glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs rnams go cha gyon te /
analyzed: sems kyang rtsub bar 'gyur te / de dag lus rtsub pa dang / sems rtsub pa dang / g-yul 'gyed pa la mngon bar mos par gyur nas dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa 'di lta ste / glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs rnams go cha gyon te /
translated: Their minds also become rough.🔽With their bodies and minds rough, they become intent on waging war.🔽They don armor for the four divisions of the army, namely, the division of elephants, the division of horses, the division of chariots, and the division of infantry.

original: dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs rnams kyi go cha rnam pa bzhi 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa glang po che'i tshogs dang / rta'i tshogs dang / shing rta'i tshogs dang / dpung bu chung gi tshogs rnams kyi go cha rnam pa bzhi 'di lta ste /
translated: They don the four types of armor for the four divisions of the army, namely, the division of elephants, the division of horses, the division of chariots, and the division of infantry.

original: gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel @26a * //
analyzed: gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel @26a * //
translated: made of gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.

original: las byas pa rnams bgos so //
analyzed: las byas pa rnams bgos so //
translated: They are distributed.

original: mtshon cha rnam pa bzhi 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshon cha rnam pa bzhi 'di lta ste /
translated: There are four types of weapons:

original: ral gri dang / mdung dang / 'phang mdung dang / gzhu rnams so //
analyzed: ral gri dang / mdung dang / 'phang mdung dang / gzhu rnams so //
translated: swords, spears, javelins, and bows.

original: mtshon cha rnam pa bzhi ral gri dang / mdung dang / 'phang mdung dang / gzhu rnams blangs nas lha ma yin rnams dang lhan cig tu g-yul 'gyed do //
analyzed: mtshon cha rnam pa bzhi ral gri dang / mdung dang / 'phang mdung dang / gzhu rnams blangs nas lha ma yin rnams dang lhan cig tu g-yul 'gyed do //
translated: Taking up these four types of weapons, the gods fight the asuras.

original: ji ste lha ma yin rnams rgyal te /
analyzed: ji ste lha ma yin rnams rgyal te /
translated: If the asuras are victorious

original: lha rnams pham na ni lha ma yin rnams kyis lha rnams thub cing rdugs par byas te /
analyzed: lha rnams pham na ni lha ma yin rnams kyis lha rnams thub cing rdugs par byas te /
translated: and the gods are defeated, the asuras defeat the gods, crush them,

original: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas shing rta byang phyogs su lha'i grong khyer gang na ba der phyir ldog go //
analyzed: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas shing rta byang phyogs su lha'i grong khyer gang na ba der phyir ldog go //
translated: and drive them back, and then turn their chariots around and return to the city of the gods in the north.

original: 'on kyang lha ma yin rnams lha rnams kyi phyi bzhin du snyegs par byed nas der lha rnams 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'on kyang lha ma yin rnams lha rnams kyi phyi bzhin du snyegs par byed nas der lha rnams 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: However, if the demigods pursue the gods, the gods think:

original: 'di ltar lha ma yin 'di dag bdag cag gi phyi bzhin du snyegs pa las na yang lan gnyis su g-yul 'gyed par 'dod do snyam du shes nas lha rnams phyir log ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar lha ma yin 'di dag bdag cag gi phyi bzhin du snyegs pa las na yang lan gnyis su g-yul 'gyed par 'dod do snyam du shes nas lha rnams phyir log ste /
translated: “Since the demigods are pursuing us, they want to fight a second time.”

original: lham yin rnams dang lhan cig tu g-yul 'gyed do //
analyzed: lham yin rnams dang lhan cig tu g-yul 'gyed do //
translated: The gods turn back and fight with the demigods.

original: ji ste lan gnyis su yang lha ma yin rnams rgyal te /
analyzed: ji ste lan gnyis su yang lha ma yin rnams rgyal te /
translated: If the demigods win a second time,

original: lha rnams pham na ni lha ma yin rnams kyis lha rnams thub cing rdugs par byas te /
analyzed: lha rnams pham na ni lha ma yin rnams kyis lha rnams thub cing rdugs par byas te /
translated: the demigods defeat and crush the gods.

original: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas shing rta byang phyogs su lha'i grong khyer gang na bar phyir ldog go //
analyzed: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas shing rta byang phyogs su lha'i grong khyer gang na bar phyir ldog go //
translated: Having defeated and driven them away, the demigods turn back north to the city of the gods.

original: 'on kyang lha ma yin rnams lha rnams kyi phyi bzhin du snyegs par byed na ni der lha rnams 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'on kyang lha ma yin rnams lha rnams kyi phyi bzhin du snyegs par byed na ni der lha rnams 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: However, if the demigods pursue the gods, the gods think:🔽“

original: 'di ltar lha ma yin 'di dag bdag cag gi phyi bzhin du snye gas pha las na yang lan gsum du g-yul 'gyed par 'dod do snyam du shes nas lha rnams phyir log ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar lha ma yin 'di dag bdag cag gi phyi bzhin du snye gas pha las na yang lan gsum du g-yul 'gyed par 'dod do snyam du shes nas lha rnams phyir log ste /
translated: “These asuras are harassing us. They want to fight us three times.”🔽

original: lha ma yin rnams dang lhan cig tu g-yul 'gyed do //
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams dang lhan cig tu g-yul 'gyed do //
translated: The gods, having understood that the asuras are pursuing them, think: They want to fight us a third time. The gods then return to fight the asuras.

original: ji ste lha ma yin rnams 'ba' zhig rgyal te /🔽lha rnams pham na ni lha ma yin rnams kyis lha rnams thub cing rdugs par byas te /
analyzed: ji ste lha ma yin rnams 'ba' zhig rgyal te / lha rnams pham na ni lha ma yin rnams kyis lha rnams thub cing rdugs par byas te /
translated: If the asuras are victorious,🔽the gods are defeated, crushed, and destroyed by the asuras.

original: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas lha'i grong khyer du 'jug go//
analyzed: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas lha'i grong khyer du 'jug go//
translated: Having been defeated and driven back, the gods enter their city.

original: lha'i grong khyer du zhugs nas sgo rnams bcad de /
analyzed: lha'i grong khyer du zhugs nas sgo rnams bcad de /
translated: Having entered their city, they close the gates

original: lha rnams la lha ma yin rnams kyis mi tshugs kyang 'jigs shing skrag pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis shas cher gnas so //
analyzed: lha rnams la lha ma yin rnams kyis mi tshugs kyang 'jigs shing skrag pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis shas cher gnas so //
translated: and remain there, their minds filled with fear and terror, even though the asuras cannot harm them.

original: 'on kyang lha ma yin rnams kyis der mi brdzi bzhin du lha ma yin rnams kyang 'di ltar lha rnams ni lha'i grong khyer na @26b 'dug kyang 'jigs shing skrag pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis shas cher gnas mod kyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang lha ma yin rnams kyis der mi brdzi bzhin du lha ma yin rnams kyang 'di ltar lha rnams ni lha'i grong khyer na @26b 'dug kyang 'jigs shing skrag pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis shas cher gnas mod kyi /
translated: However, the asuras, without being crushed by the gods, think, “The gods, though dwelling in the divine city, mostly live with a mind of fear and terror.

original: bdag cag gis der mi brdzi'o snyam du shes pa'i mthong ba 'jug go //🔽ji ste lha rnams rgyal te /
analyzed: bdag cag gis der mi brdzi'o snyam du shes pa'i mthong ba 'jug go // ji ste lha rnams rgyal te /
translated: We will not be crushed by them.”

original: lha ma yin rnams pham na ni lha rnams kyis lha ma yin rnams thub cing rdugs par byas te /
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams pham na ni lha rnams kyis lha ma yin rnams thub cing rdugs par byas te /
translated: If the gods are victorious and the asuras are defeated, the gods will defeat and crush the asuras.

original: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas shing rta lho phyogs su lha ma yin gyi grong khyer gang na bar phyir ldog go //🔽'on kyang lha rnams lha ma yin rnams kyi phyi bzhin du snyegs par byed na ni /
analyzed: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas shing rta lho phyogs su lha ma yin gyi grong khyer gang na bar phyir ldog go // 'on kyang lha rnams lha ma yin rnams kyi phyi bzhin du snyegs par byed na ni /
translated: Having defeated and turned them away, the chariot will return to the south, to the city of the asuras.🔽If the gods pursue the asuras, the asuras will think,

original: de ltar lha ma yin rnams 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de ltar lha ma yin rnams 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: “The gods are pursuing us.

original: 'di ltar lha 'di dag bdag cag gi phyi bzhin du snyegs pa las na yang lan gnyis su g-yul 'gyed par 'dod do snyam du shes nas lha ma yin rnams phyir ldog te /
analyzed: 'di ltar lha 'di dag bdag cag gi phyi bzhin du snyegs pa las na yang lan gnyis su g-yul 'gyed par 'dod do snyam du shes nas lha ma yin rnams phyir ldog te /
translated: “The gods know that the asuras are pursuing them and that they want to fight a second time.

original: lha rnams dang lhan cig g-yul 'gyed do //
analyzed: lha rnams dang lhan cig g-yul 'gyed do //
translated: The asuras turn around and fight the gods.

original: ji ste lan gnyis su yang lha rnams rgyal te /
analyzed: ji ste lan gnyis su yang lha rnams rgyal te /
translated: If the gods win a second time,

original: lham yin rnams pham na ni lha rnams kyis lha ma yin rnams thub cing rdugs par byas te /
analyzed: lham yin rnams pham na ni lha rnams kyis lha ma yin rnams thub cing rdugs par byas te /
translated: the asuras are defeated and destroyed by the gods.

original: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas /
analyzed: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas /
translated: They are defeated and driven back.

original: shing rta lho phyogs su lha ma yin gyi grong khyer gang na bar phyir ldog go //
analyzed: shing rta lho phyogs su lha ma yin gyi grong khyer gang na bar phyir ldog go //
translated: The chariot turns around and heads south to the asura city.

original: 'on kyang lha rnams lha ma yin rnams kyi phyi bzhin du snyegs par byed na ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang lha rnams lha ma yin rnams kyi phyi bzhin du snyegs par byed na ni /
translated: If the gods pursue the asuras,

original: der lha ma yin rnams 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: der lha ma yin rnams 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: the asuras think,🔽‘

original: 'di ltar lha 'di dag bdag cag gi phyi bzhin du snyegs pa las na lan gsum du g-yul 'gyed par 'dod do snyam du shes nas lha ma yin rnams phyir log ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar lha 'di dag bdag cag gi phyi bzhin du snyegs pa las na lan gsum du g-yul 'gyed par 'dod do snyam du shes nas lha ma yin rnams phyir log ste /
translated: “ ‘The gods are pursuing us. They want to fight us three times. ’ Knowing this, the asuras return.

original: lha rnams dang lhan cig tu g-yul 'gyed do //
analyzed: lha rnams dang lhan cig tu g-yul 'gyed do //
translated: They fight the gods.

original: ji ste lan gsum du lha rnams 'ba' zhig rgyal te /
analyzed: ji ste lan gsum du lha rnams 'ba' zhig rgyal te /
translated: If the gods win three times in a row,

original: lha ma yin rnams pham na ni lha rnams kyis lha ma yin rnams thub cing rdugs par byas te /
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams pham na ni lha rnams kyis lha ma yin rnams thub cing rdugs par byas te /
translated: the gods will defeat the asuras, crush them,

original: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas /
analyzed: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas /
translated: and make them flee.

original: lha ma yin gyi grong khyer du 'jug go //
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi grong khyer du 'jug go //
translated: They will enter the city of the asuras.

original: lha ma yin gyi grong du zhugs nas sgo rnams bcad do /
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi grong du zhugs nas sgo rnams bcad do /
translated: Having entered the city of the asuras, they will close the gates.

original: lha ma yin rnams la lha rnams kyis mi tshugs kyang 'jigs shing skrag pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis shas cher gnas so //
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams la lha rnams kyis mi tshugs kyang 'jigs shing skrag pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis shas cher gnas so //
translated: The asuras will remain there, their minds filled with fear and terror, and the gods will not be able to reach them.

original: 'on kyang lha rnams kyis der mi brdzi bzhin du lha rnams kyang 'di ltar lha ma yin rnams ni lham yin gyi grong khyer na 'dug kyang /
analyzed: 'on kyang lha rnams kyis der mi brdzi bzhin du lha rnams kyang 'di ltar lha ma yin rnams ni lham yin gyi grong khyer na 'dug kyang /
translated: However, the gods do not let them enter.🔽

original: 'jigs shing skrag pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis shas cher gnas mod kyi /
analyzed: 'jigs shing skrag pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis shas cher gnas mod kyi /
translated: However, the gods do not enter there, but the gods see that the demigods are demigods, and they mostly remain in the city with a fearful and terrified mind.

original: bdag cag gis ni der mi @27a * //🔽brdzi'o snyam du shes pa'i mthong ba 'jug go //
analyzed: bdag cag gis ni der mi @27a * // brdzi'o snyam du shes pa'i mthong ba 'jug go //
translated: We do not enter there.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'di skad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'di skad du /
translated: The Bhagavān also said this:

original: dge slong dag sngon byung ba lha dang lha ma yin g-yul du zhugs pa lha ma yin rnams rgyal te /
analyzed: dge slong dag sngon byung ba lha dang lha ma yin g-yul du zhugs pa lha ma yin rnams rgyal te /
translated: “Monks, in the past, the gods and demigods engaged in battle. The demigods were victorious.

original: lha rnams pham na ni lha ma yin rnams kyis lha rnams thub cing rdugs par byas te /
analyzed: lha rnams pham na ni lha ma yin rnams kyis lha rnams thub cing rdugs par byas te /
translated: When the gods were defeated, the demigods conquered the gods, crushed them,

original: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas /
analyzed: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas /
translated: defeated them, and turned them back.

original: shing rta byang phyogs su lha'i grong khyer gang na bar phyir ldog go //
analyzed: shing rta byang phyogs su lha'i grong khyer gang na bar phyir ldog go //
translated: The chariot turned back to the north, to the city of the gods.

original: 'on kyang lha ma yin rnams lha rnams kyi phyi bzhin du snyegs bar byed na ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang lha ma yin rnams lha rnams kyi phyi bzhin du snyegs bar byed na ni /
translated: However, if the demigods pursued the gods,

original: der lha rnams 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: der lha rnams 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The gods think:

original: 'di ltar lha ma yin 'di dag bdag cag gi phyi bzhin du snyegs pa las na yang lan gnyis su g-yul 'gyed par 'dod do shes nas lha rnams phyir log ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar lha ma yin 'di dag bdag cag gi phyi bzhin du snyegs pa las na yang lan gnyis su g-yul 'gyed par 'dod do shes nas lha rnams phyir log ste /
translated: “Since the demigods are pursuing us, they want to fight a second time.”

original: lha ma yin rnams dang lhan cig tu g-yul 'gyed do //
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams dang lhan cig tu g-yul 'gyed do //
translated: The gods return and fight with the demigods.

translated: The gods are defeated and turn their backs,🔽and the asuras enter the supreme city of the gods.🔽 Having entered the city of the gods, they close the gates.🔽 Although the asuras cannot harm the gods, the gods mostly remain with frightened minds.🔽 🔽The gods are defeated and turn their backs,🔽and the asuras enter the supreme city of the gods.🔽 Having entered the city of the gods, they close the gates.

translated: “We will not be crushed there.”

original: dge slong dag 'di ltar snga ma 'das pa'i dus na /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ltar snga ma 'das pa'i dus na /
translated: “Monks, in this way, in the past,

analyzed: lha dang lha ma yin g-yul du zhugs pa na lha rnams rgyal te /

original: lha ma yin rnams pham na ni lha rnams kyis lha ma yin rnams thub cing rdugs par byas te /

original: lha ma yin rnams phyir ldog ste /

analyzed: lha ma yin rnams pham na ni lha rnams kyis lha ma yin rnams thub cing rdugs par byas te pham par byas shing /

analyzed: rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas shing rta lho phyogs su lha ma yin gyi grong khyer gang na bar phyir ldog go //

original: 'on kyang lha rnams lha ma yin rnams kyi phyi bzhin du snyegs par byed na ni der lha ma yin rnams 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'on kyang lha rnams lha ma yin rnams kyi phyi bzhin du snyegs par byed na ni der lha ma yin rnams 'di snyam du sems te /

analyzed: 'di ltar lha 'di dag bdag cag gi phyi bzhin du snyegs pa las na yang lan gsum du g-yul 'gyed par 'dod do snyam du shes nas /

analyzed: pham par byas shing rgyab kyis phyogs par byas nas lha ma yin gyi grong khyer du 'jug go //

original: lha ma yin gyi grong khyer du zhugs nas sgo rnams bcad de /
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi grong khyer du zhugs nas sgo rnams bcad de /

original: lha ma yin rnams la lha rnams kyis mi tshugs kyang 'jigs shing skrag pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis shas cher gnas so //
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams la lha rnams kyis mi tshugs kyang 'jigs shing skrag pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis shas cher gnas so //

original: 'on kyang lha rnams kyis der mi brdzi bzhin du lha rnams kyang 'di ltar lha ma yin rnams ni lha ma yin gyi grong khyer na 'dug kyang 'jigs shing skrag pa dang ldan pa'i sems kyis shas cher gnas mod kyi /

analyzed: bdag cag gis @28a * // ni der mi brdzi'o snyam du shes pa'i mthong ba 'jug go //

analyzed: dge slong dag sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na de lta bur gyur pa'i tshe /
translated: “Monks, in the past, at a time when the world was in the process of formation,

analyzed: 'di skad du /

analyzed: gang tshe lha dang lha min lhan cig tu //

analyzed: gnyi ga 'dus shing g-yul ni 'gyed pa na //

analyzed: shing rta pa ni nyi zla mtshungs med de //

original: lha yi shing rta pa ni mchog yin no //
analyzed: lha yi shing rta pa ni mchog yin no //

original: zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: zhes kyang bya'o //

original: ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi steng gi gzhi ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi grong khyer blta na sdug ces bya ba chur dpag tshad nyis stong lnga brgya /
analyzed: ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi steng gi gzhi ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi grong khyer blta na sdug ces bya ba chur dpag tshad nyis stong lnga brgya /
translated: The base of Mount Meru, king of mountains, is the city of the Thirty-three gods called Lovely to Behold, 2,500 yojanas in breadth.🔽

original: zheng du yang nyis stong lnga brgya /
analyzed: zheng du yang nyis stong lnga brgya /
translated: The base of Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains, is the city of the Thirty-three called Lovely to Behold, which is 2,500 yojanas in height and width.

original: mtha' skor du dpag tshad khri yod pa /
analyzed: mtha' skor du dpag tshad khri yod pa /

original: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa zhig yod de /
analyzed: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa zhig yod de /
translated: It is well-shaped, beautiful and attractive.

analyzed: gser gyi ra bas bskor te ra ba'i 'phang du ni dpag tshad phyed dang gsum yod do //

original: rab de la rtsig skyabs rnams pa bzhi las byas pa yod de /
analyzed: rab de la rtsig skyabs rnams pa bzhi las byas pa yod de /

original: gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnams so //
analyzed: gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnams so //

original: gyen du 'phang ba'i mda' yab dang / thur du 'phang ba'i mda' yab dang / zam pa brgyud ma rnams pa bzhi yod de //
analyzed: gyen du 'phang ba'i mda' yab dang / thur du 'phang ba'i mda' yab dang / zam pa brgyud ma rnams pa bzhi yod de //
translated: There are four types of parapets:

original: gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnams so //
analyzed: gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnams so //
translated: made of gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.

original: de'i nang gi sa gzhi dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes te /
analyzed: de'i nang gi sa gzhi dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes te /
translated: The ground inside is well-shaped, beautiful, and attractive.

original: bris shing legs par bris pa tshon sna brgya rtsa gcig gis bris pa ste /
analyzed: bris shing legs par bris pa tshon sna brgya rtsa gcig gis bris pa ste /

original: 'jam zhing shin tu 'jam pa ni dper na shing bal gyi 'dab ma 'am ras bal kyi 'dab ma bzhin du /
analyzed: 'jam zhing shin tu 'jam pa ni dper na shing bal gyi 'dab ma 'am ras bal kyi 'dab ma bzhin du /
translated: It is smooth and very smooth, like a drawing in cotton or silk.

original: rkang pa bzhag na ni nems  zhes byed de /
analyzed: rkang pa bzhag na ni nems  zhes byed de /
translated: When the foot is placed down, it sinks in.

original: rkang pa bteg na ni par zhes byed de /
analyzed: rkang pa bteg na ni par zhes byed de /

analyzed: me tog man dar ba mang pos pus mo nub pa tsam du yongs su khebs te /
translated: It is completely covered with many mandārava flowers up to the knees.

original: rlung gi mthus me tog rnying pa rnams ni 'thor /
analyzed: rlung gi mthus me tog rnying pa rnams ni 'thor /
translated: By the power of the wind, old flowers fall off

original: me tog gsar pa rnams ni legs par bkram ste /
analyzed: me tog gsar pa rnams ni legs par bkram ste /
translated: and new flowers spread out well.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: lha rnams bsod nams dbang gi mthu stobs kyis //
analyzed: lha rnams bsod nams dbang gi mthu stobs kyis //
translated: By the power of the strength of the gods' merit,

original: lha yi grong khyer dag na rlung chen ldang // me tog rnying pa rnams ni 'dor bar byed //
analyzed: lha yi grong khyer dag na rlung chen ldang // me tog rnying pa rnams ni 'dor bar byed //
translated: In the divine cities, a great wind blows,

original: me tog gsar pa rnams ni legs par dgram //
analyzed: me tog gsar pa rnams ni legs par dgram //
translated: removing old flowers and

original: zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: arranging new ones.

original: lha'i grong khyer de ni sgo stong du gcig gis ma tshang ba yod do //🔽sgo gcig gi yang 'phang du ni dpag tshad phyed dang gsum /
analyzed: lha'i grong khyer de ni sgo stong du gcig gis ma tshang ba yod do // sgo gcig gi yang 'phang du ni dpag tshad phyed dang gsum /
translated: The divine cities have nine hundred and ninety-nine gates.🔽Each gate is one and a half yojanas high

original: @28b zheng du ni dpag tshad phyed dang gnyis yod do //🔽sgo re re la yang skar ma'i gzugs su byas pa bzhi bzhi yod de /🔽gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnams so //
analyzed: @28b zheng du ni dpag tshad phyed dang gnyis yod do // sgo re re la yang skar ma'i gzugs su byas pa bzhi bzhi yod de / gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnams so //
translated: and one yojana wide.🔽At each gate there are four stars made of gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.🔽There are four mirrors made of gold, silver, beryl, and crystal,

original: zla ba phyed pa lta bur yongs su grub pa dang / ba lang gi mgo lta bu dang / me long rnams kyang gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: zla ba phyed pa lta bur yongs su grub pa dang / ba lang gi mgo lta bu dang / me long rnams kyang gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa bzhi yod de /
translated: shaped like a half-moon, a bull's head, and a mirror.

original: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa yin no //
analyzed: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa yin no //
translated: It is well-shaped, beautiful and pleasant to behold.

original: sgo re re la yang sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams srung ba'i phyir dang / bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / mdzes par bya ba'i phyir srung ma go cha bgos shing mtshon cha thogs pa lnga brgya bkod do //
analyzed: sgo re re la yang sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams srung ba'i phyir dang / bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / mdzes par bya ba'i phyir srung ma go cha bgos shing mtshon cha thogs pa lnga brgya bkod do //
translated: In order to protect, to accomplish and to beautify each gate, five hundred guardians are stationed, wearing armor and carrying weapons.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi lam sring srid du dpag tshad nyis stong lnga brgya yod la zheng du dpag tshad bcu gnyis yod do //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi lam sring srid du dpag tshad nyis stong lnga brgya yod la zheng du dpag tshad bcu gnyis yod do //
translated: The path of the Thirty-Three gods is two thousand five hundred leagues long and twelve leagues wide.

original: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug pa mdzes pa gser gyi bye ma bdal zhing tsandan gyi chus chag chag btab pa zhig yod do //
analyzed: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug pa mdzes pa gser gyi bye ma bdal zhing tsandan gyi chus chag chag btab pa zhig yod do //
translated: It is well-shaped, beautiful and pleasant to behold, covered with golden sand and sprinkled with sandalwood water.

original: srang de'i glo g-yas g-yon na rdzing bu byas pa'i rdzing bu de dag gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa'i pha gu rnam pa bzhi brtsigs so //
analyzed: srang de'i glo g-yas g-yon na rdzing bu byas pa'i rdzing bu de dag gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa'i pha gu rnam pa bzhi brtsigs so //
translated: On the right and left sides of this path are ponds. These ponds are made of four kinds of precious materials: gold, silver, beryl and crystal.

original: rdzing bu de dag gi phyogs bzhi na them skas byas pa yod de /
analyzed: rdzing bu de dag gi phyogs bzhi na them skas byas pa yod de /
translated: In the four directions of those ponds, stairs are made.

original: them skas de dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: them skas de dag 'di lta ste /
translated: Those stairs are like this:

original: gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa'i pha gu rnams pa bzhi brtsigs so //
analyzed: gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa'i pha gu rnams pa bzhi brtsigs so //
translated: They are built with four railings, namely, made of gold, made of silver, made of beryl, and made of crystal.

original: rdzing bu de dag gi lan kan gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa bzhi kun nas bskor te /
analyzed: rdzing bu de dag gi lan kan gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa bzhi kun nas bskor te /
translated: Those ponds are completely surrounded by four railings, made of gold, made of silver, made of beryl, and made of crystal.

original: gser gyi lan kan gyi gtan ma dang / gdang bu dang gzungs gzer ni dngul las byas so //
analyzed: gser gyi lan kan gyi gtan ma dang / gdang bu dang gzungs gzer ni dngul las byas so //
translated: The lower part, the crossbar, and the bolt of the golden railing are made of silver.

original: dngul gyi ni gser las byas so //
analyzed: dngul gyi ni gser las byas so //
translated: The silver [railing] is made of gold.

original: bee d'urya'i shel las byas so //
analyzed: bee d'urya'i shel las byas so //
translated: The beryl [railing] is made of crystal.

original: shel gyi lan kan gyi gtan ma dang / gdong bu dang / gzungs gzer ni bee d'urya las byas te /
analyzed: shel gyi lan kan gyi gtan ma dang / gdong bu dang / gzungs gzer ni bee d'urya las byas te /
translated: The lower part, the crossbar, and the bolt of the crystal railing are made of beryl.

original: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes so //
analyzed: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes so //
translated: They are well-shaped, beautiful, and pleasing to behold.

original: rdzing bu de dag kyang chu bsil zhing chu sbrang rtsi lta bus gang ste /🔽me tog autpa la dang / padma dang / ku mu ta dang / @29a * //
analyzed: rdzing bu de dag kyang chu bsil zhing chu sbrang rtsi lta bus gang ste / me tog autpa la dang / padma dang / ku mu ta dang / @29a * //
translated: Those ponds are filled with cool water and honey-like nectar.🔽They are covered with utpala, padma, kumuda, and

original: padma dkar pos yongs su khebs te /
analyzed: padma dkar pos yongs su khebs te /
translated: white lotuses.

original: de dag la ni chu nas skyes pa'i bya sna tshogs skad snyan cing 'jebs pa dang / skad yid du 'ong ba dang / skad mnyen pa dang / 'dod dgur sgyur ba'i gzugs can rnams skad snyan pa 'byin no //
analyzed: de dag la ni chu nas skyes pa'i bya sna tshogs skad snyan cing 'jebs pa dang / skad yid du 'ong ba dang / skad mnyen pa dang / 'dod dgur sgyur ba'i gzugs can rnams skad snyan pa 'byin no //
translated: In them, various water birds sing sweet, melodious, and pleasant songs, with forms that can change at will.

original: rdzing bu de dag gi nye 'khor na me tog gi shing dang / 'bras bu'i shing sna tshogs pa rnams legs par skyes shing dbyibs legs la yongs su grub ste /
analyzed: rdzing bu de dag gi nye 'khor na me tog gi shing dang / 'bras bu'i shing sna tshogs pa rnams legs par skyes shing dbyibs legs la yongs su grub ste /
translated: Around those ponds, various flower trees and fruit trees grow well, with good shapes and perfect forms.

original: me tog phreng bar bkod pa bzhin du gyur pa ni dper na me tog phreng rgyud dang / me tog phreng rgyud kyi slob ma mkhas pas me tog gi phreng ba tha gu la brgyus pa dang / me tog gi rna rgyan legs par byas pa bzhin te /
analyzed: me tog phreng bar bkod pa bzhin du gyur pa ni dper na me tog phreng rgyud dang / me tog phreng rgyud kyi slob ma mkhas pas me tog gi phreng ba tha gu la brgyus pa dang / me tog gi rna rgyan legs par byas pa bzhin te /
translated: They are like garlands of flowers, for example, like garlands of flowers, or like a garland maker or his skilled apprentice, or like a well-made flower chaplet.

original: thang las skyes pa'i bya sna tshogs skad snyan cing 'jebs pa dang / skad yid du 'ong ba dang / skad mnyen pa dang / 'dod dgur sgyur ba'i gzugs can rnams skad snyan pa 'byin to //
analyzed: thang las skyes pa'i bya sna tshogs skad snyan cing 'jebs pa dang / skad yid du 'ong ba dang / skad mnyen pa dang / 'dod dgur sgyur ba'i gzugs can rnams skad snyan pa 'byin to //
translated: The various birds born in the fields sing sweetly, with a pleasant voice, a soft voice, and a voice that can change at will.

original: de dag gi nye 'khor na dpag bsam gyi shing sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnams pa bzhi yod do //
analyzed: de dag gi nye 'khor na dpag bsam gyi shing sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnams pa bzhi yod do //
translated: In their vicinity are the four kinds of wish fulfilling trees: blue, yellow, red, and white.

original: gzhag gos sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnams pa bzhi yod do //
analyzed: gzhag gos sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnams pa bzhi yod do //
translated: There are four kinds of garments: blue, yellow, red, and white.

original: dpag bsam shing las byung ba'i gos sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnam pa bzhi yod do //
analyzed: dpag bsam shing las byung ba'i gos sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnam pa bzhi yod do //
translated: There are four kinds of trees that produce garments: blue, yellow, red, and white.

original: rgyan sna tshogs lag rgyan dang / rkang rgyan dang / rgyan snang ba dang / mi snang ba rnams 'byung ba'i shing dag yod do //
analyzed: rgyan sna tshogs lag rgyan dang / rkang rgyan dang / rgyan snang ba dang / mi snang ba rnams 'byung ba'i shing dag yod do //
translated: There are trees that produce various ornaments: armlets, anklets, visible and invisible ornaments.

original: lha'am lha'i bu mo dag gis ji lta bur 'dod pa'i sems bskyed ma thag tu de lta bur de dag gi lag tu 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha'am lha'i bu mo dag gis ji lta bur 'dod pa'i sems bskyed ma thag tu de lta bur de dag gi lag tu 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As soon as a god or goddess thinks of something, it appears in their hands.

original: rol mo'i cha byad sna tshogs pi wang dang / gling bu dang / pi wang rgyud gsum pa dang / 'khar rnga dang / ham shang rnams 'byung ba'i shing dag yod de /
analyzed: rol mo'i cha byad sna tshogs pi wang dang / gling bu dang / pi wang rgyud gsum pa dang / 'khar rnga dang / ham shang rnams 'byung ba'i shing dag yod de /
translated: There are trees that produce various musical instruments: flutes, lutes, three-stringed lutes, clay drums, and tabors.

original: lha 'am lha'i bu mo rnams kyis ji lta bur 'dod par sems bskyed ma thag tu de lta bur de dag gi lag tu 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha 'am lha'i bu mo rnams kyis ji lta bur 'dod par sems bskyed ma thag tu de lta bur de dag gi lag tu 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As soon as a god or goddess thinks of something, it appears in their hands.

original: bdud rtsi rnam pa bzhi dang / sbrang rtsi dang / sbrang chang gi btung ba dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: bdud rtsi rnam pa bzhi dang / sbrang rtsi dang / sbrang chang gi btung ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: There are also four kinds of nectar, honey, and mead to drink.

original: yang thog rnams dang / khang pa brtsegs pa rnams dang / khyim rnams dang / khang bzangs rnams dang / bsil khang rnams dang // ltad mo lta ba'i sa rnams dang / zam pa rnams bud med kyi tshogs @29b kyis mdzes par byas shing lha'i bu mo mang pos brten pa dang /
analyzed: yang thog rnams dang / khang pa brtsegs pa rnams dang / khyim rnams dang / khang bzangs rnams dang / bsil khang rnams dang // ltad mo lta ba'i sa rnams dang / zam pa rnams bud med kyi tshogs @29b kyis mdzes par byas shing lha'i bu mo mang pos brten pa dang /
translated: There are also terraces, multi-storied buildings, houses, mansions, pavilions, viewing stands, and bridges, all beautified by crowds of women and frequented by many celestial maidens.

original: sil snyan dang / pheg rdob pa dag gi sgra snyan pa sgrogs pa dang / dri sna tshogs kyis legs par bsgos pa dang / kha zas dang btung ba dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: sil snyan dang / pheg rdob pa dag gi sgra snyan pa sgrogs pa dang / dri sna tshogs kyis legs par bsgos pa dang / kha zas dang btung ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: There are pleasant sounds of musical instruments and percussion, various fragrances, and food and drink.

original: de na sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams 'khor dang bcas pa rtse zhing dga' la dga' dgur spyod do //
analyzed: de na sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams 'khor dang bcas pa rtse zhing dga' la dga' dgur spyod do //
translated: There, the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, together with their retinues, play, enjoy themselves, and indulge in pleasures.

original: rang gi las kyi 'bras bu nyams su myong ngo /
analyzed: rang gi las kyi 'bras bu nyams su myong ngo /
translated: They experience the fruits of their own actions.

original: // /'jig rten gzhag pa /
analyzed: // /'jig rten gzhag pa /
translated: The Arrangement of the World

original: bam po bzhi pa /
analyzed: bam po bzhi pa /
translated: PART IV

original: lha'i grong khyer gyi nang na lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyi khang bzangs rnams par rgyal ba zhes bya ba chur dpag tshad nyis brgya lnga bcu /🔽zheng du yang dpag tshad nyis brgya lnga bcu //
analyzed: lha'i grong khyer gyi nang na lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyi khang bzangs rnams par rgyal ba zhes bya ba chur dpag tshad nyis brgya lnga bcu / zheng du yang dpag tshad nyis brgya lnga bcu //
translated: In the middle of the city of the gods is the palace of Śakra, lord of the gods, called Vaijayanta, 250 yojanas long and wide,

original: mtha' skor du dpag tshad stong yod pa /
analyzed: mtha' skor du dpag tshad stong yod pa /
translated: with a circumference of 1,000 yojanas.

original: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa zhig yod do //
analyzed: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa zhig yod do //
translated: It is well-formed, beautiful, and pleasing to the eye.

original: lha'i grong khyer las dpag tshad phyed dang lngas gyen du 'phags so //
analyzed: lha'i grong khyer las dpag tshad phyed dang lngas gyen du 'phags so //
translated: It rises 1.5 yojanas above the city of the gods.

original: khang bzangs rnams par rgyal ba de'i rmang rten rnam pa bzhi las byas pa la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: khang bzangs rnams par rgyal ba de'i rmang rten rnam pa bzhi las byas pa la 'di lta ste /
translated: The foundation of that palace is made of four types of precious substances:

original: gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnams so //
analyzed: gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnams so //

analyzed: khang bzang rnam par rgyal ba'i them pa rnam pa bzhi bkod pa la 'di lta ste /
translated: The steps of that palace are arranged in four types of precious substances:

original: gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnams so //
analyzed: gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnams so //
translated: made of gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.

original: khang bzangs rnam par rgyal ba'i ka ba rnam pa bzhi gtsugs pa la 'di lta ste /🔽gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnams so //🔽gser las byas pa'i ka tan dang / ka zhu dang / bre phul dang / gdung rnams dngul las byas so //
analyzed: khang bzangs rnam par rgyal ba'i ka ba rnam pa bzhi gtsugs pa la 'di lta ste / gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnams so // gser las byas pa'i ka tan dang / ka zhu dang / bre phul dang / gdung rnams dngul las byas so //
translated: In the palace Vaijayanta there are four kinds of pillars:🔽made of gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.🔽The gold pillars have gold bases, capitals, and crossbeams, with silver fittings.

original: dngul gyi ni gser las byas so //🔽bee d'urya'i ni shel las byas so //
analyzed: dngul gyi ni gser las byas so // bee d'urya'i ni shel las byas so //
translated: The silver pillars have silver bases, capitals, and crossbeams, with gold fittings.🔽The beryl pillars have beryl bases, capitals, and crossbeams, with crystal fittings.

original: shel gyi ka tan dang / ka zhu dang / bre phul dang gdung rnams bee d'urya las byas so //
analyzed: shel gyi ka tan dang / ka zhu dang / bre phul dang gdung rnams bee d'urya las byas so //

analyzed: khang bzangs rnam par rgyal pa de'i phyam rten rnam pa bzhi las byas pa dag yod do //🔽'di lta ste /

original: gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnams so //
analyzed: gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnams so //
translated: made of gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.

original: khang bzangs rnam par rgyal ba la them skas rnam pa bzhi las byas pa dag yod do //
analyzed: khang bzangs rnam par rgyal ba la them skas rnam pa bzhi las byas pa dag yod do //
translated: The Vaijayanta Palace has four types of staircases.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽@30a * // gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa'i pha gu rnam pa bzhi brtsigs so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / @30a * // gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa'i pha gu rnam pa bzhi brtsigs so //
translated: They are made of🔽gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.🔽The Vaijayanta Palace is surrounded by four types of railings made of🔽gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.

original: khang bzangs rnam par rgyal ba la lan ka na gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnam pa bzhis kun nas bskor te /🔽gser gyi lan kan gyi gtan ma dang / gdang bu dang / gzungs gzer ni dngul las byas so //

translated: The upright pillars, crossbeams, and railings of the golden railing are🔽made of silver.🔽The upright pillars, crossbeams, and railings of the silver railing are made

analyzed: dngul gyi nyi gser las byas pa dang / bee d'urya'i ni shel las byas so //
translated: of gold. The upright pillars, crossbeams, and railings of the beryl railing are🔽made of crystal.

original: shel gyi gtan ma dang / gdang bu dang / gzungs gzer ni bee d'urya las byas so //
analyzed: shel gyi gtan ma dang / gdang bu dang / gzungs gzer ni bee d'urya las byas so //
translated: The crystal pillars, beams, and door bolts are made of beryl.

original: bar gyi mdo la /
analyzed: bar gyi mdo la /
translated: In the middle section, it says:🔽The foundation, steps, pillars,

original: rmang rten them pa ka ba dang // phyam rten dang ni stobs ldan phyam //
analyzed: rmang rten them pa ka ba dang // phyam rten dang ni stobs ldan phyam //
translated: beams, and strong beams,

original: 'khor sa dang ni spang leb khang //
analyzed: 'khor sa dang ni spang leb khang //
translated: the circular path, and the flat-roofed house

original: ya phubs dag ni tha ma yin //
analyzed: ya phubs dag ni tha ma yin //
translated: are the lowest.

analyzed: khang bzangs rnam par rgyal ba la ba gam brgyad yod do // ba gam re re la yang khang ba brtsegs pa bdun bdun yod do //
translated: The Vaijayanta palace has eight terraces.🔽Each terrace has seven stacked houses.

original: khang pa brtsegs pa re re la yang gnas khang bdun bdun /
analyzed: khang pa brtsegs pa re re la yang gnas khang bdun bdun /
translated: Each stacked house has seven rooms.

original: gnas khang re re la yang lha'i bu mo bdun bdun /
analyzed: gnas khang re re la yang lha'i bu mo bdun bdun /
translated: Each room has seven celestial maidens.

original: lha'i bu mo re re la yang g-yog mo bdun bdun /
analyzed: lha'i bu mo re re la yang g-yog mo bdun bdun /

analyzed: g-yog mo re re la sil snyan bdun bdun yod do //

analyzed: khang bzangs rnam par rgyal ba'i nang na rdzing bu byas pa yod do //

analyzed: zheng du yang dpag tshad lnga bcu /

analyzed: mtha' skor du dpag tshad nyis brgya yod do //

analyzed: rdzing bu de'i phyogs bzhin them skas byas pa dag yod do //
translated: In the four directions of the pond, there are stairs.

original: them skas de dag kyang /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: them skas de dag kyang / 'di lta ste /
translated: These stairs🔽are made of four kinds of precious substances:

analyzed: gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa'i pha gu rnam pa bzhi brtsigs so //

original: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa /
analyzed: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa /
translated: They are well-proportioned, beautiful, and pleasing to the eye.

original: bsil zhing chu sbrang rtsi lta bus gang ste me tog autpa la dang / padma dang / ku mu ta dang / padma dkar pos yongs su khebs la /
analyzed: bsil zhing chu sbrang rtsi lta bus gang ste me tog autpa la dang / padma dang / ku mu ta dang / padma dkar pos yongs su khebs la /

analyzed: dpag bsam gyi shing sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnam pa bzhi yod do //

analyzed: gzhag gos sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnam pa bzhi yod do //

analyzed: dpag bsam shing las byung ba'i gos sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnam pa bzhi yod do //

original: rgyan sna tshogs lag rgyan dang / rkang rgyan dang / rgyan snang ba dang / mi snang ba dag 'byung ba'i shing rnams yod do //
analyzed: rgyan sna tshogs lag rgyan dang / rkang rgyan dang / rgyan snang ba dang / mi snang ba dag 'byung ba'i shing rnams yod do //
translated: There are trees that produce various ornaments, such as armlets, anklets, and visible and invisible ornaments.

original: rol mo'i cha byad sna tshogs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rol mo'i cha byad sna tshogs 'di lta ste /
translated: There are various musical instruments, such as

analyzed: pi wang dang / gling bu dang / pi wang rgyud gsum pa dang / 'khar rnga dang / ham shang rnams 'byung ba'i shing dag yod de /
translated: lute, flute, three-stringed lute, small kettledrum, and horn.

original: lha dang lha'i bu mo rnams kyis ji lta bur 'dod par sems bskyed ma thag tu de lta bur de dag gi lag tu 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha dang lha'i bu mo rnams kyis ji lta bur 'dod par sems bskyed ma thag tu de lta bur de dag gi lag tu 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As soon as the gods and goddesses form the wish, “How I would like to have such and such an instrument,” it appears in their hands.

original: bdud rtsi rnam pa bzhi dang / sbrang rtsi dang sbrang chang gi btung ba dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: bdud rtsi rnam pa bzhi dang / sbrang rtsi dang sbrang chang gi btung ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: There are also four types of nectar and drinks of honey and mead.

original: yang thog rnams dang / khang pa brtsegs pa rnams dang / khyim rnams dang / khang bzangs rnams dang / bsil khang rnams dang / ltad mo lta ba'i sa rnams dang / zam pa rnams bud med kyi tshogs kyis mdzes par byas shing lha'i bu mo mang pos brten pa dang /
analyzed: yang thog rnams dang / khang pa brtsegs pa rnams dang / khyim rnams dang / khang bzangs rnams dang / bsil khang rnams dang / ltad mo lta ba'i sa rnams dang / zam pa rnams bud med kyi tshogs kyis mdzes par byas shing lha'i bu mo mang pos brten pa dang /
translated: The terraces, multistoried buildings, houses, mansions, pavilions, viewing stands, and bridges are beautified by groups of women and frequented by many celestial maidens.

original: sil snyan dang / pheg rdob pa dag gi sgra snyan pa sgrogs pa dang / dri sna tshogs kyis legs par bsgos pa dang / kha zas dang / btung ba dang ldan pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: sil snyan dang / pheg rdob pa dag gi sgra snyan pa sgrogs pa dang / dri sna tshogs kyis legs par bsgos pa dang / kha zas dang / btung ba dang ldan pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: There are also sounds of pleasant music and cymbals, various fragrances, and food and drink.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin 'khor dang bcas pa rtse zhing dga' la dga' dgur spyod do //🔽rang gi las kyi 'bras bu nyams @31a * //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin 'khor dang bcas pa rtse zhing dga' la dga' dgur spyod do // rang gi las kyi 'bras bu nyams @31a * //
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, together with his retinue, plays, enjoys, and indulges in desires.

original: su myong ngo //
analyzed: su myong ngo //
translated: He experiences the results of his own actions.

original: lha'i grong khyer gyi shar lho'i mtshams na sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi lha'i 'dun sa chos bzangs zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: lha'i grong khyer gyi shar lho'i mtshams na sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi lha'i 'dun sa chos bzangs zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: To the southeast of the city of the gods is the divine assembly hall of the Thirty-Three Gods called Sudharmā.

original: chur dpag tshad sum brgya /
analyzed: chur dpag tshad sum brgya /
translated: It is three hundred leagues in size,

original: zheng du dpag tshad sum brgya mtha' skor du dpag tshad dgu brgya yod de /
analyzed: zheng du dpag tshad sum brgya mtha' skor du dpag tshad dgu brgya yod de /
translated: three hundred leagues in breadth, and nine hundred leagues in circumference.

original: lha'i grong khyer las dpag tshad phyed dang bzhis 'phags so //
analyzed: lha'i grong khyer las dpag tshad phyed dang bzhis 'phags so //
translated: It is four and a half leagues above the city of the gods.

original: lha'i mdun sa chos bzangs kyi sa gzhi dang / yang thog dang / ka ba dang / spyi 'dus kyi gdung dang / yang thog gi rtse bzhi dang / phyam gzum dang / phyam dgu po thams cad shel las byas pa dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i mdun sa chos bzangs kyi sa gzhi dang / yang thog dang / ka ba dang / spyi 'dus kyi gdung dang / yang thog gi rtse bzhi dang / phyam gzum dang / phyam dgu po thams cad shel las byas pa dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa ste /
translated: The ground of the divine assembly hall Sudharmā, the upper stories, the pillars, the beams that hold them all together, the four corners of the upper stories, the flat roof, and the nine terraces are all made of crystal. They are well shaped, beautiful, and attractive.

original: lan kan gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnam pa bzhis kun nas bskor te //
analyzed: lan kan gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnam pa bzhis kun nas bskor te //
translated: The railings are made of four types of materials: gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.

original: de la sgo dang / ya phubs dang / gha na dang / yang thog gi rtse bzhi dang / lu na dang / phyam dgu po yod de /
analyzed: de la sgo dang / ya phubs dang / gha na dang / yang thog gi rtse bzhi dang / lu na dang / phyam dgu po yod de /
translated: There are doors, upper stories, ghanas, four corners of the upper stories, lūnas, and nine terraces.

original: phum dgu po re re la yang ka ba bcu drug gis brten to //
analyzed: phum dgu po re re la yang ka ba bcu drug gis brten to //
translated: Each of the nine terraces is supported by sixteen pillars.

original: rgyu ba'i lam ni rim pa bdun yod do //
analyzed: rgyu ba'i lam ni rim pa bdun yod do //
translated: There are seven levels of walkways.

original: de'i dbus su bee d'urya las byas pa'i ka ba zur brgyad pa /
analyzed: de'i dbus su bee d'urya las byas pa'i ka ba zur brgyad pa /
translated: In the middle of that is an octagonal pillar made of beryl.

original: gsal zhing 'phan med la rigs dang ldan pa zhig yod de /
analyzed: gsal zhing 'phan med la rigs dang ldan pa zhig yod de /
translated: It is clear, without flaws, and of good quality.

original: skra'i rtse mo tsam gyi khang ba brtsegs pa'i spyi 'dus kyi rten la mi reg go //
analyzed: skra'i rtse mo tsam gyi khang ba brtsegs pa'i spyi 'dus kyi rten la mi reg go //
translated: The throne of Indra, lord of the gods, is located in the middle of the assembly hall, and it is not touched by the thrones of the other gods.

original: de'i 'og na lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyi gser gyi khri bzang po dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha lhag ma rnams kyi khri bshams pa yod do //
analyzed: de'i 'og na lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyi gser gyi khri bzang po dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha lhag ma rnams kyi khri bshams pa yod do //
translated: Below that is the excellent golden throne of Śakra, lord of the gods, and the thrones of the remaining gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: der sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams 'dus shing 'khod nas lha rnams dang / mi rnams kyi don dang / chos sems shing spyod de /
analyzed: der sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams 'dus shing 'khod nas lha rnams dang / mi rnams kyi don dang / chos sems shing spyod de /
translated: The gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three gather and sit on these thrones, and they contemplate and practice the Dharma for the benefit of gods and humans.

original: yongs su rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: yongs su rtogs par byed do //
translated: They understand it completely.

original: lha'i grong khyer nas rgyu ba'i lam srid du dpag tshad bcu gnyis /
analyzed: lha'i grong khyer nas rgyu ba'i lam srid du dpag tshad bcu gnyis /
translated: The road that runs through the city of the gods is twelve yojanas long

original: zheng du yang dpag tshad bcu gnyis pa dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa /
analyzed: zheng du yang dpag tshad bcu gnyis pa dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa /
translated: and twelve yojanas wide. It is well-shaped, beautiful, and pleasant to behold.

original: gser gyi bye ma bdal zhing tsandan gyi chus chag chag btab pa zhig yod de /
analyzed: gser gyi bye ma bdal zhing tsandan gyi chus chag chag btab pa zhig yod de /
translated: It is covered with golden sand and sprinkled with sandalwood water.

original: de'i glo g-yas g-yon na me tog gi shing dang / 'bras bu'i shing sna tshogs yod pa rnams legs par skyes te /
analyzed: de'i glo g-yas g-yon na me tog gi shing dang / 'bras bu'i shing sna tshogs yod pa rnams legs par skyes te /
translated: On the right and left sides of the city are various flowering trees and fruit trees that grow well.

original: dbyi bas legs la yongs su grub pa ste /🔽me tog phreng bar bkod pa bzhin du gyur pa ni dper na me tog phreng rgyud dam /
analyzed: dbyi bas legs la yongs su grub pa ste / me tog phreng bar bkod pa bzhin du gyur pa ni dper na me tog phreng rgyud dam /
translated: The city is well laid out and well built.🔽It is like a garland of flowers, like a garland of flowers strung on a thread

original: me tog phreng rgyud kyi slob ma mkhas pas me tog gi phreng ba tha gu @31b la brgyus pa dang / me tog gi rna rgyan legs par byas pa bzhin te /
analyzed: me tog phreng rgyud kyi slob ma mkhas pas me tog gi phreng ba tha gu @31b la brgyus pa dang / me tog gi rna rgyan legs par byas pa bzhin te /
translated: or like a garland of flowers well made by a skilled garland maker.

original: thang las skyes pa'i bya sna tshogs skad snyan cing 'jebs pa dang / skad yid du 'ong ba dang / skad snyan pa dang / 'dod dgur sgyur ba'i gzugs can rnams skad snyan pa 'byin to //
analyzed: thang las skyes pa'i bya sna tshogs skad snyan cing 'jebs pa dang / skad yid du 'ong ba dang / skad snyan pa dang / 'dod dgur sgyur ba'i gzugs can rnams skad snyan pa 'byin to //
