analyzed: yang thog rnams dang / khang pa brtsegs pa rnams dang / khyim rnams dang / khang bzangs rnams dang / bsil khang rnams dang / ltad mo lta ba'i sa rnams dang / zam pa rnams dang / pra skanda na ka rnams dang / pra tsa ra ka rnams dang /
translated: There are terraces, multistoried buildings, houses, palaces, pavilions, places for viewing spectacles, bridges, canals, and lotus ponds.

original: gharga ra ka @38a * //🔽rnams dang / bud med kyi tshogs kyis mdzes par byas shing lha'i bu mo mang pos brten pa dang / sil snyan dang / pheg rdob pa dag gi sgra snyan pa sgrogs pa dang / dri sna tshogs kyis legs par bsgos pa dang / kha zas dang /🔽btung ba dang ldan te /
analyzed: gharga ra ka @38a * // rnams dang / bud med kyi tshogs kyis mdzes par byas shing lha'i bu mo mang pos brten pa dang / sil snyan dang / pheg rdob pa dag gi sgra snyan pa sgrogs pa dang / dri sna tshogs kyis legs par bsgos pa dang / kha zas dang / btung ba dang ldan te /

original: de na sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams 'khor dang bcas pa rtse zhing dga' la dga' dgur spyod de /
analyzed: de na sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams 'khor dang bcas pa rtse zhing dga' la dga' dgur spyod de /
translated: The gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three are surrounded by their retinues and enjoy themselves, reveling in their pleasures.

original: rang gi las kyi 'bras bu nyams su myong ngo //
analyzed: rang gi las kyi 'bras bu nyams su myong ngo //
translated: They experience the results of their own actions.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi glang po che'i rgyal po skyed mos tshal du spyad pas srung gi bu zhes bya ba gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa zhig yod do /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi glang po che'i rgyal po skyed mos tshal du spyad pas srung gi bu zhes bya ba gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa zhig yod do /
translated: The king of elephants of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three is named Airāvaṇa. He is well proportioned, attractive, and beautiful.

original: me tog ku mu ta'i mdog lta bur thal kar du 'dug la /
analyzed: me tog ku mu ta'i mdog lta bur thal kar du 'dug la /
translated: He is white like the color of a kumuda flower.

original: yan lag bdun legs par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: yan lag bdun legs par gnas pa ste /
translated: He has seven well-placed limbs.

original: de'i mgo bo dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i mgo bo dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa ste /
translated: His head is well-shaped, beautiful and handsome.

original: sngo zhing srog chags lham bu chu gsher gyi mdog ltar dbus dmar la mche ba drug yod de /
analyzed: sngo zhing srog chags lham bu chu gsher gyi mdog ltar dbus dmar la mche ba drug yod de /
translated: It is blue, the color of a water-born jewel, with six tusks.

original: glang po che'i rgyal po sa srung gi bu'i srid du dpag tshad phyed dang gsum /
analyzed: glang po che'i rgyal po sa srung gi bu'i srid du dpag tshad phyed dang gsum /
translated: The king of elephants, Airāvaṇa, is three and a half yojanas long.

original: zheng du dpag tshad gcig /'phang du dpag tshad phyed dang gnyis /
analyzed: zheng du dpag tshad gcig /'phang du dpag tshad phyed dang gnyis /
translated: He is one yojana wide and one and a half yojanas high.

original: mtha' skor du dpag tshad bdun yod do //
analyzed: mtha' skor du dpag tshad bdun yod do //
translated: He is seven yojanas in circumference.

original: glang po che'i rgyal po sa srung gi bu'i 'khor glang po che brgyad stong yod do ;
analyzed: glang po che'i rgyal po sa srung gi bu'i 'khor glang po che brgyad stong yod do ;
translated: The king of elephants, Airāvaṇa, has a retinue of eight thousand elephants.

original: / de dag thams cad kyang gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa me tog ku mu ta'i mdog ltar thal kar du 'dug cing yan lag bdun shin tu legs par gnas te /
analyzed: / de dag thams cad kyang gzugs bzang zhing blta na sdug la mdzes pa me tog ku mu ta'i mdog ltar thal kar du 'dug cing yan lag bdun shin tu legs par gnas te /
translated: They are all well-shaped, beautiful and handsome, white like the color of a kumuda flower, with seven limbs well-formed.

original: de dag gi mgo bo yang dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes te /
analyzed: de dag gi mgo bo yang dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes te /
translated: Their heads are also well-shaped, beautiful and handsome.

original: sngo zhing srog chags lham bu chu gsher gyi mdog ltar dbus dmar la mche ba drug yod pa sha stag ste /
analyzed: sngo zhing srog chags lham bu chu gsher gyi mdog ltar dbus dmar la mche ba drug yod pa sha stag ste /
translated: They are all blue, the color of a water-born jewel, with red centers and six tusks.

original: gang gi che sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams skyed mos tshal gyi sar 'gro bar 'dod pa de'i tshe glang po che'i rgyal po sa srung gi bus mgo sum cu rtsa gnyis mngon par sprul te /
analyzed: gang gi che sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams skyed mos tshal gyi sar 'gro bar 'dod pa de'i tshe glang po che'i rgyal po sa srung gi bus mgo sum cu rtsa gnyis mngon par sprul te /
translated: When the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three wish to go to the Pleasure Grove, the king of elephants, the son of the earth-holding mountains, manifests thirty-two heads.

original: mgo re re la mche ba drug drug / mche ba re re la rdzing bu bdun bdun /
analyzed: mgo re re la mche ba drug drug / mche ba re re la rdzing bu bdun bdun /
translated: Each head has six tusks, each tusk has seven ponds,

original: rdzing bu re re la padma bdun bdun /
analyzed: rdzing bu re re la padma bdun bdun /
translated: each pond has seven lotuses,

original: padma re re la sdong bu bdun bdun /
analyzed: padma re re la sdong bu bdun bdun /
translated: each lotus has seven stalks,

original: sdong bu re re la lha'i bu mo bdun bdun /
analyzed: sdong bu re re la lha'i bu mo bdun bdun /
translated: each stalk has seven celestial maidens,

original: lha'i bu mo re re la g-yog mo bdun bdun /
analyzed: lha'i bu mo re re la g-yog mo bdun bdun /
translated: each celestial maiden has seven attendants,

original: g-yog mo re re la sil snyan bdun bdun mngon par sprul te /
analyzed: g-yog mo re re la sil snyan bdun bdun mngon par sprul te /
translated: and each attendant manifests seven musical instruments.

original: mgo bo de dag thams cad kyi nang na khyad @38b par du 'phags pa gang yin pa de la lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin zhon no //
analyzed: mgo bo de dag thams cad kyi nang na khyad @38b par du 'phags pa gang yin pa de la lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin zhon no //
translated: Śakra, lord of the gods, rides the one that is most excellent among all those heads.

original: mgo bo lhag ma rnams la ni nye ba'i dbang po sum cu rtsa gnyis po rnams zhon no //
analyzed: mgo bo lhag ma rnams la ni nye ba'i dbang po sum cu rtsa gnyis po rnams zhon no //
translated: The other elephants are ridden by the thirty-two types of sense faculties.

original: glang po che lhag ma rnams la ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams zhon no //
analyzed: glang po che lhag ma rnams la ni sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams zhon no //
translated: The remaining elephants are ridden by the Thirty-Three gods.

original: de shin tu mgyogs te dper na 'jig pa'i rlung ngam 'chags pa'i rlung bzhin te /🔽de na lha'am lha'i bu mo su yang 'di ni bdag gi mdun du 'gro'o zhe 'am /
analyzed: de shin tu mgyogs te dper na 'jig pa'i rlung ngam 'chags pa'i rlung bzhin te / de na lha'am lha'i bu mo su yang 'di ni bdag gi mdun du 'gro'o zhe 'am /
translated: They are very fast, like the wind at the end of an eon.🔽Neither the gods nor the goddesses think, “This one is going in front of me”

original: phyi nas 'ong ngo snyam du sems pa med do //
analyzed: phyi nas 'ong ngo snyam du sems pa med do //
translated: or “This one is coming behind me.”

original: de nas glang po che'i rgyal pos srung gi bus sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams so sor grong khyer gyi sgo nas bton to //
analyzed: de nas glang po che'i rgyal pos srung gi bus sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams so sor grong khyer gyi sgo nas bton to //
translated: Then the king of elephants, having taken the Thirty-Three gods out through the city gates,

original: bton nas so sor skyed mos tshal du phyin par byas te /
analyzed: bton nas so sor skyed mos tshal du phyin par byas te /
translated: having taken them out, makes them go to the pleasure grove.

original: rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du byed pa de btang nas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du byed pa de btang nas 'di lta ste /
translated: Having given up that magical creation,

original: lha 'am lha'i bu mo rdzu 'phrul che zhing mthu che ba gang yang rung ba dang 'dra bar bdag nyid mngon par sprul nas /
analyzed: lha 'am lha'i bu mo rdzu 'phrul che zhing mthu che ba gang yang rung ba dang 'dra bar bdag nyid mngon par sprul nas /
translated: He manifests himself like a god or a son of god who has great magical power and great might.

original: lha'i 'dod pa lnga dag la 'byor cing ldan par gyur te /
analyzed: lha'i 'dod pa lnga dag la 'byor cing ldan par gyur te /
translated: He becomes endowed with and possesses the five divine objects of pleasure.

original: rtse zhing dga' la dga' dgur spyod do //
analyzed: rtse zhing dga' la dga' dgur spyod do //
translated: He plays, enjoys, and indulges in desire.

original: ji ltar brgya byin lha'i dbang po sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar brgya byin lha'i dbang po sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as Śakra, Lord of the Gods, rules over the divine kingship of the Thirty-Three Gods,

original: lha ma yin gyi dbang po thags zangs ris lha ma yin rnams kyi rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byed do //
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi dbang po thags zangs ris lha ma yin rnams kyi rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug la dbang byed do //
translated: so too does Vemacitrin, Lord of the Asuras, rule over the divine kingship of the Asuras.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor grong khyer blta na sdug ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor grong khyer blta na sdug ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as the city of the Thirty-Three Gods is called Sudarśana,

original: lha ma yin rnams kyi rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor yang grong khyer gser ldan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams kyi rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor yang grong khyer gser ldan zhes bya'o //
translated: so too is the city of the Asuras called Kanyākubja.

original: lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyi khang bzangs rnam par rgyal ba ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyi khang bzangs rnam par rgyal ba ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: The palace of the asura king Rāhu is called Potalaka, just like the palace of Śakra, lord of the gods.

original: lha ma yin gyi dbang po thags zangs ris kyi khang bzangs kyang gtams pa can zhes bya'o //🔽sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi lha'i 'dun sa chos bzangs zhes bya ba ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi dbang po thags zangs ris kyi khang bzangs kyang gtams pa can zhes bya'o // sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi lha'i 'dun sa chos bzangs zhes bya ba ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: The asura king Rāhu’s palace is called Potalaka, just like the palace of Śakra, lord of the gods.🔽The asura assembly hall of the asuras is called Sudharmā, just like the assembly hall of the Thirty-Three gods.

original: lha ma yin rnams kyi lha ma yin gyi 'dun sa yang nor bzangs zhes bya'o //🔽sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi skyed mos tshal bzhi 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams kyi lha ma yin gyi 'dun sa yang nor bzangs zhes bya'o // sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi skyed mos tshal bzhi 'di lta ste /
translated: The asura assembly hall of the asuras is called Sudharmā, just like the assembly hall of the Thirty-Three gods.🔽The asuras have four pleasure groves, just like the Thirty-Three gods.🔽The asuras have four pleasure groves, just like the Thirty-Three gods.

original: shing rta sna tshogs tshal dang / rtsub 'gyur tshal dang / 'dres pa'i tshal dang / dga' ba'i tshal ji lta ba de bzhin du lha ma yin rnams kyi skyed mos tshal bzhi yang 'di lta ste /🔽kun dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / dga' ba dang / dga' ba'i kun dga' ra ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: shing rta sna tshogs tshal dang / rtsub 'gyur tshal dang / 'dres pa'i tshal dang / dga' ba'i tshal ji lta ba de bzhin du lha ma yin rnams kyi skyed mos tshal bzhi yang 'di lta ste /🔽kun dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / dga' ba dang / dga' ba'i kun dga' ra ba rnams yin no //
translated: The asuras have four pleasure groves, just like the Thirty-Three gods.

original: sum cu @39a * //
analyzed: sum cu @39a * //
translated: Thirty🔽🔽

original: rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi sa gzhi bzang po bzhi 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi sa gzhi bzang po bzhi 'di lta ste /
translated: The four excellent grounds of the Thirty-Three gods are:🔽(1) the ground of various gems, (2) the ground of rough gems, (3) the ground of mixed gems and (4) the ground of pleasure.

original: sna tshogs dang / rtsub 'gyur dang / 'dres pa dang / dga' ba ji lta ba de bzhin du lha ma yin rnams kyi sa gzhi bzang po bzhi yang kun tu dga' ba ma dang / rab tu dga' ba ma dang / dga' ba ma dang /🔽dga' ba'i kun dga' ra ba ma rnams so //🔽sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi shing yongs 'du sa brtol ji lta ba de bzhin du lha ma yin rnams kyi shing yang tsi tra pa ta la zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs dang / rtsub 'gyur dang / 'dres pa dang / dga' ba ji lta ba de bzhin du lha ma yin rnams kyi sa gzhi bzang po bzhi yang kun tu dga' ba ma dang / rab tu dga' ba ma dang / dga' ba ma dang / dga' ba'i kun dga' ra ba ma rnams so // sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi shing yongs 'du sa brtol ji lta ba de bzhin du lha ma yin rnams kyi shing yang tsi tra pa ta la zhes bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the four excellent grounds of the demigods are: (1) the ground of complete joy, (2) the ground of supreme joy, (3) the ground of joy and (4) the ground of the pleasure grove of joy.🔽The tree of the demigods is called citrapaṭala, just as the pārijāta tree of the Thirty-Three gods is.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi aar mo nig lta bu'i rdo leb ji lta ba de bzhin du lha ma yin rnams kyi yang lha ma yin gyi rdo leb ces bya'o //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi aar mo nig lta bu'i rdo leb ji lta ba de bzhin du lha ma yin rnams kyi yang lha ma yin gyi rdo leb ces bya'o //
translated: The slab of stone of the demigods is called the slab of the demigods, just as the slab of stone of the Thirty-Three gods is like a mirror.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi glang po che'i rgyal po skyed mos tshal du spyad pa sa srung gi bu ji lta ba de bzhin du lha ma yin rnams kyi glang po che'i rgyal po skyed mos tshal du spyad pa yang ti se'i gangs brtsegs zhes
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi glang po che'i rgyal po skyed mos tshal du spyad pa sa srung gi bu ji lta ba de bzhin du lha ma yin rnams kyi glang po che'i rgyal po skyed mos tshal du spyad pa yang ti se'i gangs brtsegs zhes
translated: in the same way, the elephant king of the demigods, who enjoys the pleasure garden, is called Himagiri.🔽Just as the elephant king of the Thirty-Three Gods, who is used in battle and is very stable, is called Dhanapālaka,

original: bya'o // sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi glang po che'i rgyal po g-yul ngor spyad pa rab tu brtan pa ji lta ba de bzhin du lha ma yin rnams kyi glang po che'i rgyal po g-yul ngor spyad pa yang bzod par dka' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bya'o // sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi glang po che'i rgyal po g-yul ngor spyad pa rab tu brtan pa ji lta ba de bzhin du lha ma yin rnams kyi glang po che'i rgyal po g-yul ngor spyad pa yang bzod par dka' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: in the same way, the elephant king of the demigods, who is used in battle and is difficult to endure, is called Duḥsaha.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi rta'i rgyal po sprin gyi shugs can zhes bya ba ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi rta'i rgyal po sprin gyi shugs can zhes bya ba ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the horse king of the Thirty-Three Gods, called Meghajava,

original: lha ma yin rnams kyi rta'i rgyal po yang brag 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams kyi rta'i rgyal po yang brag 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: in the same way, the horse king of the demigods is called Parvata.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi lha'i grong khyer ji ltar 'khor dang ldan pa de bzhin du lha ma yin rnams kyi grong khyer yang 'khor dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi lha'i grong khyer ji ltar 'khor dang ldan pa de bzhin du lha ma yin rnams kyi grong khyer yang 'khor dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The city of the asuras is surrounded by a wall in the same way as the city of the Thirty-Three gods.

original: lha ma yin rnams kyi lha ma yin gyi rgyal srid kyang sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi ji lta ba bzhin du rgyas par brjod par bya'o //🔽'jig rten gzhag pa las tshigs bdun pa'o /🔽// /'jig rten gzhag pa /
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams kyi lha ma yin gyi rgyal srid kyang sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha rnams kyi ji lta ba bzhin du rgyas par brjod par bya'o // 'jig rten gzhag pa las tshigs bdun pa'o / // /'jig rten gzhag pa /
translated: The asura kings have their palaces there, just as the Thirty-Three gods have theirs.

original: bam po lnga pa /
analyzed: bam po lnga pa /
translated: This concludes the chapter on the arrangement of the world, the seventh chapter in the Treatise on the Treasury of Abhidharma.🔽The chapter on the arrangement of the world is finished.🔽Chapter 8: The Characteristics of Sentient Beings🔽The sutra says:

original: mdo la / phyed dang drug dang thang cig mtha' //
analyzed: mdo la / phyed dang drug dang thang cig mtha' //
translated: Half, six, and a moment at the end,🔽Short, cold, and decreasing,🔽Overpowering, gathering,

original: thung dang grang dang 'grib pa dang // rlog pa dang ni bsdu ba dang // phyogs dang shar phyogs 'du shes pa //
analyzed: thung dang grang dang 'grib pa dang // rlog pa dang ni bsdu ba dang // phyogs dang shar phyogs 'du shes pa //
translated: Direction, and east perception.

original: zla ba drug tu nyi ma lho phyogs su 'gro ste /
analyzed: zla ba drug tu nyi ma lho phyogs su 'gro ste /
translated: For six months the sun travels to the south.

original: lho phyogs su 'gro ba na dpag tshad phyed dang drug dang dpag tshad kyi bco brgyad cha @39b gcig tu 'dzam bu'i gling las yol te /
analyzed: lho phyogs su 'gro ba na dpag tshad phyed dang drug dang dpag tshad kyi bco brgyad cha @39b gcig tu 'dzam bu'i gling las yol te /
translated: When the sun moves south, it moves 6.5 yojanas and 1/18th of a yojana over Jambudvīpa and

original: rgya mtsho chen po dpag tshad phyed dang drug dang dpag tshad kyi bco brgyad cha gcig khyab par byed do //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po dpag tshad phyed dang drug dang dpag tshad kyi bco brgyad cha gcig khyab par byed do //
translated: it moves 6.5 yojanas and 1/18th of a yojana over the ocean.

original: zla ba drug tu nyi ma byang phyogs su 'gro ste /
analyzed: zla ba drug tu nyi ma byang phyogs su 'gro ste /
translated: For six months the sun moves north.

original: byang phyogs su 'gro ba na dpag tshad phyed dang drug dang dpag tshad kyi bco brgyad cha gcig tu rgya mtsho chen po las yol te /
analyzed: byang phyogs su 'gro ba na dpag tshad phyed dang drug dang dpag tshad kyi bco brgyad cha gcig tu rgya mtsho chen po las yol te /
translated: When it moves north, it moves 6.5 yojanas and 1/18th of a yojana over the ocean

original: 'dzam bu'i gling du dpag tshad phyed dang drug dang dpag tshad kyi bco brgyad cha gcig khyab par byed do //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling du dpag tshad phyed dang drug dang dpag tshad kyi bco brgyad cha gcig khyab par byed do //
translated: and it moves 6.5 yojanas and 1/18th of a yojana over Jambudvīpa.

original: zla ba drug tu nyi ma lho phyogs su 'gro ste /🔽lho phyogs su 'gro ba na nyin mo las thang cig re re 'grib cing /
analyzed: zla ba drug tu nyi ma lho phyogs su 'gro ste / lho phyogs su 'gro ba na nyin mo las thang cig re re 'grib cing /
translated: For six months the sun moves south.🔽When it moves south, it decreases by one muhūrta each day

original: mtshan mo las thang cig re re skye'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo las thang cig re re skye'o //
translated: and increases by one muhūrta each night.

original: zla ba drug tu nyi ma byang phyogs su 'gro ste /
analyzed: zla ba drug tu nyi ma byang phyogs su 'gro ste /
translated: The sun moves north for six months.

original: byang phyogs su 'gro ba na mtshan mo las thang cig re re 'grib cing nyin mo las thang cig re re skye'o //
analyzed: byang phyogs su 'gro ba na mtshan mo las thang cig re re 'grib cing nyin mo las thang cig re re skye'o //
translated: When it moves north, the nights grow shorter and the days grow longer.

original: zla ba drug tu nyi ma lho phyogs su 'gro ste /
analyzed: zla ba drug tu nyi ma lho phyogs su 'gro ste /
translated: The sun moves south for six months.

original: lho phyogs su 'gro ba na 'dzam bu'i gling gi mtha' myur du spong ngo //
analyzed: lho phyogs su 'gro ba na 'dzam bu'i gling gi mtha' myur du spong ngo //
translated: When it moves south, it quickly abandons the edge of Jambudvīpa.

original: zla ba drug tu nyi ma byang phyogs su 'gro ste /
analyzed: zla ba drug tu nyi ma byang phyogs su 'gro ste /
translated: The sun moves north for six months.

original: byang phyogs su 'gro ba na 'dzam bu'i gling gi dbus yun ring mo zhig gis spong ngo //
analyzed: byang phyogs su 'gro ba na 'dzam bu'i gling gi dbus yun ring mo zhig gis spong ngo //
translated: When it moves north, it slowly abandons the center of Jambudvīpa.

original: ci'i phyir dgun mtshan mo ring la nyin mo thung zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dgun mtshan mo ring la nyin mo thung zhe na /
translated: Why are the nights long in winter and short in summer?

original: smras pa / zla ba drug tu nyi ma lho phyogs su 'gro ste /
analyzed: smras pa / zla ba drug tu nyi ma lho phyogs su 'gro ste /
translated: The sun moves south for six months.

original: lho phyogs su 'gro ba na 'dzam bu'i gling gi mtha' myur du spong ba de'i phyir na dgun mtshan mo ring la nyin mo thung ngo //
analyzed: lho phyogs su 'gro ba na 'dzam bu'i gling gi mtha' myur du spong ba de'i phyir na dgun mtshan mo ring la nyin mo thung ngo //
translated: When it moves south, it quickly abandons the edge of Jambudvīpa. Therefore, the nights are long in winter and short in summer.

original: ci'i phyir na dpyid dang dbyar nyin mo ring la mtshan mo thung zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na dpyid dang dbyar nyin mo ring la mtshan mo thung zhe na /
translated: Why are the days long and the nights short in spring and summer?

original: smras pa / zla ba drug tu nyi ma byang phyogs su 'gro ste /
analyzed: smras pa / zla ba drug tu nyi ma byang phyogs su 'gro ste /
translated: Because for six months the sun moves north.

original: byang phyogs su 'gro ba na 'dzam bu'i gling gi dbus yun ring du spong bas de'i phyir na dpyid dang dbyar nyin mo ring la mtshan mo thung ngo //
analyzed: byang phyogs su 'gro ba na 'dzam bu'i gling gi dbus yun ring du spong bas de'i phyir na dpyid dang dbyar nyin mo ring la mtshan mo thung ngo //
translated: When the sun moves north, it abandons the center of Jambudvīpa for a long time, and therefore the days are long and the nights short in spring and summer.

original: ci'i phyir dgun grang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dgun grang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it cold in winter?

original: smras pa / zla ba drug tu nyi ma lho phyogs su 'gro ste /
analyzed: smras pa / zla ba drug tu nyi ma lho phyogs su 'gro ste /
translated: Because for six months the sun moves south.

original: lho phyogs su 'gro ba na dpag tshad bzhi khri nas nyi ma'i 'od zer 'byung ba rnams rgya mtsho chen por 'bab pas gling rnams grang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lho phyogs su 'gro ba na dpag tshad bzhi khri nas nyi ma'i 'od zer 'byung ba rnams rgya mtsho chen por 'bab pas gling rnams grang bar 'gyur te /
translated: When the sun moves south, the light rays of the sun that emerge from forty thousand yojanas below the surface of the great ocean fall on the ocean, and the continents become cold.

original: de'i phyir na dgun grang ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir na dgun grang ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is cold in winter.

original: ci'i phyir na dpyid dang dbyar dro bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na dpyid dang dbyar dro bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it warm in spring and summer?

original: smras pa / zla ba drug tu nyi ma byang phyogs su 'gro ste /
analyzed: smras pa / zla ba drug tu nyi ma byang phyogs su 'gro ste /
translated: Because for six months the sun moves north.

original: byang phyogs su 'gro ba na dpag tshad bzhi khri nas nyi ma'i 'od zer byung ba rnams gling rnams su 'bab pas gling rnams dro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang phyogs su 'gro ba na dpag tshad bzhi khri nas nyi ma'i 'od zer byung ba rnams gling rnams su 'bab pas gling rnams dro bar 'gyur te /
translated: When the sun moves north, the light rays of the sun that emerge from forty thousand yojanas below the sun's disk fall on the continents and warm them.

original: de'i phyir na dpyid dang dbyar dro bar 'gyur ro //🔽ci'i phyir zla @40a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir na dpyid dang dbyar dro bar 'gyur ro // ci'i phyir zla @40a * //
translated: Therefore, the spring and summer seasons are warm.

original: ba'i dkyil 'khor mar gyi ngo tshes brgyad dag phan chad 'od 'grib cing kha dog dang dkyil 'khor chu zhing du 'grib ce na /
analyzed: ba'i dkyil 'khor mar gyi ngo tshes brgyad dag phan chad 'od 'grib cing kha dog dang dkyil 'khor chu zhing du 'grib ce na /
translated: Why does the moon's disk wane in light, color, size and radiance from the eighth day of the waxing phase onward?

original: smras pa / nyi ma dang nye bar 'gro zhing 'phrad par gyur to //🔽'gro ba de rang gi dkyil 'khor las de'i grib ma byung ste /
analyzed: smras pa / nyi ma dang nye bar 'gro zhing 'phrad par gyur to // 'gro ba de rang gi dkyil 'khor las de'i grib ma byung ste /
translated: It is said that the moon moves closer to the sun and is eclipsed by it.🔽The light of the sun falls on the moon's disk and casts a shadow.

original: des de'i dkyil 'khor khebs shing de'i dkyil 'khor g-yogs par gyur te /🔽mi snang bas de'i phyir na /
analyzed: des de'i dkyil 'khor khebs shing de'i dkyil 'khor g-yogs par gyur te / mi snang bas de'i phyir na /
translated: That shadow covers the moon's disk and obscures it.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor mar gyi ngo tshes bcu drug phan chad 'od 'grib cing mdog dang dkyil 'khor dang chu zhing du 'grib po //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor mar gyi ngo tshes bcu drug phan chad 'od 'grib cing mdog dang dkyil 'khor dang chu zhing du 'grib po //
translated: Therefore, the moon's disk wanes in light, color, size and radiance from the eighth day of the waxing phase onward.

original: ci'i phyir zla ba'i dkyil 'khor mar gyi ngo gnam stong la rnam pa thams cad du mi snang zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zla ba'i dkyil 'khor mar gyi ngo gnam stong la rnam pa thams cad du mi snang zhe na /
translated: Why does the lunar disk not appear at all on the fifteenth day of the waning phase?

original: smras pa / nyi ma dang rnam pa thams cad du 'phrad cing 'grogs te /
analyzed: smras pa / nyi ma dang rnam pa thams cad du 'phrad cing 'grogs te /
translated: It is said: The moon is in conjunction with the sun and moves away from it.

original: de'i rang gi dkyil 'khor las grib ma 'byung ba de'i dkyil 'khor khebs shing des de'i dkyil 'khor g-yogs par mi 'gyur te mi snang bas de'i phyir na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor mar gyi ngo gnam stong la rnam pa thams cad du mi snang ngo //
analyzed: de'i rang gi dkyil 'khor las grib ma 'byung ba de'i dkyil 'khor khebs shing des de'i dkyil 'khor g-yogs par mi 'gyur te mi snang bas de'i phyir na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor mar gyi ngo gnam stong la rnam pa thams cad du mi snang ngo //
translated: The shadow arises from its own disk and covers its disk, and that covers its disk, so it does not appear. Therefore, the lunar disk does not appear at all on the fifteenth day of the waning phase.

original: ci'i phyir zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yar gyi ngo tshes gcig phan chad 'od skye zhing kha dog dang dkyil 'khor dang chu zhing du skye zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yar gyi ngo tshes gcig phan chad 'od skye zhing kha dog dang dkyil 'khor dang chu zhing du skye zhe na /
translated: Why does the lunar disk increase in light, color, and size from the first day of the waxing phase onward?

original: smras pa / nyi ma dang 'bral zhing 'gro ste /
analyzed: smras pa / nyi ma dang 'bral zhing 'gro ste /
translated: It is said: The moon separates from the sun and moves away from it.

original: nyi ma dang 'bral zhing 'gro ba de rang gi dkyil 'khor las grib ma chung ngur 'gyur te grib ma chung dur gyur pas de'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyogs snang bar gyur te /
analyzed: nyi ma dang 'bral zhing 'gro ba de rang gi dkyil 'khor las grib ma chung ngur 'gyur te grib ma chung dur gyur pas de'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyogs snang bar gyur te /
translated: Since the shadow becomes smaller, the side of the moon that faces its orb is illuminated.

original: de'i phyir na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yar gyi tshes gcig phan chad 'od skye zhing kha dog dang dkyil 'khor dang chu zhing du skye'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yar gyi tshes gcig phan chad 'od skye zhing kha dog dang dkyil 'khor dang chu zhing du skye'o //
translated: Therefore, the moon’s orb increases in light, color, shape, and water channels from the first day of the waxing phase onward.

original: ci'i phyir zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yar gyi ngo tshes bco lnga la rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yar gyi ngo tshes bco lnga la rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why does the moon’s orb become completely full on the fifteenth day of the waxing phase?

original: smras pa / nyi ma dang rnam pa thams cad du bral te 'gro bas bral ba'i dkyil 'khor de las nyi ma'i 'od zer las gyur pa'i grib ma gang de'i dkyil 'khor la bsgribs pa de med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: smras pa / nyi ma dang rnam pa thams cad du bral te 'gro bas bral ba'i dkyil 'khor de las nyi ma'i 'od zer las gyur pa'i grib ma gang de'i dkyil 'khor la bsgribs pa de med par 'gyur te /
translated: The moon moves away from the sun in all ways, and the shadow that is created by the sun’s rays on the side of the moon that faces its orb disappears.

original: des de'i dkyil 'khor snang bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yar gyi ngo tshes bco lnga la rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des de'i dkyil 'khor snang bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yar gyi ngo tshes bco lnga la rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of that, the lunar disk appears in the middle of the sky, and therefore the lunar disk is completely full on the fifteenth day of the waxing fortnight.

original: ci'i phyir zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus rnyog la mtha' rnam par dang zhing rnyog pa med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus rnyog la mtha' rnam par dang zhing rnyog pa med ce na /
translated: Why is the middle of the lunar disk obscured and the edge clear and unobscured?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / gling gi rten gyis de'i dbus @40b rnyog la /
analyzed: smras pa / gling gi rten gyis de'i dbus @40b rnyog la /
translated: The middle is obscured by the support of the continents.

original: chu'i rten gyis de'i mtha' rnam par dang zhing rnyog pa med do //
analyzed: chu'i rten gyis de'i mtha' rnam par dang zhing rnyog pa med do //
translated: The edge is clear and unobscured by the support of the water.

original: gling rnams kyi gzugs brnyan gang yin pa des ni dbus rnyog la /
analyzed: gling rnams kyi gzugs brnyan gang yin pa des ni dbus rnyog la /
translated: The reflection of the continents obscures the middle.

original: chu'i gzugs brnyan gang yin pa des ni mtha' rnam par dang zhing rnyog pa med do //
analyzed: chu'i gzugs brnyan gang yin pa des ni mtha' rnam par dang zhing rnyog pa med do //
translated: The reflection of the water makes the edge clear and unobscured.

original: gzhan yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng na kun dga' ra ba dang skyed mos tshal dang / khyim rnams dang / khang pa brtsegs pa rnams yod pas de'i phyir yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus rnyog la mtha' rnams par dang zhing rnyog pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng na kun dga' ra ba dang skyed mos tshal dang / khyim rnams dang / khang pa brtsegs pa rnams yod pas de'i phyir yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus rnyog la mtha' rnams par dang zhing rnyog pa med do //
translated: Moreover, on the lunar disk, there are parks, gardens, houses and palaces.🔽When the sun rises in Jambudvīpa, it is noon in Godānīya and midnight in Kuru.🔽When the sun rises in Godānīya, it is noon in Kuru, midnight in Jambudvīpa and sunset in Videha.

original: gang gi tshe 'dzam bu'i gling du nyi ma shar ba de'i tshe shar gyi lus 'phags su ni nyi ma phyed do //🔽byang gi sgra mi snyan na ni nyi ma nub po //🔽nub kyi ba lang spyod na ni nam phyed do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dzam bu'i gling du nyi ma shar ba de'i tshe shar gyi lus 'phags su ni nyi ma phyed do // byang gi sgra mi snyan na ni nyi ma nub po // nub kyi ba lang spyod na ni nam phyed do //
translated: When the sun rises in Videha, it is noon in Jambudvīpa, midnight in Godānīya and sunset in Kuru.🔽When the sun sets in Jambudvīpa, it is midnight in Godānīya, noon in Kuru and sunset in Videha.

original: gang gi tshe 'dzam bu'i gling du nyi ma phyed du gyur pa de'i tshe shar gyi lus 'phags su ni nyi ma nub po //🔽byang gi sgra mi snyan na ni nam phyed do //🔽nub kyi ba lang spyod kyi gling na ni nyi ma 'char ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dzam bu'i gling du nyi ma phyed du gyur pa de'i tshe shar gyi lus 'phags su ni nyi ma nub po // byang gi sgra mi snyan na ni nam phyed do // nub kyi ba lang spyod kyi gling na ni nyi ma 'char ro //
translated: When the sun sets in Godānīya, it is midnight in Kuru, noon in Videha and sunset in Jambudvīpa.

original: gang gi tshe 'dzam bu'i gling na nyi ma nub pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dzam bu'i gling na nyi ma nub pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the sun sets in Kuru, it is midnight in Videha, noon in Jambudvīpa and sunset in Godānīya.

original: shar gyi lus 'phags gling na ni nam phyed do //
analyzed: shar gyi lus 'phags gling na ni nam phyed do //
translated: In Pūrvavideha, it is midnight.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan na ni nyi ma 'char ro //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan na ni nyi ma 'char ro //
translated: In Uttarakuru, the sun rises.

original: nub kyi blang spyod kyi gling na ni nyi ma phyed do //🔽gang gi tshe 'dzam bu'i gling na nam phyed du gyur pa de'i tshe shar gyi lus 'phags kyi gling na ni nyi ma 'char ro //
analyzed: nub kyi blang spyod kyi gling na ni nyi ma phyed do // gang gi tshe 'dzam bu'i gling na nam phyed du gyur pa de'i tshe shar gyi lus 'phags kyi gling na ni nyi ma 'char ro //
translated: In Godānīya, it is noon.🔽When it is midnight in Jambudvīpa, it is sunset in Godānīya,

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan na ni nyi ma phyed do //🔽nub kyi ba lang spyod kyi gling na ni nyi ma nub po //🔽ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling thog mar byas te bshad pa de bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod kyang thog mar byas te thams cad brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan na ni nyi ma phyed do // nub kyi ba lang spyod kyi gling na ni nyi ma nub po // ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling thog mar byas te bshad pa de bzhin du shar gyi lus 'phags dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod kyang thog mar byas te thams cad brjod par bya'o //
translated: sunrise in Uttarakuru,🔽noon in Pūrvavideha.🔽The same for the other continents, by placing Jambudvīpa to the south, etc.🔽The east of Jambudvīpa is the west of Pūrvavideha;

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi shar phyogs gang yin pa de shar gyi lus 'phags kyi ni lho phyogs so //🔽byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi ni nub phyogs so //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi shar phyogs gang yin pa de shar gyi lus 'phags kyi ni lho phyogs so //🔽byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi ni nub phyogs so //
translated: the west of Jambudvīpa is the east of Godānīya;

original: nub kyi ba lang spyod kyi ni byang phyogs so //
analyzed: nub kyi ba lang spyod kyi ni byang phyogs so //
translated: The northern direction of Godaniya is the southern direction of Purvavideha.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi lho phyogs gang yin pa de shar gyi lus 'phags kyi ni nub phyogs so //🔽byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi ni byang phyogs so //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi lho phyogs gang yin pa de shar gyi lus 'phags kyi ni nub phyogs so // byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi ni byang phyogs so //
translated: The southern direction of Jambudvipa is the western direction of Purvavideha.🔽The northern direction of Uttarakuru is the eastern direction of Purvavideha.

original: nub kyi ba lang spyod kyi ni shar phyogs so //🔽'dzam bu'i gling gi nub phyogs gang yin pa de shar gyi lus 'phags kyi ni byang phyogs so //
analyzed: nub kyi ba lang spyod kyi ni shar phyogs so // 'dzam bu'i gling gi nub phyogs gang yin pa de shar gyi lus 'phags kyi ni byang phyogs so //
translated: The western direction of Godaniya is the eastern direction of Purvavideha.🔽The western direction of Jambudvipa is the northern direction of Purvavideha.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi ni shar phyogs so //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi ni shar phyogs so //
translated: The eastern direction of Uttarakuru is the southern direction of Purvavideha.

original: nub kyi ba lang spyod kyi ni lho phyogs so //
analyzed: nub kyi ba lang spyod kyi ni lho phyogs so //
translated: The southern direction of Godaniya is the western direction of Purvavideha.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi byang phyogs gang yin pa de shar gyi lus 'phags kyi ni @41a * //🔽shar phyogs so //🔽byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi ni lho phyogs so //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi byang phyogs gang yin pa de shar gyi lus 'phags kyi ni @41a * // shar phyogs so // byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi ni lho phyogs so //
translated: The northern direction of Jambudvipa is the eastern direction of Purvavideha.🔽The southern direction of Uttarakuru is the western direction of Purvavideha.

original: nub kyi ba lang spyod kyi ni nub phyogs so //
analyzed: nub kyi ba lang spyod kyi ni nub phyogs so //
translated: The western direction of Godaniya is the northern direction of Purvavideha.

original: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling thog mar byas te bshad pa de bzhin du byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod dang / shar gyi lus 'phags kyang thog mar byas te thams cad brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dzam bu'i gling thog mar byas te bshad pa de bzhin du byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod dang / shar gyi lus 'phags kyang thog mar byas te thams cad brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same explanation holds for the other continents, beginning with Unpleasant Sound in the north, Bountiful Cow in the west, and Pleasant Sound in the east.

original: phyogs ni bzhi yod de /
analyzed: phyogs ni bzhi yod de /
translated: There are four directions:

original: shar phyogs dang / lho phyogs dang / nub phyogs dang / byang phyogs so //
analyzed: shar phyogs dang / lho phyogs dang / nub phyogs dang / byang phyogs so //
translated: east, south, west, and north.

original: shar phyogs la sems can shar phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /🔽sems can lho phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yong /
analyzed: shar phyogs la sems can shar phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod / sems can lho phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yong /
translated: In the east, there are sentient beings who perceive the east,🔽sentient beings who perceive the south,

original: sems can nub phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: sems can nub phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
translated: sentient beings who perceive the west,

original: sems can byang phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod do //🔽lho phyogs la sems can lho phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: sems can byang phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod do // lho phyogs la sems can lho phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
translated: and sentient beings who perceive the north.🔽In the south, there are sentient beings who perceive the south,

original: sems can shar phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: sems can shar phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
translated: sentient beings who perceive the east,

original: sems can nub phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: sems can nub phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
translated: sentient beings who perceive the west,🔽and sentient beings who perceive the north.

original: sems can byang phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod do //🔽nub phyogs la sems can shar phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: sems can byang phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod do // nub phyogs la sems can shar phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
translated: There are sentient beings who perceive the north as the south.

original: sems can lho phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /🔽sems can nub phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: sems can lho phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod / sems can nub phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
translated: There are sentient beings who perceive the west as the east.🔽There are sentient beings who perceive the south as the north.

original: sems can byang phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod do //🔽byang phyogs la sems can shar phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: sems can byang phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod do // byang phyogs la sems can shar phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
translated: There are sentient beings who perceive the north as the south.🔽There are sentient beings who perceive the east as the west.

original: sems can lho phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod //🔽sems can nub phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: sems can lho phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod // sems can nub phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
translated: There are sentient beings who perceive the west as the east.🔽There are sentient beings who perceive the south as the north.

original: sems can byang phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: sems can byang phyogs su 'du shes pa dag kyang yod de /
translated: There are sentient beings who perceive the north as the south.

original: phyogs de dang de dag la de ltar tha snyad 'dogs so //
analyzed: phyogs de dang de dag la de ltar tha snyad 'dogs so //
translated: In this way, they designate the directions.

original: 'jig rten gzhag pa las tshigs brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhag pa las tshigs brgyad pa'o /
translated: This is the eighth chapter on the arrangement of the world.

original: // / mdo la /
analyzed: // / mdo la /
translated: In the sutra, it is said:

original: zla ba nyi ma gnyis kyi tshad //
analyzed: zla ba nyi ma gnyis kyi tshad //
translated: The measure of the sun and moon

original: skar ma rnams kyang de bzhin te //
analyzed: skar ma rnams kyang de bzhin te //
translated: And the stars is the same.

original: zla drug nyi ma 'gro ba dang // gnod par byed pa tha ma yin //
analyzed: zla drug nyi ma 'gro ba dang // gnod par byed pa tha ma yin //
translated: The last one is the one that causes harm.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshad ji tsam zhe na /🔽smras pa / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni chur dpag tshad lnga bcu /🔽zheng du yang dpag chad lnga bcu /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshad ji tsam zhe na / smras pa / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni chur dpag tshad lnga bcu / zheng du yang dpag chad lnga bcu /
translated: What is the size of the moon’s disk?🔽It is fifty yojanas in diameter.

original: mtha' skor du dpag tshad brgya lnga bcu /
analyzed: mtha' skor du dpag tshad brgya lnga bcu /
translated: It is fifty yojanas in width.🔽It is one hundred and fifty yojanas in circumference.

original: rngams su dpag tshad phyed dang drug dang dpag tshad kyi bco brgyad cha gcig yod de /
analyzed: rngams su dpag tshad phyed dang drug dang dpag tshad kyi bco brgyad cha gcig yod de /
translated: It is six and one-eighteenth yojanas in height.

original: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa shel @41b las grub pa ste /
analyzed: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa shel @41b las grub pa ste /
translated: It is well-shaped, beautiful, and lovely to behold. It is made of crystal.

original: gser gyi ra bas kun nas bskor ro //
analyzed: gser gyi ra bas kun nas bskor ro //
translated: It is surrounded by a golden wall.

original: ra ba de'i 'phang du yang dpag tshad phyed do //
analyzed: ra ba de'i 'phang du yang dpag tshad phyed do //
translated: That wall is half a yojana in height.

original: ra ba de la rtsig skyabs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ra ba de la rtsig skyabs 'di lta ste /
translated: That wall has parapets.

original: gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnams pa bzhi dang / gyen du 'phang pa'i mda' yab dang / thur du 'phang ba'i mda' yab dang / tham pa brgyud ma rnam pa bzhi dag yod do //
analyzed: gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnams pa bzhi dang / gyen du 'phang pa'i mda' yab dang / thur du 'phang ba'i mda' yab dang / tham pa brgyud ma rnam pa bzhi dag yod do //
translated: made of gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.

original: de'i nang gi sa gzhi dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i nang gi sa gzhi dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa ste /
translated: The ground inside is well-shaped, beautiful, and pleasant to behold.

original: bris shing legs par bris pa tshon sna brgya rtsa gcig gis bris te /🔽'jam zhing shin tu 'jam pa ni dper na shing bal gyi 'dab ma 'am /
analyzed: bris shing legs par bris pa tshon sna brgya rtsa gcig gis bris te / 'jam zhing shin tu 'jam pa ni dper na shing bal gyi 'dab ma 'am /
translated: It is well-drawn, drawn with a hundred and one colors.

original: ras bal gyi 'dab ma bzhin du /
analyzed: ras bal gyi 'dab ma bzhin du /
translated: It is smooth and very smooth, like a drawing in cotton or silk.

original: rkang pa bzhag na ni nems zhes byed /
analyzed: rkang pa bzhag na ni nems zhes byed /
translated: When the foot is placed down, it sinks in and then springs back up.

original: rkang pa bteg na par zhes byed la me tog man nga ra ba dag gis pus mo nub pa tsam du khebs te /
analyzed: rkang pa bteg na par zhes byed la me tog man nga ra ba dag gis pus mo nub pa tsam du khebs te /
translated: It is covered with jasmine flowers up to the ankles.

original: de ni mi ma yin pa rnams kyi rlung gi mthus me tog rnying pa rnams ni 'thor gsar pa rnams ni legs par 'grems te 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni mi ma yin pa rnams kyi rlung gi mthus me tog rnying pa rnams ni 'thor gsar pa rnams ni legs par 'grems te 'di skad du /
translated: They also say:

original: zla ba'i bsod nams dbang gi rkyen gyis na //
analyzed: zla ba'i bsod nams dbang gi rkyen gyis na //
translated: By the power of the moon's merit,🔽a great wind blows in the city of the moon,

original: zla ba'i grong khyer dag na rlung chen ldang // me tog rnying pa rnams ni 'thor bar byed //
analyzed: zla ba'i grong khyer dag na rlung chen ldang // me tog rnying pa rnams ni 'thor bar byed //
translated: scattering the old flowers

original: me tog gsar pa rnams ni legs par 'grems //🔽zhes kyang bya'o //🔽zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi nang na lam srang chur dpag tshad lnga bcu /
analyzed: me tog gsar pa rnams ni legs par 'grems // zhes kyang bya'o // zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi nang na lam srang chur dpag tshad lnga bcu /
translated: and arranging the new flowers.🔽In the center of the moon's mandala is a road fifty yojanas long

original: zheng du dpag tshad phyed dang gnyis pa cig yod de /
analyzed: zheng du dpag tshad phyed dang gnyis pa cig yod de /
translated: and one and a half yojanas wide.

original: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa /
analyzed: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa /
translated: It is well shaped, beautiful and attractive.

original: gser gyi bye ma bdal zhing tsandana gyi chus chag chag btab pa /
analyzed: gser gyi bye ma bdal zhing tsandana gyi chus chag chag btab pa /
translated: It is covered with golden sand and sprinkled with sandalwood water.

original: de'i glo g-yas g-yon na rdzing bu byas pa dag yod de /
analyzed: de'i glo g-yas g-yon na rdzing bu byas pa dag yod de /
translated: On its right and left sides are ponds.

original: rdzing bu de dag kyang gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa'i pha gu rnam pa bzhis brtsigs so //
analyzed: rdzing bu de dag kyang gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa'i pha gu rnam pa bzhis brtsigs so //
translated: Those ponds are surrounded by railings made of four kinds of precious substances: gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.

original: rdzing bu de dag gi phyogs bzhi na yang them skas byas pa dag yod do //
analyzed: rdzing bu de dag gi phyogs bzhi na yang them skas byas pa dag yod do //
translated: On the four sides of those ponds, stairs are built.

original: them skas byas pa dag kyang gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa'i pha gu rnam pa bzhis brtsigs so //
analyzed: them skas byas pa dag kyang gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa'i pha gu rnam pa bzhis brtsigs so //
translated: Those stairs are also surrounded by railings made of four kinds of precious substances: gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.

original: rdzing bu de dag kyang gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa'i lan kan rnam pa bzhis kun nas bskor te /🔽gser @42a * //
analyzed: rdzing bu de dag kyang gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa'i lan kan rnam pa bzhis kun nas bskor te / gser @42a * //
translated: Those ponds are surrounded by railings made of four kinds of precious substances: gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.

original: gyi lan kan gyi gtan ma dang / gdang bu dang / gzungs gzer ni dngul las byas pa dang / dngul gyi ni gser las byas so //
analyzed: gyi lan kan gyi gtan ma dang / gdang bu dang / gzungs gzer ni dngul las byas pa dang / dngul gyi ni gser las byas so //
translated: The lower part of the golden railings is made of silver, the upper part is made of gold, and the crossbars are made of gold.🔽The lower part of the silver railings is made of gold, the upper part is made of silver, and the crossbars are made of silver.

original: bee d'urya'i ni shel las byas so //
analyzed: bee d'urya'i ni shel las byas so //
translated: The crystal ones are made of beryl.

original: shel gyi ni gtan ma dang / gdang bu dang / gzungs gzer ni bee d'urya las byas te /
analyzed: shel gyi ni gtan ma dang / gdang bu dang / gzungs gzer ni bee d'urya las byas te /
translated: The crystal ones have beryl railings, ropes, bells, and nets.

original: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa /
analyzed: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa /
translated: They are well-proportioned, beautiful, and attractive.

original: chu bsil ba dang / chu sbrang rtsi lta bus gang ba ste /
analyzed: chu bsil ba dang / chu sbrang rtsi lta bus gang ba ste /
translated: They are filled with cool water and honey-like water.

original: me tog autpa la dang / padma dang / ku mu ta dang / padma dkar pos yongs su khebs shing chu nas skyes pa'i bya sna tshogs skad snyan cing 'jebs pa dang / skad yid du 'ong ba dang / skad snyan pa dang / 'dod dgur sgyur ba'i gzugs can rnams skad snyan pa 'byin to //
analyzed: me tog autpa la dang / padma dang / ku mu ta dang / padma dkar pos yongs su khebs shing chu nas skyes pa'i bya sna tshogs skad snyan cing 'jebs pa dang / skad yid du 'ong ba dang / skad snyan pa dang / 'dod dgur sgyur ba'i gzugs can rnams skad snyan pa 'byin to //
translated: They are covered with utpala, padma, kumuda, and puṇḍarīka flowers, and various water birds with pleasant and melodious voices, with beautiful voices, with sweet voices, and with forms that can change at will, sing sweetly.

original: de dag gi nye 'khor na me tog gi shing dang / 'bras bu'i shing sna tshogs yod pa rnams legs par skyes shing dbyibs legs la yongs su grub pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi nye 'khor na me tog gi shing dang / 'bras bu'i shing sna tshogs yod pa rnams legs par skyes shing dbyibs legs la yongs su grub pa ste /
translated: Around them are various flowering trees and fruit trees that grow well, are well-proportioned, and are well-formed.

original: me tog phreng bar bkod pa bzhin du gyur pa ni dper na me tog phreng rgyud dam /
analyzed: me tog phreng bar bkod pa bzhin du gyur pa ni dper na me tog phreng rgyud dam /
translated: They are like garlands of flowers arranged in a row, like a garland of flowers.

original: me tog phreng rgyud kyi slob ma mkhas pas me tog gi phreng ba tha gu la brgyus pa dang / me tog gi rna rgyan legs par byas pa bzhin te /
analyzed: me tog phreng rgyud kyi slob ma mkhas pas me tog gi phreng ba tha gu la brgyus pa dang / me tog gi rna rgyan legs par byas pa bzhin te /
translated: The skilled garland-makers make garlands of flowers strung on thread and flower earrings.

original: thang las skyes pa'i bya sna tshogs skad snyan cing 'jebs pa dang / skad yid du 'ong ba dang / skad snyan pa dang / 'dod dgur sgyur ba'i gzugs can rnams skad snyan pa 'byin to //
analyzed: thang las skyes pa'i bya sna tshogs skad snyan cing 'jebs pa dang / skad yid du 'ong ba dang / skad snyan pa dang / 'dod dgur sgyur ba'i gzugs can rnams skad snyan pa 'byin to //
translated: The various birds born in the fields sing sweetly, with pleasant voices, melodious voices, and voices that can transform at will.

original: dpag bsam gyi shing sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnam pa bzhi yod do //
analyzed: dpag bsam gyi shing sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnam pa bzhi yod do //
translated: There are four kinds of wish-fulfilling trees: blue, yellow, red, and white.

original: gzhag gos sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnam pa bzhi yod do //
analyzed: gzhag gos sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnam pa bzhi yod do //
translated: There are four kinds of garments: blue, yellow, red, and white.

original: dpag bsam gyi shing las byung ba'i gos sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnam pa bzhi yod do //
analyzed: dpag bsam gyi shing las byung ba'i gos sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnam pa bzhi yod do //
translated: There are four kinds of garments that come from the wish-fulfilling trees: blue, yellow, red, and white.

original: rol mo'i cha byad sna tshogs pi wang dang / gling bu dang / pi wang rgyud gsum pa dang / 'khar rnga dang / ham shang rnams 'byung ba'i shing dag yod do //
analyzed: rol mo'i cha byad sna tshogs pi wang dang / gling bu dang / pi wang rgyud gsum pa dang / 'khar rnga dang / ham shang rnams 'byung ba'i shing dag yod do //
translated: There are trees that produce various musical instruments: flutes, lutes, three-stringed lutes, tabours, and cymbals.

original: rgyan sna tshogs lag rgyan dang / rkang rgyan dang / rgyan snang ba dang / mi snang ba rnams 'byung ba'i shing dag yod do //
analyzed: rgyan sna tshogs lag rgyan dang / rkang rgyan dang / rgyan snang ba dang / mi snang ba rnams 'byung ba'i shing dag yod do //
translated: There are trees that produce various ornaments: armlets, anklets, visible and invisible ornaments.

original: lha dang lha'i bu mo rnams kyis ji lta bur 'dod pa sems bskyed ma thag tu de lta bur de dag gi lag tu 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha dang lha'i bu mo rnams kyis ji lta bur 'dod pa sems bskyed ma thag tu de lta bur de dag gi lag tu 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As soon as the gods and goddesses think of what they want, it appears in their hands.

original: bdud rtsi rnam pa bzhi dang / sbrang rtsi dang sbrang chang gi btung ba @42b dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: bdud rtsi rnam pa bzhi dang / sbrang rtsi dang sbrang chang gi btung ba @42b dag kyang yod do //
translated: There are four kinds of ambrosia and drinks of honey and mead.

original: yang thog rnams dang / khang pa brtsegs pa rnams dang / khyim rnams dang / khang bzangs rnams dang / bsil khang rnams dang / ltad mo blta ba'i gnas rnams dang / zam pa rnams bud med kyi tshogs kyis mdzes par byas shing lha'i bu mo mang pos brten pa dang /
analyzed: yang thog rnams dang / khang pa brtsegs pa rnams dang / khyim rnams dang / khang bzangs rnams dang / bsil khang rnams dang / ltad mo blta ba'i gnas rnams dang / zam pa rnams bud med kyi tshogs kyis mdzes par byas shing lha'i bu mo mang pos brten pa dang /
translated: The tops of the houses, the multi-storied houses, the houses, the mansions, the pavilions, the places for viewing, the bridges are adorned with crowds of women and frequented by many celestial maidens.

original: sil snyan dang / pheg rdob pa rnams kyi sgra snyan par sgrogs pa dang / dri sna tshogs kyis legs par bsgos pa dang / kha zas dang / btung ba dang ldan pa dag yod do //
analyzed: sil snyan dang / pheg rdob pa rnams kyi sgra snyan par sgrogs pa dang / dri sna tshogs kyis legs par bsgos pa dang / kha zas dang / btung ba dang ldan pa dag yod do //
translated: They resound with the sweet sounds of musical instruments and cymbals, are perfumed with various fragrances, and are filled with food and drink.

original: de ni lha'i bu zla ba 'khor dang bcas pa rtse zhing dga' la dga' dgur spyod de /
analyzed: de ni lha'i bu zla ba 'khor dang bcas pa rtse zhing dga' la dga' dgur spyod de /
translated: The celestial son Candra, together with his retinue, plays, enjoys, and indulges in desires there.

original: rang gi las kyi 'bras bu nyams su myong ngo //
analyzed: rang gi las kyi 'bras bu nyams su myong ngo //
translated: He experiences the results of his own actions.

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshad ni ji tsam zhe na /
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshad ni ji tsam zhe na /
translated: What is the size of the orb of the sun?

original: smras pa / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ni chur dpag tshad lnga bcu rtsa gcig / zheng du yang dpag tshad lnga bcu rtsa gcig / mtha' skor du dpag tshad lnga bcu rtsa gsum /
analyzed: smras pa / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ni chur dpag tshad lnga bcu rtsa gcig / zheng du yang dpag tshad lnga bcu rtsa gcig / mtha' skor du dpag tshad lnga bcu rtsa gsum /
translated: It is said that the sun’s maṇḍala is fifty-one yojanas in diameter, fifty-one yojanas in width, and its circumference is fifty-three yojanas.

original: rngams su dpag tshad phyed dang drug dang dpag tshad kyi bco brgyad cha gcig yod de /
analyzed: rngams su dpag tshad phyed dang drug dang dpag tshad kyi bco brgyad cha gcig yod de /
translated: It is half a yojana and one-eighteenth of a yojana in height.

original: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa shel las grub pa ste /
analyzed: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa shel las grub pa ste /
translated: It is well-shaped, beautiful, and lovely to behold and is made of crystal.

original: gser gyi rabs kun nas bskor te /
analyzed: gser gyi rabs kun nas bskor te /
translated: It is surrounded by a golden ring.

original: ra ba de'i 'phang du yang dpag tshad phyed yod la ra ba de'i rtsig skyabs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ra ba de'i 'phang du yang dpag tshad phyed yod la ra ba de'i rtsig skyabs 'di lta ste /
translated: The height of that ring is half a yojana and the wall of that ring is fourfold:

original: gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnam pa bzhi dang / gyen du 'phang ba'i mda' yab dang / thur du 'phang ba'i mda' yab dang / zam pa brgyud ma rnam pa bzhi dag yod do //
analyzed: gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnam pa bzhi dang / gyen du 'phang ba'i mda' yab dang / thur du 'phang ba'i mda' yab dang / zam pa brgyud ma rnam pa bzhi dag yod do //
translated: made of gold, silver, beryl, and crystal, and it has a parapet that is half a yojana high, a half-yojana-wide moat, and four kinds of bridges.

original: de'i nang gis gzhi dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i nang gis gzhi dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa ste /
translated: It is well-formed, beautiful, and pleasant to behold.

original: bris shing legs par bris pa tshon sna brgya rtsa gcig gis bris te /🔽'jam zhing shin tu 'jam pa ni dper na shing bal gyi 'dab ma 'am /
analyzed: bris shing legs par bris pa tshon sna brgya rtsa gcig gis bris te / 'jam zhing shin tu 'jam pa ni dper na shing bal gyi 'dab ma 'am /
translated: It is painted with a hundred and one colors.🔽It is soft and very soft, like a cotton ball

original: ras bal gyi 'dab ma bzhin te /
analyzed: ras bal gyi 'dab ma bzhin te /
translated: or a wool ball.

original: rkang pa bzhag na ni nems zhes byed /
analyzed: rkang pa bzhag na ni nems zhes byed /
translated: When the foot is placed down, it sinks in,

original: rkang pa bteg na ni par zhes byed la /
analyzed: rkang pa bteg na ni par zhes byed la /
translated: and when the foot is lifted, it springs back up.

original: me tog man da ra ba dag gis pus mo nub pa tsam du khebs te /
analyzed: me tog man da ra ba dag gis pus mo nub pa tsam du khebs te /
translated: It is covered with mandārava flowers up to the knees.

original: de na mi ma yin pa rnams kyi rlung gi mthus me tog rnying pa rnams ni 'dor /
analyzed: de na mi ma yin pa rnams kyi rlung gi mthus me tog rnying pa rnams ni 'dor /
translated: There, by the power of the wind of nonhuman beings, old flowers are removed

original: me tog gsar pa rnams ni legs par 'grems te /
analyzed: me tog gsar pa rnams ni legs par 'grems te /
translated: and new flowers are well spread out.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dbang gi rkyen gyis na //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dbang gi rkyen gyis na //
translated: By the power of the orb of the sun,🔽in the city of the sun, a great wind arises,

original: nyi ma'i grong khyer dag na rlung chen ldang // me tog rnying pa rnams ni 'dor @43a * //
analyzed: nyi ma'i grong khyer dag na rlung chen ldang // me tog rnying pa rnams ni 'dor @43a * //
translated: removing old flowers

original: bar byed // me tog gsar pa rnams ni legs par 'grems //
analyzed: bar byed // me tog gsar pa rnams ni legs par 'grems //
translated: and well spreading out new flowers.

original: zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: It is also called the “path of the gods.”

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi nang na lam srang chur dpag tshad lnga bcu rtsa gcig / zheng du dpag tshad phyed dang gnyis pa zhig yod de /
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi nang na lam srang chur dpag tshad lnga bcu rtsa gcig / zheng du dpag tshad phyed dang gnyis pa zhig yod de /
translated: Within the sun’s maṇḍala, there is a road that is fifty-one yojanas long and one and a half yojanas wide.

original: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa gser gyi bye ma bdal zhing tsandan gyi chus chag chag btab pa /
analyzed: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa gser gyi bye ma bdal zhing tsandan gyi chus chag chag btab pa /
translated: It is well-shaped, beautiful, and attractive, covered with golden sand and sprinkled with sandalwood water.

original: de'i glo g-yas g-yon na rdzing bu byas pa dag yod de /
analyzed: de'i glo g-yas g-yon na rdzing bu byas pa dag yod de /
translated: On the right and left sides of the road are ponds.

original: rdzing bu de dag kyang gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa'i pha gu rnam pa bzhis brtsigs so //
analyzed: rdzing bu de dag kyang gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa'i pha gu rnam pa bzhis brtsigs so //
translated: Those ponds are built with four types of railings made of gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.

original: rdzing bu de dag gi phyogs bzhin yang them skas byas pa dag yod de /
analyzed: rdzing bu de dag gi phyogs bzhin yang them skas byas pa dag yod de /
translated: In the four directions of those ponds, there are stairs.

original: them skas de dag kyang gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa'i pha gu rnam pa bzhis brtsigs so //
analyzed: them skas de dag kyang gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa'i pha gu rnam pa bzhis brtsigs so //
translated: Those stairs are also built with four types of railings made of gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.

original: rdzing bu de dag kyang gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa'i lan kan rnam pa bzhis kun nas bskor te /
analyzed: rdzing bu de dag kyang gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa'i lan kan rnam pa bzhis kun nas bskor te /
translated: Those ponds are surrounded by four types of railings made of gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.

original: gser gyi lan kan gyi gtan ma dang / gdang bu dang / gzungs gzer ni dngul las byas so //
analyzed: gser gyi lan kan gyi gtan ma dang / gdang bu dang / gzungs gzer ni dngul las byas so //
translated: The lower parts, crossbars, and bolts of the golden railings are made of silver.

original: dngul gyi ni gser las byas so //🔽bee d'urya'i shel las byas so ;
analyzed: dngul gyi ni gser las byas so // bee d'urya'i shel las byas so ;
translated: Those of the silver railings are made of gold.🔽Those of the beryl railings are made of crystal.

original: / shel gyi ni gtan ma dang / gdang bu dang / gzungs gzer ni bee d'urya las byas so //
analyzed: / shel gyi ni gtan ma dang / gdang bu dang / gzungs gzer ni bee d'urya las byas so //
translated: Those of the crystal railings are made of beryl.

original: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa /
analyzed: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa /
translated: They are well-proportioned, beautiful, and attractive.

original: chu bsil ba dang / chu sbrang rtsi lta bus gang ba ste /
analyzed: chu bsil ba dang / chu sbrang rtsi lta bus gang ba ste /
translated: They are filled with cool water and water that tastes like honey.

original: me tog autpa pa la dang / padma dang / ku mu ta dang / padma dkar pos yongs su khebs te /
analyzed: me tog autpa pa la dang / padma dang / ku mu ta dang / padma dkar pos yongs su khebs te /
translated: They are covered with utpala, padma, kumuda, and puṇḍarīka flowers.

original: chu las skyes pa'i bya sna tshogs skad snyan cing 'jebs pa dang / skad yid du 'ong ba dang / skad snyan pa dang / 'dod dgur sgyur ba'i gzugs can rnams skad snyan pa 'byin to //
analyzed: chu las skyes pa'i bya sna tshogs skad snyan cing 'jebs pa dang / skad yid du 'ong ba dang / skad snyan pa dang / 'dod dgur sgyur ba'i gzugs can rnams skad snyan pa 'byin to //
translated: Various birds that live in the water sing in melodious and delightful ways, with pleasant voices, sweet voices, and voices that can take on any form at will.

original: de dag gi nye 'khor na me tog gi shing dang 'bras bu'i shing sna tshogs yod pa rnams legs par skyes shing dbyibs legs la yongs su grub pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi nye 'khor na me tog gi shing dang 'bras bu'i shing sna tshogs yod pa rnams legs par skyes shing dbyibs legs la yongs su grub pa ste /
translated: In their vicinity are various flowering trees and fruit trees that grow well, with excellent shapes and perfect forms.

original: me tog phreng bar bkod pa bzhin du gyur pa ni dper na me tog phreng rgyud dam /
analyzed: me tog phreng bar bkod pa bzhin du gyur pa ni dper na me tog phreng rgyud dam /
translated: They are like flower garlands, for example, like flower garlands strung on thread,

original: me tog phreng rgyud kyi slob ma mkhas pas me tog gi phreng ba tha gu la brgyus pa dang / me tog gi rna rgyan legs par byas pa bzhin te /
analyzed: me tog phreng rgyud kyi slob ma mkhas pas me tog gi phreng ba tha gu la brgyus pa dang / me tog gi rna rgyan legs par byas pa bzhin te /
translated: or like flower earrings well made by a skilled garland maker or garland maker’s apprentice.

original: thang las @43b skyes pa'i bya sna tshogs skad snyan cing 'jebs pa dang / skad yid du 'ong ba dang / skad snyan pa dang / 'dod dgur sgyur ba'i gzugs can rnams skad snyan pa 'byin to //
analyzed: thang las @43b skyes pa'i bya sna tshogs skad snyan cing 'jebs pa dang / skad yid du 'ong ba dang / skad snyan pa dang / 'dod dgur sgyur ba'i gzugs can rnams skad snyan pa 'byin to //
translated: Various birds that are born from the earth sing in a pleasant and melodious way, with a voice that is pleasing, melodious, and able to transform into any sound.

original: dpag bsam gyi shing sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnam pa bzhi yod do //
analyzed: dpag bsam gyi shing sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnam pa bzhi yod do //
translated: There are four types of wish-fulfilling trees: blue, yellow, red, and white.

original: gzhag gos sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnams pa bzhi yod do //
analyzed: gzhag gos sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnams pa bzhi yod do //
translated: There are four types of garments: blue, yellow, red, and white.

original: dpag bsam gyi shing las byung ba'i gos sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnam pa bzhi yod do //
analyzed: dpag bsam gyi shing las byung ba'i gos sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnam pa bzhi yod do //
translated: There are four types of garments that come from wish-fulfilling trees: blue, yellow, red, and white.

original: rol mo'i cha byad rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i pi wang dang / gling bu dang / pi wang rgyud gsum pa dang / 'khar rnga dang / ham shang rnams 'byung ba'i shing dag yod do //
analyzed: rol mo'i cha byad rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i pi wang dang / gling bu dang / pi wang rgyud gsum pa dang / 'khar rnga dang / ham shang rnams 'byung ba'i shing dag yod do //
translated: There are trees that produce various musical instruments such as the vīṇā, flute, three-stringed lute, small kettledrum, and horn.

original: rgyan sna tshogs lag rgyan dang / rkang rgyan dang / rgyan snang ba dang / mi snang ba rnams 'byung ba'i shing dag yod do //
analyzed: rgyan sna tshogs lag rgyan dang / rkang rgyan dang / rgyan snang ba dang / mi snang ba rnams 'byung ba'i shing dag yod do //
translated: There are trees that produce various ornaments, such as armlets, anklets, and visible and invisible ornaments.

original: lha 'am lha'i bu mo rnams kyis ji lta bur 'dod pa sems bskyed ma thag tu /
analyzed: lha 'am lha'i bu mo rnams kyis ji lta bur 'dod pa sems bskyed ma thag tu /
translated: Whatever the gods or goddesses desire, as soon as they think of it,

original: de lta bur de dag gi lag tu 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bur de dag gi lag tu 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it appears in their hands.

original: bdud rtsi rnam pa bzhi dang / sprang rtsi dang sbrang chang gi btung ba dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: bdud rtsi rnam pa bzhi dang / sprang rtsi dang sbrang chang gi btung ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: There are also the four types of nectar and drinks of honey and mead.

original: yang thog rnams dang / khang pa brtsegs pa rnams dang / khyim rnams dang / khang bzangs rnams dang / bsil khang rnams dang / ltad mo lta ba'i sa dang / zam pa rnams dang / bud med kyi tshogs kyis mdzes par byas shing lha'i bu mo mang pos brten pa dang /
analyzed: yang thog rnams dang / khang pa brtsegs pa rnams dang / khyim rnams dang / khang bzangs rnams dang / bsil khang rnams dang / ltad mo lta ba'i sa dang / zam pa rnams dang / bud med kyi tshogs kyis mdzes par byas shing lha'i bu mo mang pos brten pa dang /
translated: There are also terraces, multi-storied buildings, houses, mansions, pavilions, places for watching performances, bridges, and so forth, beautified by crowds of women and frequented by many celestial maidens.

original: sil snyan dang / pheb rdob pa dag gi sgra snyan pa sgrogs pa dang / dri sna tshogs kyis legs par bsgos pa dang / kha zas dang btung ba dang ldan ba dag yod de /
analyzed: sil snyan dang / pheb rdob pa dag gi sgra snyan pa sgrogs pa dang / dri sna tshogs kyis legs par bsgos pa dang / kha zas dang btung ba dang ldan ba dag yod de /
translated: The sounds of musical instruments and songs resound, and the place is perfumed with various fragrances and filled with food and drink.

original: de na lha'i bu nyi ma 'khor dang bcas pa rtse zhing dga' la dga' dgur spyod de /
analyzed: de na lha'i bu nyi ma 'khor dang bcas pa rtse zhing dga' la dga' dgur spyod de /
translated: The gods and their retinues play, enjoy themselves, and indulge in pleasures.

original: rang gi las kyi 'bras bu nyams su myong ngo //
analyzed: rang gi las kyi 'bras bu nyams su myong ngo //
translated: They experience the results of their own actions.

original: skar ma'i gzugs rnams kyi tshad ni ji tsam zhe na /
analyzed: skar ma'i gzugs rnams kyi tshad ni ji tsam zhe na /
translated: What is the size of the stars?

original: smras pa / skar ma'i gzugs rnams la thams cad kyi nang na che ba gang yin pa de ni rgyang grangs bco brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / skar ma'i gzugs rnams la thams cad kyi nang na che ba gang yin pa de ni rgyang grangs bco brgyad pa'o //
translated: The largest of the stars is eighteen krośas.

original: thams cad kyi nang na chung pa gang yin pa de dag ni rgyang grags gsum mo //
analyzed: thams cad kyi nang na chung pa gang yin pa de dag ni rgyang grags gsum mo //
translated: The smallest is three krośas.

original: phal cher ni rgyang grags bcu dang bcu gnyis pa yin te /
analyzed: phal cher ni rgyang grags bcu dang bcu gnyis pa yin te /
translated: Most are ten or twelve krośas.

original: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa shel las grub pa ste /
analyzed: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa shel las grub pa ste /
translated: They are well-shaped, beautiful, and lovely, and are made of crystal.

original: gser gyi ra bas kun nas bskor to //
analyzed: gser gyi ra bas kun nas bskor to //
translated: They are surrounded by a golden fence.

original: ra ba de la rtsig skyabs gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa @44a * //
analyzed: ra ba de la rtsig skyabs gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa @44a * //
translated: The walls of the city are protected by four layers of ramparts made of gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.

original: dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnam pa bzhi dang / mda' yab dang / ltad mo lta ba'i sa rnam pa bzhi yod do //
analyzed: dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa rnam pa bzhi dang / mda' yab dang / ltad mo lta ba'i sa rnam pa bzhi yod do //
translated: There are four terraces for viewing spectacles,

original: de'i nang gis gzhi yang dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes par bris shing legs par bris pa tshon sna brgya rtsa gcig gis bris te /🔽'jam zhing shin tu 'jam pa ni dper na shing bal gyi 'dab ma 'am /
analyzed: de'i nang gis gzhi yang dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes par bris shing legs par bris pa tshon sna brgya rtsa gcig gis bris te / 'jam zhing shin tu 'jam pa ni dper na shing bal gyi 'dab ma 'am /
translated: and the ground inside is well-shaped, beautiful, and attractive. It is painted with a hundred and one colors,🔽smooth and soft, like a tuft of cotton wool

original: ras bal gyi 'dab ma bzhin te /🔽rkang pa bzhag na ni nems zhes byed /
analyzed: ras bal gyi 'dab ma bzhin te / rkang pa bzhag na ni nems zhes byed /
translated: or a fleecy cloud.

original: rkang pa bteg na ni par zhes byed la /
analyzed: rkang pa bteg na ni par zhes byed la /
translated: When one places one’s foot on it, it sinks in and then bounces back up.

original: me tog man da ra ba dag gis pus mo nub pa tsam du khebs te /🔽rlung gi mthus me tog rnying pa rnams ni 'thor /
analyzed: me tog man da ra ba dag gis pus mo nub pa tsam du khebs te / rlung gi mthus me tog rnying pa rnams ni 'thor /
translated: It is covered with mandārava flowers up to the knees.🔽The force of the wind blows away the old flowers and scatters new ones,

original: me tog gsar pa rnams ni legs par 'grems te 'di skad du /
analyzed: me tog gsar pa rnams ni legs par 'grems te 'di skad du /
translated: saying:🔽“Welcome, welcome!”

original: lha rnams bsod nams dbang gi rkyen gyis na //🔽gzhal med khang mchog dag na rlung chen ldang // me tog rnying pa rnams ni 'thor bar byed //
analyzed: lha rnams bsod nams dbang gi rkyen gyis na // gzhal med khang mchog dag na rlung chen ldang // me tog rnying pa rnams ni 'thor bar byed //
translated: Due to the power of the gods' merit,🔽in the excellent celestial palaces, a great wind arises🔽that scatters the old flowers

original: me tog gsar pa rnams ni legs par 'grems //🔽zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: me tog gsar pa rnams ni legs par 'grems // zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: and spreads out the new ones.

original: de dag gi nang na rdzing bu byas pa dag yod de /
analyzed: de dag gi nang na rdzing bu byas pa dag yod de /
translated: In the middle of those, there are man-made ponds.

original: rdzing bu de dag kyang gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa'i pha gu rnam pa bzhis brtsigs so //
analyzed: rdzing bu de dag kyang gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa'i pha gu rnam pa bzhis brtsigs so //
translated: Those ponds are surrounded by railings made of four types of materials: gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.

original: rdzing bu de dag gi phyogs bzhin yang them skas byas pa dag yod de /
analyzed: rdzing bu de dag gi phyogs bzhin yang them skas byas pa dag yod de /
translated: In the four directions of those ponds, there are stairs.

original: them skas de dag kyang gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa'i pha gu rnam pa bzhis brtsigs so //
analyzed: them skas de dag kyang gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa'i pha gu rnam pa bzhis brtsigs so //
translated: Those stairs are also surrounded by railings made of four types of materials: gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.

original: rdzing bu de dag kyang gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa'i lan kan rnam pa bzhis kun nas bskor te /
analyzed: rdzing bu de dag kyang gser las byas pa dang / dngul las byas pa dang / bee d'urya las byas pa dang / shel las byas pa'i lan kan rnam pa bzhis kun nas bskor te /
translated: Those ponds are surrounded by four types of railings made of gold, silver, beryl, and crystal.

original: gser gyi lan kan gyi gtan ma dang / gdang bu dang / gzungs gzer ni dngul las byas so //
analyzed: gser gyi lan kan gyi gtan ma dang / gdang bu dang / gzungs gzer ni dngul las byas so //
translated: The posts, railings, and crossbeams of the golden railings are made of silver.

original: dngul gyi ni gser las byas so //
analyzed: dngul gyi ni gser las byas so //
translated: Those of the silver railings are made of gold.

original: bee d'urya'i ni shel las byas so //
