analyzed: bee d'urya'i ni shel las byas so //
translated: Those of the beryl railings are made of crystal.

original: shel gyi gtan ma dang / gdang bu dang / gzungs gzer ni bee d'urya las byas te /
analyzed: shel gyi gtan ma dang / gdang bu dang / gzungs gzer ni bee d'urya las byas te /
translated: The posts, railings, and crossbeams of the crystal railings are made of beryl.

original: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa /
analyzed: dbyibs legs shing blta na sdug la mdzes pa /
translated: They are well-proportioned, beautiful, and attractive.

original: chu bsil ba dang / chu sbrang rtsi lta bus gang ba ste /
analyzed: chu bsil ba dang / chu sbrang rtsi lta bus gang ba ste /
translated: They are filled with cool water and water that tastes like honey.

original: me tog autpa la dang / padma dang / ku mu dang / padma dkar pos yongs su khebs shing /
analyzed: me tog autpa la dang / padma dang / ku mu dang / padma dkar pos yongs su khebs shing /
translated: They are covered with utpala, padma, kumuda, and puṇḍarīka flowers.

original: chu nas skyes pa'i bya sna tshogs skad snyan cing 'jebs pa @44b dang ; skad yid du 'ong ba dang / skad snyan pa dang / 'dod dgur sgyur ba'i gzugs can rnams skad snyan pa 'byin to //
analyzed: chu nas skyes pa'i bya sna tshogs skad snyan cing 'jebs pa @44b dang ; skad yid du 'ong ba dang / skad snyan pa dang / 'dod dgur sgyur ba'i gzugs can rnams skad snyan pa 'byin to //
translated: Various birds born in the water sing melodious, delightful, and pleasant songs, and they have the ability to transform their forms at will.

original: de dag gi nye 'khor na me tog gi shing dang 'bras bu'i shing sna tshogs yod pa rnams legs par skyes shing dbyibs legs pa yongs su grub pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi nye 'khor na me tog gi shing dang 'bras bu'i shing sna tshogs yod pa rnams legs par skyes shing dbyibs legs pa yongs su grub pa ste /
translated: In their vicinity are various flowering trees and fruit trees that grow well, have excellent shapes, and are fully developed.

original: me tog phreng bar bkod pa bzhin du gyur pa ni dper na me tog phreng rgyud dam /
analyzed: me tog phreng bar bkod pa bzhin du gyur pa ni dper na me tog phreng rgyud dam /
translated: They are like flower garlands, for example, like a garland of flowers

original: me tog phreng rgyud kyi slob ma mkhas pas me tog gi phreng ba tha gu la brgyus pa dang / me tog gi rna rgyan legs par byas pa 'byin te /
analyzed: me tog phreng rgyud kyi slob ma mkhas pas me tog gi phreng ba tha gu la brgyus pa dang / me tog gi rna rgyan legs par byas pa 'byin te /
translated: or a skilled garland maker who strings flowers on a thread and makes a beautiful flower earring.

original: thang las skyes pa'i bya sna tshogs skad snyan cing 'jebs pa dang / skad yid du 'ong ba dang / skad snyan pa dang / 'dod dgur sgyur ba'i gzugs can rnams skad snyan pa 'byin to //
analyzed: thang las skyes pa'i bya sna tshogs skad snyan cing 'jebs pa dang / skad yid du 'ong ba dang / skad snyan pa dang / 'dod dgur sgyur ba'i gzugs can rnams skad snyan pa 'byin to //
translated: The birds that live on the ground sing in a pleasant way, with a pleasant voice, a sweet voice, and a voice that can take on any form at will.

original: dpag bsam gyi shing sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: dpag bsam gyi shing sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The wish fulfilling trees are of four types: blue, yellow, red, and white.

original: rgyas par snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyas par snga ma bzhin no //
translated: They are described in the same way as above.

original: de dag na gzhal med khang na gnas pa'i lha'i bu rnams rtse zhing dga' la dga' dgur spyod de /
analyzed: de dag na gzhal med khang na gnas pa'i lha'i bu rnams rtse zhing dga' la dga' dgur spyod de /
translated: The gods who live in the palaces on these trees play, enjoy themselves, and indulge in pleasures.

original: rang gi las kyi 'bras bu nyams su myong ngo //
analyzed: rang gi las kyi 'bras bu nyams su myong ngo //
translated: They experience the results of their own actions.

original: nyi mas zla ba drug tu bgrod pa gang yin pa de ni zla bas zla ba gcig la 'gro ba dang 'ong bar byed do //
analyzed: nyi mas zla ba drug tu bgrod pa gang yin pa de ni zla bas zla ba gcig la 'gro ba dang 'ong bar byed do //
translated: The sun travels for six months in the northern direction and for six months in the southern direction.

original: ci'i phyir nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la bltas na mig la gnod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la bltas na mig la gnod par 'gyur la /
translated: Why is it that the sun is harmful to the eyes when it is seen,

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la bltas na ni mig la gnod par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la bltas na ni mig la gnod par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: but the moon is not harmful to the eyes when it is seen?

original: smras pa / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni chu shel yang yin zhing /
analyzed: smras pa / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni chu shel yang yin zhing /
translated: He replied: The moon is a water crystal,

original: shel dang ba yang yin la /
analyzed: shel dang ba yang yin la /
translated: and it is clear crystal.

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ni me shel yin pas de'i phyir na nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la bltas na ni mig la gnod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ni me shel yin pas de'i phyir na nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la bltas na ni mig la gnod par 'gyur la /
translated: The sun is a fire crystal, and therefore if you look at the sun, it harms the eyes.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la bltas na ni gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la bltas na ni gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you look at the moon, it does not harm the eyes.

original: 'jig rten gzhag pa las tshigs dgu pa'o /
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhag pa las tshigs dgu pa'o /
translated: This is the ninth chapter, on the world, in the Treatise on the Middle Way.

original: // / mdo la /
analyzed: // / mdo la /
translated: In the sutra it says:🔽Those who perceive the great elements

original: 'byung ba chen por 'du shes dang // bdag tu yang ni 'du shes pa //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen por 'du shes dang // bdag tu yang ni 'du shes pa //
translated: and also perceive a self,

original: nam mkha' la ni sar 'du shes //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni sar 'du shes //
translated: perceive space as earth.🔽Time is made into two,

original: dus ni gnyis su byas pa dang // skad cig pa ni tha ma yin //
analyzed: dus ni gnyis su byas pa dang // skad cig pa ni tha ma yin //
translated: and the last is momentary.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / sems can sa la sar 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi ni sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / sems can sa la sar 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
translated: There are sentient beings who perceive the four great elements—the earth element, the water element, the fire element, and the wind element—as earth.

original: chur 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: chur 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
translated: There are those who perceive them as water.

original: mer 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: mer 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
translated: There are those who perceive them as fire.

original: rlung du 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: rlung du 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
translated: There are those who perceive wind as earth.

original: sems can chu la sar 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /🔽chur 'du shes @45a * //🔽pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: sems can chu la sar 'du shes pa dag kyang yod / chur 'du shes @45a * // pa dag kyang yod /
translated: There are sentient beings who perceive water as earth.🔽There are those who perceive water as water.

original: mer 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: mer 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
translated: There are those who perceive water as fire.

original: rlung du 'du shes pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: rlung du 'du shes pa dag kyang yod do //

original: sems can me la sar 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: sems can me la sar 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
translated: There are sentient beings who perceive fire as earth.

original: chur 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /🔽mer 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: chur 'du shes pa dag kyang yod / mer 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
translated: There are those who perceive fire as water.🔽There are those who perceive fire as fire.

analyzed: rlung du 'du shes pa dang kyang yod do // sems can rlung la sar 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /

original: chur 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /🔽mer 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: chur 'du shes pa dag kyang yod / mer 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /

original: rlung du 'du shes pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: rlung du 'du shes pa dag kyang yod do //

original: sems can sa la bdag tu 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: sems can sa la bdag tu 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /

original: chur 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /🔽mer 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
analyzed: chur 'du shes pa dag kyang yod / mer 'du shes pa dag kyang yod /
translated: There are those who perceive earth as water.🔽There are those who perceive earth as fire.

analyzed: rlung du 'du shes pa dag kyang yod do //
